loans.name: Gulshod

texts.en:
Gulshod lives in North Tajikistan. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Gulshod also has been busy with farming. They grow cotton and onions. Gulshod has been busy with this business more than 10 years. She has a great experience in this field and knows her business well. 

From the business profit, Gulshod buys food items and clothes for her family. They live poorly as the family income is only from farming. 

Gulshod is asking for a loan of 7,500 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 49-year-old married woman. She and her husband are involved in the business of furniture making. They have been doing it together for many years. Over time they have become famous for providing good quality furniture in their community. 

Safia is a responsible mother of 10 children and is liable to provide them with basic necessities of life.

In order to purchase good quality wood with packs of polish and nails in larger quantity, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf foundation. In this way they would be able to cater to more customers without delay, which ultimately helps in bringing more cash. 

Safia wants to provide a bright and prosperous future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood with packs of polish and nails in larger quantity .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her restaurant and purchase modern utensils.

loans.name: Faraja Emmanuel

texts.en:
Faraja is 26 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Kilolo District, Tanzania. 

Faraja volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide by helping students in a program to learn life skills designed to increase their academic performance. 

Other than this, Faraja has a retail shop in her home. She sells food products like rice, beans and soda. 

She is requesting a Kiva loan to increase her shop’s grocery stock. Faraja will use the profits she will earn to support her family with meals and health care as well as pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to expand her shop with variety of groceries so that she can support her family with meals, health care and school fees.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: José tiene 29 años de edad, y junto a su esposa luchan por sacar adelante a sus dos hijos de 19 y 11 años de edad. José trabaja como empelado en una institución cercana a su localidad y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. José desea reconstruir una pared y el techo de su vivienda dado que con el tiempo se han deteriorado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de polines, lámina, cemento, arena y ladrillo para dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
José is 29 years old and along with his wife they fight to support their children, ages 19 and 11. José works as an employee in a nearby institution of his town, and that is how he’s able to provide for his family. 

José wants to rebuild a wall and the roof of his house since they have deteriorated over time. That is the reason why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI, to invest in the purchase of poles, galvanized sheet, cement, sand and bricks to star improving his house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: poles, galvanized sheet, cement, sand and bricks to build the roof and a wall of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by buying varieties of drinks for her shop.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Nueva Vida lo integran tres mujeres emprendedoras, coordinado por la señora María Rebeca de 32 años de edad, acompañada, y quien se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras en el mercado de su municipalidad desde hace siete años, es el décimo noveno ciclo que ADIM le brinda los financiamiento para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una mujer responsable, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de naranja, ya que es una de las temporadas que mayor demanda tiene este producto, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado superarse económicamente porque ha logrado compra al por mayor y comercializar a detalle, por lo que los ingresos percibidos han sido mayores. El resto de las integrantes son la señora Flor de 44 años, que se dedica a la compra-venta de frutas, en las calles de su localidad, y por último María Auxiliadora de 30 años de edad comerciante de gallinas en el departamento de León desde hace diez años.
texts.en:
The Nueva Vida communal bank is made up of three enterprising women.  María Rebeca is the coordinator. She is 32 years old, and she is in a relationship. 

She has been selling fruits and vegetables in the municipal market for seven years. It is the nineteenth cycle in which ADIM is providing her with loans for her business.  She has shown herself to be a responsible woman.  The loan she is requesting is to buy the orange harvest.  This is because it is one of the seasons when there is greater demand for this product.  

With the previous loans she managed to improve herself financially because she has managed to buy in bulk and sell by the item.  Therefore, her earnings have been greater.

Flor de Maria, 44 years old, is another member. She sells fruit on the streets in her area.

Maria Auxiliadora, age 30, for has been selling chickens in the León department for ten years.

loans.use: to buy the orange harvest.

loans.name: Bhagabati's Group

texts.en:
On 14th Oct., 2014, 11 women from the village of Sudhimunda of Sambalpur district of Odisha state came together to form a self-help group. Formation of this group was initiated by Bhagabati, who also is the president of this group. The group applied for a loan of 165,000 INR or 15,000 INR per member for 11 members. 

Bhagabati has currently a dairy farm with one cow. She is milking almost eight to ten litres of milk every day. She sells six litres to the local milk federation and the rest milk she keeps for her family's consumption. 

Bhagabati's husband and two children share responsibility for looking after the cow. She has kept aside some amount to take care of feeding and veterinary expenses. Knowing that she can request second and third cycle loans for expanding her business, she has started working twice as hard to turn her business into a profitable venture. 

With her own portion of the loan amount, Bhagabati will buy another cow. 

With her efforts, she might become the much needed source of motivation for other women in her village. She hopes to increase her milk production by adding a new cow in her dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy a new cow for milk production and selling.

loans.name: Nhóm 02, Cẩm Bào, Vạn Hòa Group

texts.en:
Tươi is 29 years old and married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 02, Cẩm Bào, Vạn Hòa solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

Tươi works in agriculture raising poultry, and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.
 
In 2013, Tươi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid 2 loans already from them. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

With her business profit, Tươi hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. Faiza lives with her husband in Kilolo district. 

She is a Camfed learner guide who volunteers in her nearby secondary school teaching life skills knowledge to students so they can improve their performance and attend school regularly. 

Faiza fights poverty in her community as a young lady. She has engaged herself with a market stall, selling onions and tomatoes. Faiza uses her profit to increase her products and pay school fees for her children. 

Faiza is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business by purchasing more products apart from the tomatoes and onions in her shop.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more products for her shop.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Maqsood is a 59-year-old widow. She is a mother of four children. 

She has been doing a business of cattle sale and purchase for many years. Maqsood looks after the cattle and sells them in different markets. Her business provides her enough to meet day-to-day expenses. 

Now she needs to earn much more for the betterment of her children. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle, including baby goats and calves, etc. for resale purposes. 

She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle including baby goats and calves, etc. for resale purposes.

loans.name: Waone

texts.en:
Waone is 25 years old. She lives with her mother and her four younger sisters in Kilolo district. 

Waone is the breadwinner of the family, She is also a Camfed learner guide, teaching students life skills education to help them improve their performance and attendance. 

Apart from volunteering at school, Waone engages herself in small-scale farming near her village. 

She requests a Kiva loan to rent a store along the road near her home to open a clothing business. Waone plans to use the profit she will earn to buy more stock in bulk and pay school fees for her young sisters.

loans.use: to rent a store along the road near her home to open a clothing business.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 41 years old and married. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the family's needs. Therefore she started her own business to contribute to the family income. She has been doing a business selling bed sheets for many years. After purchasing a variety of cloth material from the market, she stitches and then sells the items to the people of her community at a profit. 

Currently, Asia has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy the latest variety of cloth in different colors along with a new stitching machine. This will help her to increase her sales and provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of cloth in different colors along with a new stitching machine.

loans.name: Argelia De Jesus

texts.es: Argelia de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la variedad de productos, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Argelia is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She has had a small store located in her place of residence for 15 years. She has a lot of clients due to her good prices and variety of products. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. Then she will have more income for a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to build walls in her house

loans.name: Las Sonrientes Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario las sonrientes lo integran cuatro mujeres exitosas en su vida laboral, quien lo coordina es la señora Xiomara de 42 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos, dependiendo económicamente de ella dos, se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos, ropa interior y calzado en su domicilio y ambulante, comenzó este negocio hace diecisiete años, y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de perfumes para damas y caballeros, gel, crema corporal, blúmer, bóxer, tobilleras, brazier, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado diversificar los productos ofrecidos, ya que antes solo comercializaba la línea de cosméticos. A este grupo también lo integra Tanya una joven de 25 años de edad que comercializa cosméticos, ropa de segunda y frijoles crudos desde hace cinco años, Nohelia una joven de 23 años de edad quien comercializa ropa y calzado en las calles de su comunidad desde hace más de un año, y Betty una joven mujer de 24 años de edad comerciante de prendas de plata, cobre y bisutería desde hace dos años en su comunidad.
texts.en:
The Las Sonrientes comunal bank is comprised of four women who are successful in their work lives.  Xiomara, age 42 is the coordinator.  She is married and has two children who are financially dependent upon her.  She sells cosmetics, underwear, and shoes at her house and in an itinerant manner.  She started this business 17 years ago.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy perfume for women and men, gel, body cream, panties, boxers, anklets, and bras, etc.   With the previous loans she has managed to diversify the products that she sells because she previously only sold the cosmetics line.

Tanya, age 25, is also a member of the group.  She has been selling cosmetics, second-hand clothes, and raw beans for five years.  Nohelia, age 23, has been selling clothes and shoes on the streets of the community for over a year.  Betty, age 24, has been selling silver and copper  items and costume jewelry in her community for two years.

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business of selling fried fish near her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, assorted jams, molds, etc.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina de 46 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal, ella vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar y esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas ya que le ha ido bien estos ultimos meses y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: Reina is 46 years old and works selling clothing, Her business is located in the municipal market. She lives in her own house with her family and is requesting a new loan to buy more clothing wholesale. Then she can continue with her sales as things have been going well in the last months and she will be able to have more income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Fidel Angel

texts.es: Fidel tiene 26 años de edad y habita ne casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 13 años, 8 años y un años de edad. Fidel trabaja como carpintero lo cual lo permite ganarse el sustento diario.Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y muchas personas lo prefieren por su responsabilidad y por los buenos acabados de sus productos. Con el desea de mejorar sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este  crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio de carpintería. Desea comprar materiales de trabajo como: madera, clavos, pintura, herramientas, etc. espera poder contar con este crédito y así continuar llevando sus productos a más clientes y al mismo tiempo mantener sus ingresos para dar a su familia mejor condición  de vida.
texts.en:
Fidel is 26 years old. He lives with his life partner and three children aged 13, 8 and 1 in a house of their own. He is a carpenter; this is how he earns a living. This business is his main source of income and many people prefer his services because he is responsible and his products are of good quality.

He wants to improve his income, so he has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in his business. He wants to buy materials like wood, nails, paint, and tools. He hopes to receive this loan in order to sell his products to more customers and keep a good level of income so that he can improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, paint, tools, etc. for his carpenter's shop.

loans.name: Nhóm 09 - Thôntrung 08- Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lân operates a food stall, selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.
Lân is 37 years old, and she is married and has two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 09 - ThônTrung 08- Quảng Nham solidarity group, which is comprised of five members. 
In 2007, Lân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lân faces in her business is the lack of capital.
With her business profit, Lân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel and re-bar to build a room on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase her capital and purchase a large amount of fish to sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Catalina  Del Carmen

texts.es: Catalina de 58 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tamales de elote desde hace 13 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, Catalina  vive en casa propia con su hijo y su compañero de vida, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de elotes por mayor, azúcar y leche para continuar con la elaboración de los alimentos y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Catalina is 58 years old and has been working selling corn tamales for 13 years. Her business is located in her place of residence. Catalina lives in her own house with her son and her life companion. She is requesting a loan to buy corn wholesale, sugar and milk to continue making her foods and in this way generate more income.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and sugar and milk.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariumu is 20 years old and lives with her brother in the Handeni District of Tanzania. She is a Camfed Learner Guide at a local secondary school where she helps students learn life skills in order to boost their attendance and performance in school. 

Mariamu aspires to run a business selling soft drinks. She is requesting a Kiva loan to establish this business by purchasing stock and buying a cooler so can she can sell cold drinks.

loans.use: to establish a business by purchasing stock and buying a cooler so can she can sell cold drinks.

loans.name: Wendy Gertrudis

texts.es: Wendy de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 5 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Wendy is 30 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She has been working selling tortillas for 5 years. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has lots of clients, mainly her neighbors. She is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime so that she can continue with making tortillas and generate more income to have a better quality of living.

loans.use: to by corn by the quintal and lime.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron so that he can build a bathroom and repair the kitchen of his home.

loans.name: Vilma Bernarda

texts.es: Vilma de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 2 años, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
Vilma is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their 2 children. She has worked selling clothes for 2 years, and sells them as a street vendor in different areas. 

She is asking for a loan to buy clothing wholesale to be able to continue with her sales and thereby have greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is highly skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for the last 6 years. She makes beautiful patterns with her hands. Her designs are much in demand and she is known throughout the town.

To continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones, etc. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers. Saeeda dreams of providing a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones, etc.

loans.name: Shahzadan

texts.en:
Shahzadan is a 56-year-old married woman who is in the business of cattle buying and selling.  She has been doing this for many years with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo). She looks after the cattle while her husband sells them in different markets. Their business has provided their family with a decent life. 

Shahzadan is a mother of 4 children and is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life of good education, food and clothing. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase more animals including baby goats and calves in order to boost their earnings. 

She is hopeful that their business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more animals including baby goats and calves in order to boost their earnings.

loans.name: Tural

texts.en:
Tural is a taxi driver. He is 25 years old. He is married and a while ago his child was born. His daughter is 6 months old and she is very cute. Tural's family lives in the Baki region. Taxi driving is Tural's first business.

He needs 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he will change the wheels on his car. Tural says thanks to the Kiva organization and to all the lenders for this loan. In the future he wants to give a good education to his child and to increase business.

loans.use: to change wheels, increase business, in future he wants to give a good education to his child.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her restaurant by increasing hot pots, plates and glass

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 23 years old and lives in the Kilosa District of Tanzania. She is married and a mother of three children. She lives with her children and other relatives who depend on her to provide for household expenses. She volunteers at a local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide, helping students understand life skills in order to boost their academic performance. 

In addition to this, she has a small shop for selling a variety of household products. She is requesting a Kiva loan to improve her business by purchasing commodities in bulk and selling them retail. She plans to use the profits to improve her standard of living. Her dream is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing commodities in bulk and selling them retail

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 23 years old and lives with her brother. She is a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering in her nearby secondary school encouraging students to concentrate on their studies. She also teaches life skills. 

Grace operates a business selling drinks in her grocery. She uses her profits to expand her grocery and provide household expenses for herself and her brother. Grace requested a loan, which she will use to buy drinks in bulk and improve her grocery surroundings. Grace expects to use the profits  to send her younger brother to vocational training to learn driving skills so they can help each other and increase the products in her grocery.

loans.use: to purchase drinks in bulk and improve her grocery surroundings

loans.name: Maa Maheswari Shg Group

texts.en:
The members of Maa Maheswari Self Help Group are all women from the Anugul district in Odisha, where the Peoples Forum branch in located. Peoples Forum has brought in the habit of saving among the women, as the members are involved in various activities, such as agriculture, dairy, animal husbandry, poultry farming, etc. These women, with the help of their husbands, not only support their families but also set examples for other women in the village — that women can save money, run the house and become entrepreneurs. 

Kamala is involved in a dairy business along with her husband, and tells the story of her initial days of business hardships. Nevertheless, her living conditions have relatively improved, as stated by her. She dreams of educating her two children and making them pursue higher education. She hopes with the course of time she will renovate her house and living standards. She will use her portion to buy a cow for milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy a cow for milk to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 26 years old. She is married and a mother of one child. She lives with her husband in the Handeni district. Mariam is a Camfed learner guide who volunteers herself in facilitating life skills to students once per week, helping them to identify the importance of their being at school. 

She has a grocery business selling coconut and tomatoes. The profit she obtains is used to pay household expenses, school fees for her child and to help providing food for her parents. 

Mariam requests a Kiva loan to expand her business by widening the space of her shop so that she can buy more products like many coconuts and tomatoes. The profit will help her buy land and expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by widening the space of her shop and to buy more products like many coconuts and tomatoes.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina, aged 32 years, lives in the Bagamoyo district. She is married and has two children. Paulina is a Camfed Learner guide who teaches life skills in a secondary school in her ward by insisting that students study hard. 

She deals with tailoring women's clothes in her village. Paulina requested a Kiva loan to expand her business with her tailored products. She will use her profit to pay household expenses.

loans.use: to expand her business with her tailored products.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija, aged 23, is not married.  She is the mother of one child. Hadija lives with her mother and siblings. 

She has a shop which contains a variety of cosmetics commodities. Her family depends on her to pay household expenses from the profit she obtains from her shop. She requests a loan from Kiva to increase the capital in her shop and employ one person to help in her shop.

She volunteers as a Camfed learner guide in her nearby ward secondary school, helping students to understand life skills within and out of school to improve their performance.   

With the increased profit, Hadija plans to buy products in bulk and sell to both retail and wholesale consumers.

loans.use: to increase the capital in her shop and employ one support person in her shop

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of 3 children. 

She provides a stitching facility in her community. She gets a lot of appreciation from her customers. She accepted the fact that if only her husband worked for their family, they would not be able to meet all the expenses including the household and the educational needs of their children. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, zippers and lace in various colors to consistently meet the increasing demand. 

She is hopeful that her stitching business will provide her with a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, zippers and lace in various colors to consistently meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 58 years old and a married woman. She has two children. After her marriage, she decided to support her family; therefore, she started her own business of cloth trade. She is successfully running her business in her community. She purchases different types of cloth from the market and sells them in her community. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle. She has excellent repayment behavior and counts on a good client list. Now she has requested the loan amount of 50,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation to purchase more variety of cloth in different colors and styles to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of cloth in different colors and styles to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 44-years-old married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has successfully run a small general store in his community for 7 years. He offers various goods for daily use. Sughran is a mother of 5 children. Therefore she wants to grow her husband's business to generate more income for the betterment of her children. 

She requested a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband to buy more stock including packs of biscuits, sugar, oil, salt, rice, beverages, etc. Her husband then would be able to cater to more customers and earn more for his family. He wishes to utilize part of the revenues to increase his business capital.

loans.use: to buy more stock including packs of biscuits, sugar, oil, salt, rice, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Mirian Antonia

texts.es: Mirian de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella posee un negocio de fotocopias desde hace 14 años y esta ubicada en el centro escolar que está cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de resmas de papel bond y tintas de colores todo por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Mirian, 54, has a house where she and her daughter now live.  She has operated a copying services business at a nearby school for 14 years.  She supports herself and her daughter with earnings from the business.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy bulk supplies of copier paper and printer cartridges so that she can carry on the business.  The business is her sole source of income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her copying services business.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 23-years-old married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has sold used clothes for the period of about 8 years. He buys a variety of  ladies and gentlemen's garments from the wholesale market and then sells in their locality at a profit. He has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through his business. 

In order to increase the selection of dresses for targeting more customers to boost earnings, Nazia has availed Murabaha of 20,000 PKR for her husband. Nazia dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to increase the selection of dresses for targeting more customers to boost earnings.

loans.name: Shani

texts.en:
Shani is 26 years old and she is not married. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers in her nearby secondary school, discussing with students their understanding of well-being. 

She deals with cultivating tomatoes and selling them at wholesale as well as at retail to people near her village. Shani uses her profit to help herself with household expenses and to buy an irrigation pump for irrigating the tomato plants. 

Shani is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business. She plans to rent a frame for a stall for selling her tomatoes. She will use the profit to employ someone to help her in irrigating the tomatoes, to buy a bigger pump machine near her farm, and to pay for her daily needs.

loans.use: to expand her business by renting a frame for a stall for selling her tomatoes.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is 28 years old. She is not married. She has one child. She lives in the Bagamoyo district in Tanzania. As a way of giving back to her community, Zena is a Camfed Learner guide, helping students understand life skills that will help them to improve their performance and reduce school dropouts. 

She is a women's clothing seller in her community. Zena uses her profit to pay her child's school fees and to cover household expenses for her family. 

Zena is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business by purchasing varieties of women's clothing, which will enable her to make more profit. She plans to use the profit obtained from the loan to pay rent fees for her shop and to pay her daily household expenses.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing varieties of women's clothing, which will enable her to make more profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, laminate and wood to expand his house.

loans.name: Josselin Nohemy

texts.es: Josselin tiene 20 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus padres, hermano e hija de 8 meses de edad. Josselin se gana la vida por medio de la venta de platillos típicos, tiene muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más dado que siempre ofrece calidad y buenos precios. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: elotes, maíz, frijoles, yuca, verduras, etc. para la elaboración de los ricos platillo típicos y poder así mejorar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en: Josselin, 20, lives in a house with her parents and siblings.  She operates a business making and selling meals that are traditionally popular here.  She has many regular customers who value her business because her meals are tasty and fairly-priced.  Josselin is applying to FUSAI for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs--maize, beans, yucca, vegetables, etc.--to carry on her business.  The investment will support her efforts to increase her income and move ahead in the world.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her prepared food sales business.

loans.name: Reina Admit

texts.es:
Reina, con el financiamiento anterior ha mantenido surtido el negocio de la materia prima para elaborar la venta de tamales de elote y de gallina, de esta manera ha tenido los ingresos necesarios para cubrir costos de medicinas para mejorar la salud familiar y cambiar su alimentación.
Por las múltiples dificultades que ha enfrentado se encuentra sin capital para seguir trabajando, por tal motivo se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar gallinas, elotes, maíz, verduras, condimentos, etc., así continuara elaborando los tamales que tanto gustan a sus clientes.
texts.en: Reina used past loans to buy supplies for making the chicken tamales that she sells.  Her earnings cover the costs of the medicines and the change of diet that her family has needed for good health.  Reina has faced many difficulties that have left her without funds for carrying on her business and, consequently, she is applying for a new loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs--chicken, maize, vegetables, condiments, etc.--to carry on her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her prepared food sales business.

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirian, vive con sus hijos, hermanos y nietos, la familia vive en una misma casa, por la responsabilidad de proveer a su familia de lo primordial para tener un mejor estilo de vida, hace 15 años instalo una mini tienda de productos para uso doméstico, con su esmero ha ido incorporando nueva mercadería para ampliar su mercado, trabaja en un horario de 7:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m., hasta la fecha no representa dificultades.  
Invertirá en golosinas, pan, bebidas, sobres de café instantáneos, gel para cabello, etc., le permitirá surtir mejor su negocio para mejorar las ventas y obtener nuevas ganancias, con las que pagara su deuda y cubrirá los gastos de su hogar.
Su visión es lograr tener un negocio más grande, trabajar con capital propio y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mirian lives with her children, siblings, and grandchildren; the family lives in one house. With the responsibility of providing the family with the essentials to have a better lifestyle, 15 years ago she installed a small general store of household goods, with her care it has slowly included new merchandise to expand the market. She works from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm, and to date she hasn't had any problems.

She will invest in candies, bread, drinks, instant flavored coffee, hair gel, etc. It will allow her to stock her business better to increase her sales and her vision is to manage to have a larger business, work with her own capital and remodel her house.

loans.use: to invest in sweets, bread, drinks, instant flavored coffee, hair gel, etc., it will allow her to stock her business better.

loans.name: Melida

texts.es:
Melida, tiene su venta de hot dog y refrescos muy activa con la buena inversión del préstamo anterior, sus ingresos están mejorando, le sirven para cancelar sus deudas y costear los gastos de su hogar.
Como una herramienta para tener recursos económicos de inmediato para mejorar su negocio, opta por un nuevo préstamo con el que podrá comprar aderezos, tomates, repollo, embutidos, pan, bebidas envasadas, azúcar y otros materiales necesarios para mantener su negocio en la preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Melida's sales of hot dogs and drinks are very active with the good investment of the previous loan. Her income has improved, it has served to pay off her debts and cover the household expenses.

With a tool to have economic resources immediately to improve her business, she decided to go for another loan with which she will be able to purchase seasonings, tomatoes, cabbage, cold cuts, bread, bottled drinks, sugar and other materials necessary to maintain her business to her customers' taste.

loans.use: to purchase seasonings, tomatoes, cabbage, cold cuts, bread, bottled drinks, sugar and other materials necessary to maintain her business to her customers' taste.

loans.name: Verdiana B

texts.en: Verdiana is 21 years old and lives in Bagamoyo District, Tanzania. In her spare time, she volunteers at a secondary school where she encourages students to make their best effort in their studies and helps them face challenges in order to improve their performance and quality of life. This program also helps students understand how to use resources in their community for their benefit. Verdiana is a businesswoman who owns a clothing business. She is requesting a Kiva loan in order to increase the variety of her products to better cater to her customers. Verdiana expects to use the profits she will earn to support her family with good meals and healthcare.

loans.use: to increase the variety of products in her clothing business to cater to her customers.

loans.name: Mauren

texts.es: Mauren, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está casada, vive con el esposo y un hijo  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Mauren, 22, and her husband have one child and she says that they are her top priority.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to plant more copperwood trees.  Copperwood improves soil fertility and provides extra shade, both of which facilitate coffee production.  Mauren expects the investment to support her coffee growing business and, in turn, increase the family income.  Mauren has never borrowed from a state bank and this is her first FUDECOSUR loan.  She likes FUDECOSUR, she says, because it offers a straight-forward application process and low interest rates.

loans.use: to support her coffee planting business.

loans.name: Yeimy Arely

texts.es:
Yeimy, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para la próxima temporada navideña, invertirá en variedad de ropa para ambos sexos, como blusas, vestidos, camisas, chores, etc., surtirá su negocio para incrementar las ventas y ganancias.
El financiamiento anterior le dio la oportunidad de tener recursos económicos para mejorar el inventario de la venta de ropa, teniendo así nuevos ingresos para cancelar las deudas y cubrir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Yeimy decided to get a new loan for the upcoming Christmas season. She will invest in a variety of clothing for both sexes such as blouses, dresses, shirts, shorts, etc.; she will stock her business to increase her sales and earnings.

The previous loan gave her the opportunity to have economic resources to improve her inventory of clothing to sell, having in this way new income to pay off debts and cover family needs.

loans.use: to invest in a variety of clothing for both sexes, such as blouses, dresses, shirts, shorts, etc. she will stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to put a new roof on her house

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is 21 years old. She lives with her pensioner grandmother in the small village of Vani district. The family owns 0.75 hectare of land, where they have nut trees. Teona sells the harvested nuts locally at a good price. 

Teona decided to start a clothes trading business in order to generate a stable income. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,300 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase clothing stock and will start the trading business. 

The startup program will be a great support for Teona.

loans.use: to start a clothes trading business to generate stable income

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 22 years old and lives with her mother in the Iringa District of Tanzania. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, helping secondary school students boost their academic performance through a life skills education program called 'My Better World.' 

Francisca has a stall where she sells fruits and other small food items. She currently uses her profits to support her family with meals. 

Fransisca plans to increase her stock variety with the Kiva loan she is requesting. She also plans to save the profits she will earn in order to put herself through college in the future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fruits and other small food items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Arely

texts.es: María tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto  a su compañero de de vida y sus tres hijos de 9 años, 3 años y un año de edad. María es pequeña comerciante, se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco de forma ambulante en el mercado municipal de su localidad. María es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia y junto a su compañero de vida quien se dedica a la corta y venta de cocos mantienen la economía del hogar. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de mariscos para el negocio y poder así, dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones.
texts.en: María, 24, has a house where she lives with her husband and their three children: 9-, 3- and 1-years old, respectively.  María is a street vendor and has a small business selling fresh fish in the local market.  Her husband has a business processing and selling coconuts and together the two make enough to cover the family's everyday expenses.  María is applying for a FUSAI loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of seafood so that she can carry on her business.  The investment will ultimately allow her to better provide for her children.

loans.use: to stock her fish and seafood sales business.

loans.name: Sandra Nohemy

texts.es:
Sandra, opta por un nuevo préstamo ya que necesita invertir en el negocio de venta de bisutería, comprara donas acrílicas, perlas, alambre, dijes, etc., para seguir elaborando los diferentes accesorios, le permitirá seguir realizando sus actividades para generar ingresos.
Con ayuda de préstamos ha mejorado su negocio con mercadería del gusto de sus clientes, tiene estabilidad en sus ingresos y la familia se mantiene saludable.
texts.en:
Sandra decided to get a new loan since she needs to invest in her costume jewelry business. She will buy beads, pearls, wire, pendants, etc., to continue making her various accessories. It will allow her to continue doing her work to generate income.

With the help of loans, she has improved her business with merchandise to her customers' tastes, she has stability in her income and her family remains healthy.

loans.use: she will purchase beads, pearls, wire, pendants, etc., to continue making her various accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and floaters for his fishing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, candies, eggs, oil, etc., for the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in rice, oil, eggs, cold cuts, dairy products, sugar, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is 36 years old and lives in Handeni District, Tanzania with her husband. As a Camfed Learner Guide, she teachs in a life-skills program for secondary school students to enable them to increase their attendance and improve their academic performance. Apart from this, Habiba has a maize business where she buys maize in bulk from farmers during the harvest season. She then stores the maize and sells it during the low season in her village to market distributors. Habiba is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a motorcycle to reduce transportation costs from the farms to her home where she stores the maize. Habiba plans to use the profits she will earn to put her children through school and provide a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to reduce transportation costs in her maize storage business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plates and glassware as well as renovate her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business, opening a clothing shop for women and children

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is  a married woman and a mother of five children. She lives with her family in Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 15 years now. 

Irene is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. This loan will help them in improving their fishing business.

In the future, Irene hopes of making their fishing venture a sustainable one. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay for the education fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others

loans.name: Ghoroub

texts.en:
Ghoroub is a 23-year-old married mother of two children who started working three years ago as a hairdresser to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Ghoroub is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her customers, as she is a sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to satisfy her family's needs. 

Today, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy special cosmetics to provide her customers with better service, and she wants to protect her children from the cold winter season by buying carpets.

Ghoroub hopes to open a small beauty salon to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy special cosmetics for her business and carpets to protect her children from the cold weather

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 49-year-old married father of five children, a Palestinian refugee who lives and runs his business from a Palestinian refugee camp since he was born.

Mahmoud works as a blacksmith; he learned this profession from his father, and is working hard on developing it. Three of his children work to support him in covering their family's increasing living needs, while two are completing their education.

His wife is a good financial supporter too, she works in providing cleaning services by working as a housekeeper to several families. Mahmoud is working hard to develop his business and reach the day where he can ask his beloved wife to rest and stop working.

That's why he is taking his first step forward, through an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to update his business tools with new released machines to make sure he can improve his business and develop his family's living.

loans.use: To update his business tools with new released machines to make sure he can improve his business and develop his family's living

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 18 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the Pangani district. Jamila volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide teaching life skills to students in a secondary school, helping students through self-learning after school hours.  

Currently Jamila has no business, but she is interested in starting to sell fish. She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy a refrigerator to store fish after purchasing them from fishermen. She plans to save the profit she will earn as a result of the loan for health services and domestic uses to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to store fish after purchasing from fishermen

loans.name: Yosam

texts.en:
Yosam is a resident of Kyenjojo,Uganda. He is 44 years old, and a father of four children. He is a hardworking man and a cattle dealer. He earns extra income from retail and motorcycle transport, commonly known as a boda boda business. His dreams are educating his children and meeting his family's needs. 

However, he is faced with the lack of enough capital to invest in his business. Yosam wants a loan to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell

loans.name: Fadhila S

texts.en:
Fadhila is a young woman from Rufiji District. She is 25 years old, and she is she married with one child. Fadhila is a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering two hours per week teaching students about life skills in a secondary school and assisting students to attend classes regularly. 

Fadhila requests a Kiva loan to start a business selling soap near her home. Fadhila will use the profits to expand her business by purchasing soap in bulk and selling as a wholesaler of soap in her community.

loans.use: to start a business selling soap near her home

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old single man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situation of Palestinians, especially those who live in camps, he started eight years ago working in supplying internet network connections.

Mohammad is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to strengthen the internet network in order to provide his customers with better and quicker service. Also, Mohammad wants to complete the building of his house. 

He hopes to expand his business more in the future by increasing the network subscription to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to strengthen his internet network and complete the building of his house

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 50-year-old married mother of two children who has been working as a tailor from her house since 1999. She is a hard worker, and well known in her region with the good reputation she has, and special talents in her domain.

Fatima supports her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs. Especially that two of her children are enrolled in a school and have education tuition fees to be paid.

Fatima's acquired loan will be invested in registering her family's car, and doing the necessary maintenance to make sure she and her husband can use it to buy necessary business needs easily from nearby villages.

She hopes that one day she can move her business outside her house and provide her beloved family the needed privacy.

loans.use: To register her family's car and do the necessary maintenance on it

loans.name: Intore Group

texts.en: Jeanne is 47 years old, married and has three children ages 19 to 25 and all in school. She is the leader of the group called Intore, which means “selected ones” in English. They sell different products and wish to expand their businesses for their better future. Jeanne sells food stuffs and has been running a business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, bananas and cassava for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, bananas and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Alba Veronica

texts.es: Alba tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 13 años, 8 años y 2 años de edad. Alba tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a la venta de ropa y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Alba y sus esposo hacen todo lo que este en en sus manos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Alba solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor variedad de ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y de esta forma poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Alba is 37, she lives in her own house with her husband and three children ages 13, 8 and 2.  Alba has been working selling clothes and this is how she earns a living and takes money to her home.  Alba and her husband do everything they can to earn a living for their home.  Alba requests a loan to FUSAI to invest in buying children's clothing, women and men. She hopes to be able to count with this financing and this way be able to give her family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy more variety of clothing for children, women and men for her business.

loans.name: Duteraninkunga Group

texts.en:
DUTERANINKUNGA is a group led by Dalila, who is 34 years old. The group name means “support each other” in English. She has been a group leader for four years. She sells clothes, and has been selling in a business for eight years. 

The group members sell different items, and they have same idea for changing their lives. 

With the loan, Dalila would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living, and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 31 years old and married with four children..A loan of 1000 SSP helps her to buy more inventory for her general store

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Pendo is 31 years old and is from Gairo District. She is married and a mother of one child. Pendo is a Camfed Leaner Guide, discussing life skills with students which will enable them to attend school regularly and improve their performances. Apart from volunteering, going to school for two and a half hours per week, Pendo runs a rice trading business at her home. She uses her earned profit to pay household expenses. 

Pendo requests a Kiva loan to renovate her shop, as well as to buy stock of rice to sell throughout the year. The profit obtained as a result of the loan will be used to build a bigger store for her business and to employ one person to run the business in her absence.

loans.use: to renovate her shop and buy stock of rice to sell throughout the year

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 33 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two currently in school. For the past six years, Samson has been working hard to manage his pharmacy, which sells drugs. 

To help expand his business, Samson has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs for sale, and will help Samson to generate greater profits and find a better school for his children. Samson hopes that in the future he will be able to add more items in the pharmacy. 

Samson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Samson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy drinks for the store.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 39 years old and lives in the town of Owijiono in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is divorced, and has four children, with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Christine has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase adult and baby clothes to sell, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and see her children in better schools. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to improve on the  business. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase adult and baby clothes to sell

loans.name: Dukore Group

texts.en: Dukore is a group led by Valentine who is 40 years old. The group name means “work hard” in English. Valentine has been a group leader for three years. She sells clothes and has been in business for five years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for improving their lives. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her family's standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 29 years old and lives in  Mundri in the Western Equatoria state region of South Sudan. A loan helps him to buy more goods to sell to his retail customers.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell to customers

loans.name: Silver

texts.en:
Silver is 37 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children, four currently in school. For the past four years, Silver has been working hard to manage his bar and lodge. 

To help expand his business, Silver has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drinks like soda and beer and other items for the accommodation business. The loan will help Silver generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Silver hopes that in the future, he will be able to become a rich man in town. 

Silver is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Silver who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks like soda and beer and other items for his business,

loans.name: Roxana Yesenia

texts.es: Roxana de 43 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de ropa su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, Roxana vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Roxana is 43 and has been selling clothing for several years, her business is located at home and has many customers.  Roxana lives at home with her husband and two children, she is requesting a loan to buy women and men's clothing at wholesale to continue with her sales and have better income.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women and men at wholesale.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 34 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past seven years, Henry has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential items like sugar, salt, and water. 

To help expand his business, Henry has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items, and will help Henry to generate greater profits and take care of his basic needs. Henry hopes that in the future he will be able to become a rich man in town. 

Henry is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Henry who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items,

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 39 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married, and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 10 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential items like sugar, salt, and water . 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and develop more on his business. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to maintain the stock. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: Maria de 37 años vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de pan dulce desde hace 5 años, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado en una zona muy transitada, con lo que ganan logra cubrir algunos gastos del hogar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas pan dulce por mayor para poder obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
María, 37, lives in her own house with her life partner and her son.

She has earned a living selling pan dulce for five years.  Her business is located in the market of a very busy area.  She's able to cover some of her household expenses with what she earns.

María's requesting another loan to buy more pan dulce wholesale so she can earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy pan dulce [sweet bread] wholesale

loans.name: Jr

texts.en:
Jr is a fisherman from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is married and has one-month-old child. Jr has been in the fishing business for more than five years now. This is the source of his income.

Jr is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. With a loan, Jr will be able to improve his fishing business thus augmenting his income.

In the future, Jr hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita has always had the enthusiasm for managing her farming activities, from which she earns a meager income, helping her husband in support of their family. At the age of 55 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family, most especially for her children's education. She never stopped pursuing her goals for the benefit of the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her farming activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for labor cost in land preparation for her crops growing project. 

In the future, Teresita wishes to buy agricultural land to expand her farming activities and venture into the agri business.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost in land preparation for her crops growing project

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a strong-willed man who pushes his ability when it comes to his poultry business. He is a hands-on businessman and father who never gets tired of supporting his family. 

Recently, he availed a loan to purchase bags of laying mash for his poultry business to sustain his chickens and double his income through more produce of eggs. 

Someday he hopes to have an expansion of his poultry farm business in a nearby municipality.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed for his poultry business

loans.name: Kinole Group

texts.en:
Zaituni, who is in her late 50s, is a widow with five children, four of them grown-up and one still in college.  She has been running two businesses, selling charcoal and a genge (grocery) business for 10 years now.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Zaituni's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start a genge business and bought sacks of charcoal. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for its support.  She used the profit to pay college fees, covered household expenses and started building her house. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the genge and to buy sacks of charcoal.  She dreams of finishing building her house.

Zaituni will share this loan with her loan group "Kinole" which consists of nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the genge (grocery business) and to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Tausala

texts.en:
Tausala is a 45-year-old, married woman with eight children. To earn a living, she runs a small bakery in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Tausala needs a loan to buy yeast, baking soda, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer, and tongs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tausala has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011.

loans.use: to buy yeast, baking soda, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer, and tongs.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en: Rabab is a 32-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three children. Her family's needs are hardly fulfilled which is why she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She badly needs the loan to purchase products for her agricultural business which she has run for the past 10 years. She states that she’s going to acquire fertilizer and seed as she seeks to increase her productivity to increase her income. Rabab believes that the loan will result in satisfying her family’s needs as well as meeting her business objectives.

loans.use: to purchase products for her agricultural business such as fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 48-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children. Fifteen years ago, she started a poultry business which she has remarkably developed over the years. Currently, due to several issues, Zeinab is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase products such as fodder. This is her first Kiva loan and Zeinab wishes to provide her family with better support.

loans.use: to purchase products needed, such as fodder

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 35 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three currently in school. For the past nine years, Elizabeth has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential items like sugar, salt and water . 

To help expand her business, Elizabeth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items and will help Elizabeth  generate greater profits and stock more items in the shop to attract more customers. Elizabeth hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a bigger supermarket. 

Elizabeth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Elizabeth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items like sugar, salt and water

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 56-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari, or retail store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This has been the source of her income for more than 20 years now. Her husband is a fisherman.

Marilou is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, soap and toiletries, soft drinks and beverages, condiments, biscuits and snack foods, and others. 

This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Marilou hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Rex

texts.en:
Rex is a fisherman from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is 40 years old, married, and has four children. Rex has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years now. 

Rex wants to improve his business, but lacks the financial resources to do so. With this, he joined CEVI and is now requesting to take a loan to buy gasoline for the fishing boat, crab nets, hooks and lead weights. With a loan, Rex will be able to increase his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Rex hopes to make his business a success and sustainable. Moreover, he wants to save money for the school expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for the fishing boat, crab nets, hooks and lead weights

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Victor, tiene la edad  de 27 años, está casado , vive con la esposa y un hijo  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Víctor, 27, is married and lives with his wife and a son, who are his biggest priority.

With his loan he plans to buy fertilizer and fungicide and pay for labor to help maintain the coffee crop.  He's also going to buy seedlings to re-sow at the beginning of the rainy season.

Víctor's goal is to increase the density of plants and make the most of good soil fertility, climate conditions, and other factors that favor growing coffee.  He expects to earn some profits with these improvements to his crop.  That way he can improve his family's living conditions as well as invest a little more in the area of the crop and achieve some goals.

This is Víctor's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hadn't had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy inputs

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Her name is Jenilyn, and she is 55 and a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Teofilo, and has two children. One is in high school and the other one is in the elementary level. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs, and to send her children to school. 

Jenilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also has a small tailoring. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 1,000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan which she will use to buy more grocery items such as noodles, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. She expects an increased demand of grocery items, especially now that Christmas is fast approaching. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, and a good return on her investment for it will surely help cover their daily household needs and for the education of her children.

Jenilyn hopes to maintain and grow her business so they could have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible, and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Gomer

texts.en:
Gomer is a 59-year-old, married man and a father of two children, from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is a fisherman and has been in the fishing business for more than ten years now. 

Gomer is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. A loan will help him improve his business as well as his income. 

In the future, Gomer hopes of making his business a success and sustainable. He also wants to save some of his earnings to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing vitenge (traditional African cloth) in bulk to sell in her shop

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 32 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, three currently in school. For the past two years, Robert has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential items like sugar, salt and water . 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items and will help Robert generate greater profits and build rental houses. Robert hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand the business into a mega supermarket. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items for his store,

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is a 38-year-old married Lebanese woman and the mother of two children attending school. Her husband works at a local company and he is the main income provider for the family. Samar is a hard-working woman and a great mother who is making a strong effort to meet the needs of her family. She has been producing and selling homemade food for years and she really makes appetizing provisions. She is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase raw materials and other supplies which she requires to increase her productivity and consequently her revenue.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and other supplies

loans.name: Claudia Marisol

texts.es: Claudia es una mujer de 35 años de edad que desde hace 7 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas y bebidas tanto frías como calientes para acompañar a las anteriores. Ella habita en vivienda propia desde hace 6 años junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos 2 niñas y 2 varones que son su mayor alegría y razón para esforzarse tanto. Claudia desea ofrecer mejores precios y mayor variedad de bebidas a sus clientes, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, chicharrón, frijoles, quesillo, repollo, zanahoria, tomates, bebidas frías, bebidas calientes, etc.
texts.en: Claudia is a 35 year old woman that 7 years ago started making and selling pupusas and cold and hot drinks.  She lives at her own home that she's had for 6 years with her husband and their 4 children, 2 girls and 2 boys that are her biggest joy and reason to make such an effort.  Claudia wants to offer better prices more variety of drinks to her customers. She has decided to request a loan to FUSAI and invest in buying corn, fried pork rinds, beans, cheese, cabbage, carrot, tomatoes, cold drinks, hot drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy corn, fried pork rinds, beans, cheese, cabbage, carrot, tomatoes, cold drinks, hot drinks, etc.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is 50 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has eight children, two currently in school. For the past two years, Salim has been working hard to manage his bakery and milling business. 

To help expand his business, Salim has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy baking flour and other ingredients for making bread. The loan will help Salim generate greater profits and take care of his family . Salim hopes that in the future he will be able to own another bakery. 

Salim is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Salim who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy some baking flour and other ingredients for making bread,

loans.name: Anonymous Group
