loans.use: to buy second-hand shirts to resell

loans.name: Revinia

texts.en:
This is Revinia, 63, a very hardworking entrepreneur from Coron Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Pedrito, her business partner. She has a vegetable/general store at a public market. She makes good income from it, which provides for their daily personal and household needs.

Revinia buys fresh vegetables like squash, garlic, potatoes, onions and other citrus fruits from a wholesaler and sells them at retail. She also has condiments, seasonings, and toiletries at her store. Revinia is a nice and friendly woman, so people prefer to buy at her store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day. 

Revinia is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan to purchase more varieties of fruit and vegetable to meet increased demand of her food items, since Christmas is fast approaching. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment, and the financial help that will be given her for it will be a big help to provide for the daily needs of her family.

Revinia aims to maintain and grow her business so she can save for her old age and help her grandchildren go to school. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for vegetables, eggs, condiments, and other grocery items at a public market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business selling a type women's clothes known as dira

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 49 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all in school. For the past four years, David has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells items like sugar, salt and water . 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items and will help David to generate greater profits and see his children in better schools. David hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand the retail shop and add more items. 

David is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items for his retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more essential items for his retail shop.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 49 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has seven children. For the past 20 years, Rehema has been working hard to manage her business selling charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale, and will help Rehema generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Rehema hopes that in the future, she will be able to own more branches of the same business. 

Rehema is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rehema who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale,

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 47 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two currently in school. For the past 10 years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his boutique business selling clothes. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 4,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock different types of clothes to be sold during the festive season, and will help Patrick generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Patrick hopes that in the future, he will be able to start selling construction sand. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock different types of clothes to be sold during the festive season,

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
HEIDY es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 12, 10, 7 y 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.  
Ella es buena madre, generosa, amable, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un área caracterizada por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores; inmigrantes del occidente del país como los mineros relocalizados y etnias nativas del lugar como los ‘Ayoreos’ ocuparon la zona, su siguiente generación vive mayormente del comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura constante entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
HEIDY es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que comparte con sus familiares más antiguos, en el comercio habla español (la tercera de la izquierda, usa blusa negra floreada de blanco y falda azul). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y sus hijos; los mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor se encuentra en el jardín de infantes. Sus ganas de ampliar su negocio para generar mejores ingresos para su familia la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, carnicería,  venta de sándwiches, artesanía y venta de refrescos, para solicitar un préstamo y continuar con sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui),  Chicharrón de Taitetu (Chanchitos de monte ”taitetú” frito), locro carretero cruceño (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), y otros.
Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana en el mercado del lugar. “la comida tradicional cruceña es deliciosa, muchos sabores y delicias diferentes, cocinamos una comida por día y nuestros clientes quedan satisfechos…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante propio y grande, dónde puedan comer muchos clientes. Ella desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de utensilios de cocina como; Deshuesador, Cebollero, sierra, Puntilla, Tijeras, Descorazonador, Abrelatas, Sacacorchos,  Pelador, Rallador, cubiertos de mesa, y otros. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que HEIDY solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios de cocina para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes en su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Heidy is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her partner, has four children aged 12, 10, 7 and 5 and her business is the sale of traditional food.  She is a good mother, generous, kind, optimistic, happy, responsible, hard-working and has a positive attitude. 

Her business is carried out in the area “plan 3000,” an area characterized by the multiculturalism of its inhabitants.  Immigrants from the west of the country such as relocated miners and native ethnic groups from the place such as the “Ayoreos” occupied the area. Their next generation mainly lives from trade, commerce and manufacturing in the whole area.  The climate is warm, tropical and humid, with a constant temperature between 21-35 degrees centigrade all year.

Heidy  is dark-complexioned, short in stature, with long, black, tied-back hair.  Her mother tongue is Guarani that she shares with her oldest relatives.  In her business she speaks Spanish.  She is the third from the left, in a black blouse with white flowers and a blue skirt.

She shares her life with her partner, who works in construction, and their children.  The oldest are studying in school and the youngest is in kindergarten.  Her desire to expand her business to generate a better income for her family led to forming a bank of people with businesses such as: the sale of potato chips, the sale of sportswear, neighbourhood store, butcher shop, sale of sandwiches, artisan shop and the sale of soft drinks, in order to ask for a loan and continue with their businesses.

Her business is the sale of traditional food such as “Majadito de charque” (dried meat, rice, fried egg and fried banana), “Cogote relleno” (Creole chicken neck, the stuffing could be potato and chicken liver)  “Chicharron de Taitetu” (Mount “Taitetu” fried pork rind), “Locro carretero cruceno” (dried meat, meat cut into pieces, yucca and egg soup), “Sopa de Remojado” (bone soup) and others.

She works every day of the week in the local marketplace.  She says, “The traditional 'crucena' food is delicious, full of flavour and with different delicacies.  We cook one meal for the day and our customers are very satisfied.”  Her dream is to have her own big restaurant where many customers can eat.  

She wishes to accomplish the extension of her business by the purchase of cooking utensils such as a boning knife, chef's knife, grater, can openers, corer, vegetable peeler, corkscrews, scissors, saw, cutlery and others.   This is her first round of loan with the institution in the four years that she has been doing this business.

It is for these reasons that Heidy is asking for a loan for the purchase of kitchen utensils in order to serve a greater quantity of customers in her new business.

.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils so that she can serve a greater quantity of customers in her new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in candy, rice, milk, cheese, cereals, sugar, beans, coffee, spices, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Siaumau

texts.en: Siaumau is a 59 year-old widow with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for eight years. Siaumau needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new gloves, a new wheelbarrow, crops, a tiller and a crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD since 2006. Siaumau will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new gloves, a new wheelbarrow, crops, a tiller and a crowbar

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 42 years old and unmarried.  She has six children. She owns and operates a copra business to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Maria needs a loan to buy a large outdoor baking oven, baking trays, machetes, roasting pans, plastic barrels and a squeezing machine. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Maria will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a large outdoor baking oven, baking trays, machetes, roasting pans, plastic barrels and a squeezing machine

loans.name: La Hermita Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario La Hermita, está integrado por tres socios emprendedores, es coordinado por Mayra una mujer de 26 años de edad, casada y propietaria de un taller de zapatería ubicado en su domicilio desde hace dos años, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de la municipalidad, mercados capitalinos y Diriamba, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de materia prima al por mayor como es cuero sintético, pega amarilla, pega blanca, conos de hilo, hebillas, cajuelas, adornos, etc., una de sus metas es abrir nuevos mercados. El resto de los integrantes son la señora María de 44 años de edad, quien se dedica a la hecha y venta de nacatamales, venta de leña y cosechas de frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace veinte años, y Nelson un joven de 26 años comerciante de especies en algunos barrios de la capital.
texts.en:
The La Hermita solidarity group is made up of three enterprising members. 

Mayra is coordinator for the group. She is 26 years old, married, and the owner of a cobbler’s shop, located in her house, that has been operating for two years. Her products are sold in the local municipal market, the capital and Diriamba markets. She is requesting this loan to buy in bulk the supplies she needs, such as synthetic leather, yellow glue, white glue, cones of thread, buckles, heels, decorations, etc. One of her goals is to open new markets.

The other members are Maria, who is 44 years old and has made her living making and selling nacatamales, and selling firewood and fruit harvests in the municipal market for the last 20 years, and Nelson, a young man of 26 years who sells spices in various neighborhoods in the capital.

loans.use: to buy supplies for shoemaking, which will help increase production in her cobbler's shop.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos nietos, ella trabaja de elaborar piñatas para fiestas de cumpleaños desde hace 8 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con las ventas que realiza ha logrado cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Ella  solicita un crédito que le permita comprar más materiales como: papeles de todo tipo de colores, pegamento, alambre, papel de diario entre otras cosas y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 65, lives in her own house with her two grandchildren.

She has worked making piñatas for birthday parties for eight years.  Her business is in her residence, and she has managed to cover her household expenses with her sales.

Mercedes is requesting a loan to buy more paper in all colors, glue, wire, newsprint, and other materials so she can earn better profits.

loans.use: to buy paper in all colors, glue, wire, newsprint, and other materials

loans.name: Faaseseina

texts.en: Faaseseina is a 43 year-old unmarried woman with three children. She makes and sells meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Faaseseina needs a loan to buy meat, bags of flour, cooking oil, a new oven, a strainer, seasoning, salt and some baking trays. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Faaseseina has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy meat, bags of flour, cooking oil, a new oven, a strainer, seasoning, salt and some baking trays

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is 39 year old fisherman from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is married and has five children. The eldest is 18 and the youngest child is five. 

Arnel has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years now. Fishing is a lucrative venture in his town.  Arnel is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. With a loan, he will be able to improve his catch, thus allowing him to sell more fish to the market.  In the future, Arnel has hopes of making his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Ayşegül

texts.en: Aysegul is a young high-school graduate who is preparing for college. She is also trying to find work to live comfortably while studying. She sells cleaning supplies. One day she met a group that sells different kinds of coffee. She then became a member of the group to do this job as well. With the loan from Maya, she will buy cleaning supplies and coffee. When she buys in bulk, she can make more money. Aysegul is a hard-working, enterprising woman.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies and coffee

loans.name: Aiuli

texts.en: Aiuli is a 42 year old woman who is married and has three children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has been in this business for five years. Aiuli needs a loan to buy a spare tire, floor mats, a new taxi sign, a brand new paint job and also to pay for her business license. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Aiuli joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire, floor mats, a new taxi sign, a brand new paint job and also to pay for her business license

loans.name: Sue

texts.en: Sue is a 38 year-old divorced woman with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows kava, which she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Sue needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake and kava plants. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Sue will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake and kava plants

loans.name: Eterine

texts.en: Eterine is a 46 year-old widow with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for six years. Eterine needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, shovels, sprayers, gloves, a wheelbarrow and overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Eterine will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, shovels, sprayers, gloves, a wheelbarrow and overalls

loans.name: Amparo Del Rosario

texts.es: Amparo es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar, a través de su negocio de crianza y venta de pollos, actividad que realiza desde hace 30 años por lo que gracias a su experiencia cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que buscan sus productos por ser de excelente calidad. Ella habita en vivienda propia 42 años junto a su hijo que le apoya con los gastos de su hogar. Amparo desea dedicarse también a la crianza de cerdos para tener mejores ingresos e invertir más en los pollos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, cerdos, concentrado y vitaminas para la crianza de pollos y cerdos en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Amparo is an enterprising woman who tries to sustain the economy of her home through her chicken-farming and selling business. She has been doing this for 30 years and thanks to her experience she has a lot of customers who seek her products for their excellent quality. 

She has lived in her own home for 42 years with her son who supports her with the household costs. Amparo also wants to farm pigs to make more income, and to invest more in the chickens, which is why she is asking from a loan from FUSAI. She will invest this in: chickens, pigs, concentrates and vitamins to farm chickens and pigs on her homestead.

loans.use: to invest in: chicken, pigs, concentrates and vitamins for the farming of chickens and pigs in her homestead

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is grateful that she was granted a 40,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan which she will use as her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, pasta, coffee, beverages, egg noodles, and other grocery items. She expects an increased demand for grocery items now that Christmas is fast approaching. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her for it will surely help cover their everyday needs and for the schooling of her children. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Adelaida dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a 53 year-old widow and a mother of three grown children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is engaged in retail sales of cooking pots and basketballs gear (balls). This has been the source of her income for the past 20 years.

Remedios is asking for a loan to buy more cooking pots, basketball gear (balls). This loan will enable Remedios to buy more stock to sell to her customers.  In the future, Remedios hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more cooking pots, basketball gear (balls)

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo, es un hombre que se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, oficio que ha desempeñado toda su vida, para obtener ingresos con los que subsiste con su familia, a pesar de su edad él siente que aún puede mantenerse al frente de su negocio; tiene  una familia integrada por su compañera de vida y tres hijos, dos de ellos están estudiando.
Utilizará el préstamo para pagar los costos de la recolección de la cosecha de granos básicos, agilizara los trabajos para tener en su hogar alimento y abastecer a sus clientes con el producto para tener su fuente de ingresos estable.
Sus sueños son tener en un futuro mejores cosechas, un área más grande de cultivo, resarcir su deuda y salir a delante con su familia.
texts.en:
Mateo is a farmer who cultivates basic grains, work he has done his whole life to make income to support his family. Despite his age, he thinks he can still maintain himself at the head of his business. HIs family comprises his life partner and three children, two of whom are students.

He'll use the loan to pay the costs of collecting his basic grain crops, facilitating the work so he can provide food at home and fulfill his customers' needs in order to keep his source of income stable.

His dream is to have better crops in the future, more land to cultivate, pay off his debt and get ahead with his family.

loans.use: pay for the cost of collecting his basic grain crops, facilitating the work so he can provide food at home and fulfill his customers' needs.

loans.name: Bisura

texts.en:
Bisura is 32 years old. She is married and has two children. Bisura is Camfed Learner Guide working with secondary school students. She helps youth to identify challenges which hinder their performance in order to increase their performance and personal well-being. 

Bisura is a nurse and owns a medical shop. In addition to selling medicine in her village as a nurse, she also provides house calls to patients. That's what makes her business special in her village. 

Bisura uses the profit she earns to pay for her children's school fees and household expenses. Bisura is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business by purchasing varieties of medicines.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing varieties of medicines.

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
His name is Federico, 60, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Zenaida, who manages their household. He has a business to provide income to meet their daily personal and household needs.

Federico operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages, piecemeal, to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. Federico is a cheerful man that makes people prefer to buy at his store. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day. 

To help him continue operations of his business, Federico is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which he will use to buy grocery items, such as sacks of rice, corn rice, charcoal, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages. He expects an increased demand for rice and grocery items since Christmas is fast-approaching. He is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on his investment and the financial help that will be given him. He wishes everyone a blessed Christmas!

Federico aims to grow his business, so he could save for his old age and to help send his grandchildren to school. Every week, he faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for sacks of rice, charcoal, beverages, and toiletries to sell at his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more underwear of various prices, styles and colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy larger quantities of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Marlin

texts.en:
Marlin is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase a of ladies bags needed for her business. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy different styles of ladies bags to sell at her store. She is positive that demand for her items will increase, as bags are one of the nicest gifts for Christmas. The more styles and number of bags in her store will give her customers a wide array to choose from. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas! 

Marlin dreams of having a bigger store for her bags and other direct selling products. She aims to give her children the best education in order for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more variety of ladies' bags needed for her business.

loans.name: Gjelina

texts.en:
Gjelina lives in a town with approximately 10,000 residents.  She is 54 years old and married. She has two daughters, 24 and 18,  both of whom are still attending schools.  The older one is studying in university (fitness and living well) and the younger is in the last year of high school. As seen in the photograph, she operates a little market where she sells mainly fruits and veggies and also is a wholesaler as well. All her family’s income is generated from this activity.  
Gjelina is requesting this loan to buy fresh produce to sell to another large farmer’s market (the largest in the northern Albania).  They have their own transportation vehicle that they use for this activity. This market, in particular, started its activity about 60 years ago and is still going strong.

loans.use: to buy fresh produce

loans.name: Edilita

texts.en:
Edilita works hard to support two children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Edilita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business with more products, which will help her earn profit to provide her family with decent meals, health care and the children’s school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a shoe sales business

loans.name: Nua Ngam 6 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thanh, 42, lives with her daughter in an old house in a remote village. Her daughter is 17 years old and has been disabled since birth, which makes her unable to walk and speak. Her husband was disappointed with the circumstance and left the family while the other daughter has been married and lived with the in-laws. Despite all of these hardships, Mrs. Thanh loves her disabled daughter with all her heart and works very hard everyday to provide the daughter a good life. Indeed, she works at plenty of agricultural activities, such as cultivating rice, corn, peas, and raising pigs and chickens for a living. She also constantly expands production to improve earnings. To have enough capital for investment, she has taken out loan from the Anh Chi Em Program. This is the fourth time she has received a loan from the Program and she will use it to buy piglets and food for the pigs. She hopes her investment will go well and generate extra income so that she could provide better for her daughter. She dreams good luck will knock at the door and bring a normal life for her disabled daughter. In the picture, she wears a purple coat and stands on the first row, at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for the pigs

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married and has children. He has his own business.

Oleg has been growing vegetables in greenhouses for 11 years. He grows tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage and potatoes. He is an ambitious and hardworking person. He wants to develop his business further. 

Oleg is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to buy film, seeds and wood for the greenhouses. The loan will help him to have a larger harvest this season. Increasing sales will help Oleg to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy film, seeds and wood

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her three children. She has been selling clothes for the last 5 years. She runs her business out of her house, and has many clients. 

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing in bulk, so she can continue her sales and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Ma. Villa

texts.en:
Ma. Villa is 49 years old and married, with seven children. Four of her children are in school. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, etc. Ma. Villa has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and she earns additional income from pig fattening.

Ma. Villa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business, in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional fish to sell. Norma has been in this business for eight years, now.

Norma would like to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials to build pigsty

loans.name: Leonesa

texts.en:
Leonesa is 59 years old and married, with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. Leonesa has been in this business for one year.

In the future she would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Fegauiai

texts.en:
Fegauiai is 34 years old and married. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas, which she sells in her community and at the market. She has been farming for three years. 

Fegauiai requested a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, and new overalls. She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, and new overalls

loans.name: Tuinanau

texts.en:
Tuinanau is 55 years old and married; she has six children. She has a small plantation, where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 12 years.

Tuinanau needs a loan to buy sprayers, new gum boots, fertilizer, chemicals, a crowbar, a tiller, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2002. Tuinanau will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, new gum boots, fertilizer, chemicals, a crowbar, a tiller, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Foisaga

texts.en:
Foisaga is a 38-year-old, married woman, who has one child. She manages a plantation and a vegetable garden, to earn a living. She has been doing this for eight years.

Foisaga needs a loan to buy chemicals, overalls, gloves, a large tiller, spades, machetes, a wheelbarrow, and crop and vegetable seeds. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and to expand her business. Foisaga joined SPBD in 2006, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, overalls, gloves, a large tiller, spades, machetes, a wheelbarrow, and crop and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Tafaimalo

texts.en:
Tafaimalo is 34 years old and unmarried with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Tafaimalo needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, gloves, shovels, new boots and sprayers. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Tafaimalo will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, gloves, shovels, new boots and sprayers

loans.name: Lualeiana

texts.en:
Lualeiana is 19 years old and single with no children. She makes and sells traditional elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for three years. 

Lualeiana has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, materials, gloves, brushes, rollers, pins, stencils and wooden carved designs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, materials, gloves, brushes, rollers, pins, stencils and wooden carved designs

loans.name: Miraneta

texts.en:
Miraneta is 35 years old and married with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Miraneta needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a machete, a spade, a wheelbarrow, crops and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Miraneta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a machete, a spade, a wheelbarrow, crops and new overalls

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a businesswoman from Dipolog. She is 63 years old, married and has expertise in sales. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Delia is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Delia continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: To restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to sustain the needs of the business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, 54 years old, is married. She lives in Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City. In order to survive, she has found ways to attain income through her rice retailing business. It began with displaying few kilos of repacked rice to sell to her neighbors. 

Helen joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her rice retailing business in January of 2014. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received her second loan. 

Now, she is applying for 14,900 PHP to pay for eight sacks of rice to sell. This will help her to meet her customers' needs. She hopes that her business will grow and continue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for eight sacks of rice to sell to meet her customers' needs

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is engaged in a peanut vending business. Jenny is 27 years old and single. She is from the village of Larayan, Dapitan City. 

In 2003, Jenny joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenny is requesting an amount of 5,000 PHP which will be used for peanut seedlings for her business.

loans.use: To buy seedlings of peanut plants to sustain the needs of the family

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa de  45 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y  venta de tamales de pollo desde hace varios años, vende de manera ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, Tomasa vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos, verduras, maíz, tomates, etc. y asi seguir con sus ventas para generar mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Tomasa, 45, has had a business making and selling chicken tamales for a number of years.  She sells from place to place in the different neighborhoods.  Tomasa lives in her own home with her life partner.  She is requesting a loan to buy chickens, vegetables, corn, tomatoes, etc., so she can continue with her sales and generate more earnings.

loans.use: to buy food for her business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is gardening her hobby, but she earns an income doing it, as well. At the age of 57 and married, she busies herself this way, to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. The cooperative provided her credit, in support of her gardening activities.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer. In the future, Evangeline wishes to become the supplier of flowers for the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer to maintain the growth of the plants.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: Jose de 55 años de edad posee desde hace varios años una sastrería ubicada en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo, Jose vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Jose, 55, has had a tailoring business for a number of years.  His business is in his  home, and he has a lot of customers because of the quality of his work.  Jose lives in his own home with his wife and daughter.  He is requesting a loan to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, elastic, etc., so that he can continue with his business, which generates good earnings for him.

loans.use: to buy tailoring supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy three phones.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a businesswoman. She is 39 years old, single, and has an expertise for sales. Rosemarie is living with her parents in Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City. She has a small business, operating a specialized retail store selling rice to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for five years. She earns a meager income, but it sufficiently supports the family's needs.

Rosemarie is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing, without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to pay for six sacks of rice to sell. Rosemarie continues to look for better business opportunities, which is proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to pay for six sacks of rice to sell.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is from Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 58 years of age. She and her partner have three school-age children. 

This year, 2014, Amada joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and she appreciates the programs and services of the said co-op. From her desire to help the family, she engaged in selling fish in different barangays in the municipality of Sergio Osmena, Zamboanga del Norte. Only her motorcycle was used as her source of transportation to reach the different barangays and sell fish. Her source of income has existed for two years now. 

In need of additional working capital, Amada requested financial assistance from PMPC, in the amount of PHP 15,000, to purchase more stocks of fish. Through this loan, she hopes to increase and/or have more income since she is able to provide for the daily needs of her family and also she is happy she can support the education of her children, which is her main priority of her hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, de 59 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado y está acompañada.- Se dedica a vender frutas y granos básicos  como maíz, frijol, entre otros.- Su compañero de vida antes trabajaba en la agricultura pero ahora, trabaja como vigilante en una propiedad durante la noche.

María, se levanta junto a su esposo a las 4:30 a.m. para ir a comprar a los cantones el maíz y frijol que posteriormente venden en el mercado de su ciudad.

María,  ocupa el préstamo para comprar frutas, maíz y frijol, ya que al comprar al mayoreo le saldrá a menor costo y le quedará mayores ganancias para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.

María, planea que con las ganancias que le generé la venta de estos productos, poder construir una vivienda digna para ella y su familia
texts.en:
María, 59 years old, studied until sixth grade. She is married, she sells fruits and basic grains like corn, beans and others. Her husband used to make his living in agriculture, but now works as a security guard at night.

She gets up at 4:30 am with her husband to buy corn and beans to then sell them at the market of the city.

Maria needs the loan to buy fruits, corn and beans because when buying at wholesale she will have less costs and more profits to cover the needs of her home.

Maria plans to one day build a residence for her and her family with the profits generated from selling these products.

loans.use: to buy fruits, corn and beans.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, de 51 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, oficios que aprendió de su madre, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casado y sus hijos estudian.

Miguel, se levanta temprano para ordeñar las vacas, después se va a trabajar junto a sus hijos en las parcelas que alquila y durante el resto del día trabaja de jornalero.
 
 
Miguel, necesita el préstamo para pagar trabajadores, transporte y desgranadora para sacar su cosecha de frijol y maíz.- Espera tener un buen ingreso para el sustento de su familia.

El planea en un futuro con ayuda de otro crédito, poder comprar un vehículo ya que desea dedicarse al transporte carga y pasajeros, para buscar ingresos adicionales para darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miguel is 51 years old. he works in farming and livestock production, trades that he learned from his mother. He studied through secondary school. He is married and his children are in school.

Miguel gets up early to milk the cows. After that, he leaves with his children to work in the parcels that he rents. During the rest of the day, he works as a day laborer.

Miguel needs the loan to pay for labor, transport, and a shelling machine to harvest his corn and bean crops. He hopes to have a good income to sustain his family.

With the help on another loan, he plans to buy a vehicle in the future; he would like to work transporting cargo and passengers in order to seek additional income so he can give his children a better education.

loans.use: to pay for workers, transport, and a shelling machine to harvest his bean and corn crops.

loans.name: Sauoleola

texts.en: Sauoleola is 28 years old and married with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Sauoleola needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a spade, a shovel, overalls and a machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Sauoleola will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a spade, a shovel, overalls and a machete

loans.name: Efrain De Los Santo

texts.es: Efraín de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el posee una pequeña  tienda desde hace 3 años, ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Efraín is 50 years old. He lives in his own house with his two children. He has had a small shop, located in his place of residence, for three years. He sells a variety of products like sweets, drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatins, sugar, etc. He has many customers because of his good prices. 

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of more merchandise at wholesale, since that is his only source of income. Then he will have better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy, drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatins, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Samoa

texts.en: Samoa is a 34-year-old widow with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Samoa needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new overalls, a spade, a machete, gloves and lots of crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Samoa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new overalls, a spade, a machete, gloves and lots of crops

loans.name: Baby Grace

texts.en:
Baby Grace is from Tamil, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 31 years of age and single. In October of 2013, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and she appreciates the programs and services of said co-op. 

From her desire to have her own business, she engaged in selling fish in different barangays in the municipality of Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. Only her motorcycle was used as her source of transportation to reached the different barangays and sell fish. Her source of income has existed for three years now. 

In need of additional working capital, she requested financial assistance from PMPC in the amount of PHP 14,900 to purchase more stock of fish. Through this, she hopes to increase her income so that she will be able to help her parents with the daily needs of the family, which is her main priority in her hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish for selling

location.town: SINDANGAN-TAMIL, JOSE DALMAN, ZAMBONGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Samy

texts.en: Samy is from the town of Liloy. He earns a living through his services as a wood cutter and is able to provide for his family. For his capital needs, PMPC has stood by Samy since the start of his business. He is happy that he has been able to survive the odds against businesses with determination and with his family to inspire him. To earn more, he applied for a loan to purchase a second-hand chainsaw. Samy hopes to live comfortably with his children finishing their studies.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand chainsaw

loans.name: Azizakhon

texts.ru:
Азизахон замужняя женщина в возрасте 30 лет. Она умелая и талантливая женщина, занимающаяся шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Данной деятельностью она занимается на протяжении двух лет. 
Азизахон замужем и в браке имеет троих детей. Ее муж зарабатывает на жизнь путем предоставления услуги мастера по ремонту домов. Их семья живет скромно, но счастливо. 
Азизахон сейчас за счет кредита хочет расширить свою швейную деятельность. Она собирается купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку, с помощью которой будет шить быстрее и увеличит количество своих клиентов. 
Помогите Азизахон реализовать ее планы.
texts.en: Azizakhon is a married, 30-year-old woman. She is a skillful and talented woman, involved in sewing women's clothing to-order. She has been in this business for two years. Azizakhon is married and has three children. Her husband earns a living by providing home repair services. Their family lives modestly, but happily. Now Azizakhon wants to obtain a loan to expand her business. She is planning to purchase a new sewing machine, with the help of which she will sew faster and increase the number of her customers. Please help Azizakhon realize her plans.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Retailing helped Rosita survive for the family. She retails charcoal and brings in a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. She found that the business of buying and selling charcoal is easy and simple, because all she needs to do is to weigh and repack the charcoal for her buyers.

Rosita plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan to PMPC, for the needed capital. She wants to purchase an inventory of charcoal to sell, at retail. Rosita smiles at the idea of seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of charcoal for her retail business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 24 and married in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City, she runs a store to provide for the basic necessities of her family. Every day she patiently tends her store until evening. 

Elizabeth wants to expand her business, so she recently signed up her membership in Paglaum Multi-Purpose Copperative to access insurance and financial assistance. She has borrowed a loan of PHP 14,900 to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean more income opportunities. 

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell

loans.name: Girlyn

texts.en: Girlyn is a hard-working and persevering mother who is making a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She is 37 years old and married. She never gets tired of tending her store. Her passion is selling, and she earns an income that is adequate enough to support her family. Girlyn is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without a record of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventory and sales. Girlyn continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination and the energy to support her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventory and sales

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma has been operating her store for 10 years and earns a monthly net income of 8,000 PHP. Emma is 48 years old, married and has four children. She is from the village of Mandih, Sindangan. In 2006, Emma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. Emma is requesting her 10th loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used  for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more kilos of vegetables and spices to sell and pay for additional store inventory to meet her customers' demand

loans.use: to buy more kilos of vegetables and spices to sell and pay for additional store inventory to meet her customers' demand

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 46 years old and lives in Casul, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Zenaida is engaged in fish vending, because her husband is a fisherman  Zenaida wanted to increase their income, so she joined Paglaum Cooperative in 2000. Zenaida is a good payer, even if the weather is not good. She is able to pay her obligations and she is thankful for the savings made possible through Paglaum.  Zenaida is on her third loan, applying for 30,000 PHP, to buy an  additional fishing boat which will be handled by her brother. Zenaida is very happy to give her brother a source of income and, at the same time,  she will also generate income from the fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing boat

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is from Talic, Oroquieta City. She is 56 years old and is a widow. Marilyn owns and operates a sari-sari store. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. Unfortunately, she almost lost her capital when her husband got a serious illness that led him to death. Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) came to Marilyn's rescue to provide access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase store inventory and to maintain working capital. This loan will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase store inventory

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es:
Odilia es originario Suchitepéquez de 48 años de edad, cuento con cuatro hijos: el primero es de 23 años de edad y es casado, el segundo es de 20 años de edad  es dibujante y albañil, el tercero es de 17 años de edad estudiante de quinto P.C en la comunidad donde viven y el cuarto es de 14 años de edad estudiante de segundo básico en su misma comunidad.

Su actividad productiva la cual le genera ganancia en su sistema económica es la compra y venta de ropa típica en su comunidad ya que es la única forma que ella a podido encontrar para poder tener ingresos económicos para su familia, su segunda actividad es servir de mesera en un café y por medio de esa actividad ella puede tener otro ingreso extra para poder mantener a su familia y darles una condición de vida apropiada  para sus hijos y que sean buenos profesionales en el campo laboral de la vida.

Ella es muy emprendedora en la vida y es por ello que ella se decidió a la realización de un préstamo para la compra de mercadería de traje típica, para tener a la disposición de la clientela más mercadería para su respectiva venta por todos los alrededores de su comunidad y vecinos.

Ella se ha convertido en un claro ejemplo para las mujeres en su comunidad, La aspiración más importante de Odilia es la construcción de una mejor vivienda y darles un buen estudio a sus hijos y mejorar aún más las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Odilia is a native of Suchitepéquez.  She is 48-years old and has four children.  The eldest is 23-years old and is married.  The second is 20-years old and is a draftsman and bricklayer.  The third is 17-years old and is a  fifth-year student studying accounting at a technical secondary school in their community.  The youngest is 14-years old and is in secondary school in the same community. 

Odilia's business, which generates earnings for her finances, is buying and selling traditional clothing in her community.  It is the only way she has found to earn an income for her family.  Her second line of work is working as a waitress in a café.  This second work provides her an extra income to help support her family and give her children an appropriate standard of living so they can be good professionals in their work lives. 

Odilia is very enterprising in life.  That is why she decided to take out a loan, so she could purchase merchandise (traditional clothing) to have more at her disposal for her clientele.  She sells it in her surrounding community and to her neighbors. 

Odilia has become a clear example for women in her community.  Her most important aspirations are to build a better home, to give her children a good education and to improve their standard of living even more.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (traditional clothing).

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Editha is a hardworking mother from Lopez Jaena. She is 51 years old. She is a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. Editha has signed for her membership with the cooperative, to gain access to insurance and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Editha hopes to succeed in this business, to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts from which to make copra (dried coconut meat, used for oil production).

loans.name: Dina Beatriz

texts.es: Dina es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos uno mayor de edad y uno de 12 años de edad, a los que ha sacado adelante con su esfuerzo. Ella cuenta con una panadería desde hace 10 años y es apoyada en ella que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos proveyéndoles lo necesario para una vida digna, además les apoya con sus estudios. Dina desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: duralita, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible ya que desde hace unas semanas está presentando filtraciones, por lo que espera contar con el apoyo de este crédito para cambiarlas lo antes posible.
texts.en: Dina is a single mother and she lives in her own house together with her 2 children, one adult and one of 12 years old, whom she has helped to get ahead with her efforts. She owns a bakery for 10 years already and is supported by it as it has helped her to get her children ahead, providing them with what is necessary for a dignified life, and she also supports them with their studies. Dina wishes to change the roof of her house as it is in a deteriorated state. For this she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in: Duralita sheeting, poles and pins in order to change the roof of her house as soon as possible, as for weeks it has been showing leaks. For this she hopes to have the support of this credit to change it as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in: Duralita sheeting, poles and pins to change the roof of her house

loans.name: Marcelisa

texts.en: Marcelisa, 57 years old, is a widow with three children and a resident of Baliangao, Philippines. She has been in this business for more than a decade. Vegetable vending is her primary source of livelihood. She became a member of Paglaum MPC in June, 2000. Recently, Marcelisa decided to apply for a loan to buy sand and gravel for housing expansion. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell. In the future, she hopes to save more for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional sand and gravel for housing expansion.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Roberto tiene 51 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su padre, hermano  y su hijo de 17 años de edad. Roberto es pequeño comerciante de ropa y calzado. Este negocio es el que le permite ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a su hogar. Roberto desea seguir manteniendo su negocio por mucho más tiempo dado que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra variedad de ropa para dama y calzado.
texts.en: Roberto is 51 years old and lives in his own house together with his father, brother and son, who is 17 years old. Roberto is a small businessman of clothing and footwear. This business allows him to earn a livelihood and bring sustenance into his home. Roberto wishes to continue maintaining his business for a very long time, as it is his principal source of income. For this, he requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying a variety of women's clothing and footwear.

loans.use: to buy a variety of women's clothing and footwear to sell

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
El señor Benjamín  de  61 años de edad, vive con su esposa, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de él y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 13 años a la reparación de neumáticos de motocicletas, carros, tractores y camiones.
Don Benjamín también vende los neumáticos, es un señor trabajador con deseos de salir adelante y que necesita financiamiento para seguir trabajando y mejorando su calidad de vida.
Don Benjamín está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de neumáticos para motocicleta y vehículos, tanto nuevos como usados, espera que esta inversión le genere ingresos necesarios para salir adelante en su negocio y seguir apoyando en su hogar.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Benjamín, 61 years old, lives with his wife. He doesn't have dependent children, and he lives in a community of San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras. He has his own home and for 13 years, he has made his living repairing the tires of motorcycles, cars, tractors, and trucks. Benjamín also sells tires.

He is a hardworking man with a desire to get ahead. He needs financing in order to continue working and improving his quality of life.

Benjamín is applying for the loan to buy new as well as used tires for motorcycles and vehicles. He hopes that this investment will generate enough income for him to get ahead in his business and continue supporting his family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014.

loans.use: to buy tires for his business.

loans.name: Nelly Yamileth

texts.es:
Nelly, de 30 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su esposo es comerciante de ropa y tienen 3 hijos, dos de ellos asisten a la escuela.

Nelly, es una mujer trabajadora, durante muchos años se ha esforzado para ayudar a su familia.- Anteriormente, ha trabajado como cajera en un restaurante, también trabajo como empleada doméstica.

Hace 7 años, inicio su propio negocio de venta de tortillas, con el cual ha podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a su familia.

El crédito será invertido para comprar una cocina para elaborar sus tortillas y comprar maíz.

El sueño de Nelly es, que sus hijos puedan estudiar y logren obtener un titulo universitario.- Además, tiene planificado continuar estudiando el bachillerato los fines de semana, el próximo año.
texts.en:
Nelly is 30, she studied up to ninth grade, she is married, her husband is a clothing merchant and they have 3 children, two of them in school.

Nelly is a hardworking woman, for many years she has made an effort to help her family.  Previously she worked as a cashier at a restaurant and as a domestic employee.

7 years ago, she started her own business selling tortillas, with it she has been able to help her husband with home expenses and get their family ahead.

The loan will be invested in buying a stove to make her tortillas and to buy corn.

Nelly's dream is that her children study and achieve a university degree. Also she wants to continue to study high school during weekends next year.

loans.use: to buy a stove to make her tortillas and to buy corn.

loans.name: Nua Ngam 7 Group

texts.en:
Long is a 43-year-old Thai minority lady who lives in a family of five people, including her husband, her son and his wife, and her grandchild in a small Thai traditional house. Agriculture is the main production that generates income for her family. Indeed, they work at various activities of cultivation and animal husbandry, such as cultivating rice, corn and cassava and raising buffalo, pigs and chickens. To have additional income to cover living expenses and provide better for the crowded family, Long also works as a trader between Vietnam and Laos. This is the fourth time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy goods such as cloth and food in Vietnam and trade them in Laos.

She said that she was thankful for the timely financial support of the Program when she faced the lack of capital. She hopes that her business will be prosperous so that she could improve significantly her family's income as well as their living conditions.

Long dreams her grandchild will have a more abundant life, a bright future and escape from poverty. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy goods such as cloth and food in Vietnam and trade them in Laos.

loans.name: Ligi

texts.en: Ligi is 63 years old, married, and has eight children. She has a small plantation, where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this work for two years. Ligi needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, a wheelbarrow, overalls, a spade, a shovel and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Ligi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, a wheelbarrow, overalls, a spade, a shovel, and crops

loans.name: Fuarosa

texts.en: Fuarosa is 49 years old and married. She has nine children. She has a small plantation, where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this work for two years. Fuarosa needs a loan to buy fertilizer, gloves, a new wheelbarrow, a spade, a crowbar, a tiller, and a pitchfork. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Fuarosa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gloves, a new wheelbarrow, a spade, a crowbar, a tiller, and a pitchfork.

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en: Matauaina is a 35-year-old, unmarried woman, and she has two children. She runs a small fishing business in her community, to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Matauaina needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, bait, flippers, and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Matauaina has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, bait, flippers, and new goggles.

loans.name: Mirna Isabel

texts.es:
Mirna, de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos para cancelar los gastos educativos de una universidad.- Está casada, tiene un hijo de 16 años que está estudiando, aparte de su esposo y su hijo, vive su madre y sus 2 hermanos.

Mirna, trabajó doce años como secretaria en la alcaldía de su ciudad, sin embargo hace ocho años, la despidieron, y ha sido difícil encontrar otro empleo por su edad.- Además, su madre empezó a sentirse mal de salud y no había quien le brindara los cuidados que ella necesitaba.- Fue así como Mirna, decidió poner una tienda en su vivienda, para 	tener una fuente de ingresos, que pudiera cubrir con los gastos que se tienen en el hogar.-

Desde hace ocho años, está trabajando  en esta actividad, y hace 6 meses logro poner otro negocio de venta de pupusas.


El préstamo será utilizado para comprar otros productos para surtir mas la tienda.- Además invertirá en la compra de maíz, para la elaboración de las pupusas.

Lo que más desea es, que su hijo estudie en la universidad y logre graduarse de una carrera, ya que así tendrá más oportunidades de encontrar un buen empleo; también desea que su negocio crezca y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mirna, 54 years old, studied until her high school because her parents did not have the economic resources to pay for the educational expenses of university. She is married and has a 16-year-old son who is studying. Apart from her husband and son, her mom and two siblings live with them. 

Mirna worked for 12 years as a secretary in the mayor's office. Nevertheless, they dismissed her 8 years ago, and it had been difficult to find another job because of her age. In addition, her mother had begun to be in bad health and there hadn't been anyone to afford her the care that she needed. It was for that reason that Mirna decided to put a store in her house to have a source of income that could cover the expenses that they have at home. 

For 8 years she has been working in this activity, and 6 months ago she achieved starting another business, selling pupusas.

The loan will be used to buy other products to stock her store. Additionally, she will invest it in the purchase of corn to make pupusas.

What she desires most is that her son go to college and graduates with a degree so that he will have more opportunities to find a good job. She also wants her business to grow and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy other products to stock her store and to buy corn to make pupusas.

loans.name: Danyaro

texts.en:
Danyaro is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Danyaro joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Hakilu, Dahiru and Ummaru.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Danyaro would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Danyaro can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Danyaro spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children and added that he hoped eventually to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms for his children, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials to build a pigsty

loans.name: Letirina

texts.en: Letirina is 29 years old, married, and has six children. She has a small plantation, where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this work for one year. Letirina needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, new boots, gloves, overalls, and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Letirina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, new boots, gloves, overalls, and crops.

loans.name: Ginger

texts.en: Ginger is 27 years old, unmarried, and has two children. She has a small plantation, where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this work for one year. Ginger needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a spade, a tiller, crops, and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Ginger will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a spade, a tiller, crops and gloves.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
La señora Elvia de 25 años de edad es madre de 03 hijos que depende de ella y su esposo vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras,  vive en casa de propia y se dedica desde hace 02 años  a la venta de tortilla y golosinas como tacos, enchiladas, tajaditas, churros,  etc. sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos que llegan a su casa a comprarle sus productos.
Doña Elvia está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de arena, cemento, arenilla y mano de obra  ya que desea repellar su casa para mejorar su calidad de vida, porque por dentro su casa está sin repellar,  ha solicitado varios prestamos para mejorar su casa y está muy contenta con Prisma por la ayudas brindadas, uno de sus sueños es seguir mejorando su casa para que sus hijos vivan mejor.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Elvia is 25 years old and a mother to three children who depend on her. She lives with her husband in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She lives in her own house and has been working for 2 years selling tortillas and snacks like tacos, enchiladas, sweet plantains, and churros etc. Her customers are friends and neighbors who come to her house to buy her products. She is requesting the loan to purchase sand, cement, fine sand, and manual labor. She wants to plaster her house to improve her quality of life because inside her house there is no plaster. She has requested various loans to improve her house, and she is very content with Prisma for the help afforded her. One of her dreams is to continue improving her house so that her children live better.

San Lorenzo, November 2014.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, fine sand, and manual labor for her house.

loans.name: Darwin Oswaldo

texts.es:
Darwin tiene 28 años de edad el tiene una imprenta pequeña en la cual realiza empastados para las escuelas del sector es soltero vive con sus padres en la provincia de Bolívar, cantón Guaranda.
Solicita el crédito para compra de materiales para la imprenta y para algunos arreglos en las maquinas que utiliza.
Sus sueño es ampliar sus negocio y formar una familia y solventarla.
En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol y escuchar música.
texts.en: Darwin is 28 years old and has a small printing business in which he puts the binding and covers on the books for the schools in the sector. He is single and lives with his parents in the Bolívar province, cantón Guaranda. He requests this credit to buy materials for the printing business and for some fixes on the machines he uses. His dream is to extend his business and to form a family and be able to support it. In his spare time, he likes to play soccer and listen to music.

loans.use: to buy materials for his printing business

loans.name: Yamila Jeanneth

texts.es:
Yamila, es sastre, este oficio lo aprendió dentro de su familia, es la manera que tiene para generar ingresos y cubrir las necesidades familiares, trabaja con un horario de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., en la zona ya es muy reconocida por su buen trabajo.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar telas, botones, hilos y otros accesorios para la costura, con la inversión brindara mejor atención a sus clientes y su inventario estará surtido, espera tener mejores ganancias para seguir colaborando con los gastos de su hogar y pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas.
Yamila tiene el objetivo de ahorrar para construir su propia casa y que su familia tenga mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Yamila is a tailor, she learned the trade from her family, this is how she generates income and covers the needs of her family.  She works from 7 am to 4 pm in a zone that is well known for her good work.
She will use the loan to buy fabric, buttons, threads and other accessories needed. With the investment she will give better service to her clients and her materials will be stocked, she hopes to have better profits to continue helping with home expenses and pay her loan repayments punctually.
Yamila wants to save to build a house and her family to have better life conditions.

loans.use: comprar telas, botones, hilos y otros accesorios para la costura, con la inversión brindara mejor atención a sus clientes y su inventario estará surtido

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 22-year-old married woman. She lives in Ajloun, Jordan. 

Amal is studying for her Bachelor's degree in English Language and Literature, and she is currently in her fourth year.  

Both a lack of income and some potential financial problems have led Amal to apply for an education loan to help cover her tuition fees for this semester.

loans.use: to pay for her university semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To help cover his semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Neven

texts.en:
Neven is a 20-year-old, single woman. She lives in Irbid. Neven is studying for her Bachelor's degree in Finance and Banking in her second year. Her family of five members depends on her father’s retirement salary only, but having a big family makes it harder to afford paying the university fees sometimes.

For that reason, Neven decided to request a loan that will help her pay her next semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for semester fees.

loans.name: Sarai

texts.es: Sarai es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive con sus suegros en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento, aunque la convivencia es dificil, Sarai se las arregla para tener un buen ambiente, Sarai y su esposo se dedican a la carpinteria especializandose en la fabricacion de ataudes y quieren un prestamo para comprar madera Sarai trabaja duro junto a su marido, ella y su familia gozan de buena salud y el emprendimiento tiene futuro por lo que Sarai espera que puedan ayudarla
texts.en:
Sarai is married and has two children. She lives with her in-laws in a brick and cement house located in the city of El Alto. Even though her relationship is difficult, Sarai has been able to maintain a good situation.
