She dreams of having many happy clients, so she can help her children through college. She states, “My children drive my business; they are the reason I work so hard.”

loans.use: to buy a vacuum cleaner, cleaning products, and supplies, as well as pay for printing of marketing materials.

loans.name: Gelverie

texts.en:
Gelverie is 60 years old and married with five children. 

Gelverie is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Gelverie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock.

Gelverie has been raising livestock for 6 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Gelverie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Georgia

texts.en:
Georgia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Georgia has been in this business for 15 years. Georgia earns additional income from a general store.

Georgia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn works hard to support her family. Jenalyn is married and has a fertilized duck embryo business in the Philippines.

Jenalyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fertilized duck embryo to sell.

Jenalyn has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Jenalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilized duck embryo to sell

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a 37-year-old married woman with seven children, five of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jenalyn has a direct selling avon products business in the Philippines. Jenalyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products from Avon like deodorant, lipsticks, body spray, etc. to sell to her customers.

Jenalyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon like deodorant, lipsticks, body spray, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 57 years old and married with one child. With one child still in school, Josefina works very hard to provide for them.

Josefina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Josefina has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, canned goods, beer, coffee, milk, cooking oil, vinegar, etc.

In the future, Josefina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Merygin

texts.en:
Merygin is 31 years old, married, and has two children; one child is currently in school.

Merygin is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Merygin requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Merygin has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Merygin would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Haidy

texts.en:
Haidy is 46 years old and married with eight children. With four children currently in school, Haidy works very hard to provide for them.

Haidy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, fabric conditioners, noodles, soft drinks, sugar, sanitary pads, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Haidy has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, fabric conditioners, noodles, soft drinks, sugar, sanitary pads, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Haidy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, fabric conditioners, noodles, soft drinks, sugar, sanitary pads, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is 24 years old and married with two children.

Prima is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Prima requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

Prima has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Prima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Reyna Mae

texts.en:
Reyna Mae is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Reyna Mae is 29 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Reyna Mae has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Reyna Mae requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Reyna Mae has been in this business for 1 year. Reyna Mae would like to build and expand her business to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rolanor

texts.en:
Rolanor is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rolanor is 39 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Rolanor has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. 

Rolanor requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Rolanor has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Rolanor would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Albertinha

texts.en:
Albertinha is requesting a loan of USD 800 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including slippers, cooking oils, noodles, sardines, candies, eggs, soft drinks, and other things to sell. She has been doing business since 2010 with her own working capital of USD 500. 

Albertinha wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan for good management to improve her business. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin, giving her more working capital to buy more goods. She also cultivates animals, like cows, pigs, chickens, and dogs.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cooking oils, noodles, sardines, candies, eggs, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: La Banda Group

texts.es:
Arminda es una mujer de 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 5 hijos de 3, 4, 8, 13 y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de Queques.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘el Torno’ una localidad rural que agrupa a productores campesinos de carne, leche, verduras, granos, etc., y comerciantes distribuidores mayoristas que se encargan de acomodar esos productos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día en tre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Arminda es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general (sentada a la derecha, blusa celeste, agarra una cartera negra). Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y sus hijos; los 3 mayores estudian en la escuela y los 2 menores se encuentran a su cuidado. La familia vive en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Gracias a la voluntad de salir adelante por satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos, formó una banca de personas con negocios como; puesto de venta de comida, venta de chompas, venta de materiales de construcción, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, carnicería y  venta de sándwiches, para solicitar un préstamo y generar mejores utilidades. Su negocio es la venta de queques, y sus especialidades son; Queque de mandarina, Queque relleno de ganache de chocolate y frambuesa, Queque de limón con nueces y maní, Queque de almendra por y para niños, Queque con dátiles y nueces, Queque de durazno y semillas de maravilla, Queque de naranjas, Queque de yogurt y manzanas. “Para preparar un Queque  las cantidades que usemos en la receta deben ser exactas, de aquí la importancia en el uso de una balanza, tazas y cucharas medidoras…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una pastelería y dejar de vender Queques de forma ambulante. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de harina, levadura, huevos y demás insumos de pastelería por mayor, para abaratar costos y generar mejores recursos en las fiestas de fin de año.
Es por esos motivos que Arminda solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de pastelería por mayor, para vender Queques a fin de año.
texts.en:
Arminda is a 39 year-old woman who lives with her partner.  She has 5 children aged 3, 4, 8, 13, and 14.  She has a business selling cakes.  She is a good mother who is enterprising, patient, a good listener, supportive, responsible, and hardworking.  She carries out her business in the "El Torno" area, a rural place where there are farmers producing meat, milk, vegetables, grains, etc., and also wholesale distributors who take these products to the various markets in the city.  This place has a warm tropical climate that is very humid.  The temperature during the day varies between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade over the whole year.  

Arminda has a dark complexion and long black hair.  Her native tongue is Guaraní, and she also speaks Spanish.  She is seated on the right, wearing a blue blouse and holding a black purse.  She lives with her partner, who works in construction, and their children.  Their oldest 3 children attend school, and the 2 youngest ones are in her care.  The family lives in a rented house that has potable water, electricity, and sewer service. 

Because of her desire to get ahead in order to meet the needs of her children, Arminda formed a communal bank with people that have a variety of businesses, including: food sales, neighborhood store, meat shop, sandwich sales, the knitting of baby clothes, fried potato sales, and sports clothes sales.  They formed a group to request a loan so that they can generate more profits. 

Arminda's business is selling cakes, and her specialties include: mandarin cake, cake filled with chocolate ganache and raspberries, cake with lemon, nuts, and peanuts, almond cake for children, cake with dates and nuts, cake with peach and sunflower seeds, orange cake, and cake with yogurt and apples.  "In order to prepare a cake, the quantities we use in the recipe have to be exact, thus it is important to use a scale, measuring cups, and measuring spoons..." she comments.  Her dream is to have a pastry shop so she wouldn't have to sell her cakes on the street.  

Arminda wants to invest in her business by purchasing flour, yeast, eggs, and other pastry supplies at wholesale to lower her costs.  This way, she can generate more income during the year-end festivities.  This is why Arminda is requesting a loan to buy pastry supplies at wholesale, so that she can sell cakes during the holidays.

loans.use: to buy pastry supplies at wholesale to make cakes to sell during the holidays

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras, que se organizaron hace aproximadamente 2 años, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios. 
 
Melisa: Es , integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer alegre y amable, es originaria de Waspam y se trasladó a Bilwi en el período que evacuaron a toda la población del Río Coco. Tiene 45 años de edad, casada con siete hijos: Cinco son mayores de edad y dos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Con el propósito de apoyar con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 3 años estableció una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos básicos, chiverías, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chivería, sopas instantáneas, pan, huevo, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero, donde también venda mariscos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three determined women who organized themselves approximately two years ago with the goal of accessing financing to improve their living conditions, to be able to pay for basic household necessities, to ensure the education of their children, and to expand their businesses.

Melisa is a supportive member of the group. She is a joyful and courteous woman. She's a native of Waspam and moved to Bilwi during the period when the entire population of Río Coco evacuated. She is 45 years old, married, and has seven children; five of them are adults, and two are adolescents who are studying in secondary school. 

With the goal of helping with the household expenses, she established a small neighborhood shop three years ago. There, she sells staple products, sweets, sodas, and other products. She is requesting financing to buy staple grains, sweets, instant soups, bread, eggs, and other products. Her dream is to have a prosperous business where she will also sell seafood.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, sweets, instant soups, bread, eggs, and other products

loans.name: Karina Andrea

texts.en:
Karina came to the US from Ecuador five years ago. She began to work for a commercial cleaning company, where she was an outstanding employee. Her bosses saw her real potential and offered her the opportunity to become an independent contractor for their company.

Her loan of $750 will get her started in this new venture and help her build the credit history she needs to access a larger loan in the future and continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to register as an independent contractor and to build the necessary credit history to access additional capital in the future.

loans.name: Romula

texts.en:
Romula works hard to support her family. Romula is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Romula requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Romula has been in this business for 15 years now.

Romula would like to build and expand her business to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rowena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rowena has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a 49-year-old married woman with seven children from Dulag, Leyte. Four of her children are still going to school.  She engages in a food vending business. She makes and sells fried peanuts. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 5 years already. In addition to that, she also engages in selling fish, to augment her income. 

Emelita is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional supplies for her food vending business and to have additional capital for the fish vending business. These will help Emelita and her family improve her day-to-day income. This will also create higher earnings and could help pay for the family's daily expenses.

In the future, Emelita dreams of having stable sources of income and hopefully she can manage it to make it successful for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her food vending business and to have additional capital for the fish vending business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 41 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for twelve years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria, es propietaria de un comedor, vive con su sobrino, el cual ya es mayor de edad y le apoya en atender su negocio, ella abrió su negocio hace 7 años, de esta manera genera ingresos para cubrir las necesidades familiares, trabaja en un horario normal de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
El préstamo será de utilidad para comprar aceite, arroz, carnes, verduras, bebidas, etc., estos materiales son parte de su materia prima para elaborar diferentes menús, espera satisfacer a sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
Sus aspiraciones son seguir trabajando para tener los recursos con los que cancelara su deuda y tener una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Candelaria owns a cafeteria, lives with her nephew who is an adult and supports her helping in the business, she opened the business 7 years ago.  This is how she generates income to cover her family needs, she works a normal schedule from 7 am yo 4 pm.  The loan will be used to buy oil, rice, meat, vegetables, drinks, etc. these items are part of her ingredients to make different menus, she hopes to satisfy her customers, increase sales and income.
Her aspirations are to continue working to have resources to repay her debt have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, meat, vegetables, drinks, etc. these items are part of her ingredients to make different menus.

loans.name: Sezalia

texts.en:
Sezalia is 45 years old. She is married with five children aged between 7 and 18 years, all of them of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for 6 years. With the loan requested from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer so she can grow maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer so she can grow maize to sell.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Loida works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. 

Loida has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Loida hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana lives in Ermera. She is married and she has 2 children. 

She is a businesswoman. She is applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more secondhand clothes such as skirts, shirts, turtleneck shirts, and other clothes to sell, as well as shoes and handbags. 

Ana started her business in 2012 with her working capital of $400. She is earning a good income every day because she is selling in the center of the market, so many people take interest in her clothes. 

So she is very happy to do her business. She is selling secondhand clothes as well as shoes and handbags.

loans.use: To buy skirts, shirts, turtleneck shirts, and other clothes to sell, as well as shoes and handbags.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: El grupo “Mujeres Triunfadoras” constituida por 08 personas optimistas y solidarios. Josefina de 49 años es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Hace 02 años que Josefina se dedica a la venta de papa en un puesto de mercado. Así mismo como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de comida los fines de semana. Con el fin de seguir mejorando su negocio solicitó el crédito para la compra de papa amarilla, Yungay y blanca.  El grupo “Mujeres Triunfadoras” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito, pues le  permite su progreso. Josefina es la segunda del lado izquierdo y  lleva en brazo a su bebe.
texts.en:
The group “Mujeres Triunfadoras” [Triumphant Women] consists of eight optimistic and supportive people. Josefina is 49 years old and separated with two dependent children. It has been two years since Josefina began selling potatoes at a market stall. Also, as a secondary business, she sells food on weekends. 
 
With the goal of continuing to improve her business, she is requesting this loan to buy yellow, Yungay, and white potatoes. The group "Mujeres Triunfadoras" thanks the people who made this loan possible, because it allows them to progress. Josefina is the second from the left and is holding her baby in her arms.

loans.use: to buy yellow, Yungay, and white potatoes

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a 51-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

For three years Amalia has run a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

In the future, Amalia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nermie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Nermie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from rice retailing.  

Nermie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Nermie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Amie works hard to support her family.

She has a personal products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and a pig fattening businesses. 

Amie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of personal products to sell.

Amie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of personal products to sell.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 11 children, Rogelia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Rogelia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Rogelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Salvacion is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 59 years old and a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lourdes has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 44 years old. He is married with five children aged between 3 and 14years. All of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for seven years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers so he can grow maize to sell.. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers so he can grow maize to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
A USD 800 loan is offered to Angela to improve her business. She is married, has four children, and she has a mini-shop where many people come to buy every day. She will buy shirts, trousers, short trousers, long sleeve and short sleeve shirts. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Angela independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, short trousers, long sleeve and short sleeve shirts.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia, a married mother of one, sells clothes in the market, an enterprise she has been involved in since 2010. She started the business with her own working capital of $ 500.00, and earns a good income because many people like to buy her clothes. She also cultivates coffee and has animals including cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.  

Antonia is requesting a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business through the purchase of more clothes such as t-shirts, clothing, children's clothes, etc. to sell. She is happy with her business.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, clothing, children's clothes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Adeliza

texts.en:
Adeliza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Adeliza is 35 years old, and has two children who are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Adeliza requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, ice, and plastic bags.

Adeliza has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice, and plastic bags

loans.name: Melguilina

texts.en:
Melguilina is 54 years old, married, and has three children. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melguilina requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Melguilina has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgonbayar, 38 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been transporting people between districts since 2012 using their micro bus. Their elder two sons go to primary school, while the youngest one is in kindergarten. Her family lives in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy insulation materials such as felt, foam, and fiberglass for home renovation. As a result, her family will live in warm place where less coal is burned for heating, releasing less pollutants into air.

loans.use: to renovate a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, and iron, and to pay for workers.

loans.name: Cecilie

texts.en:
Cecilie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cecilie is 55 years old, and has one child in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cecilie requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Cecilie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena is 41 years old and has two children in school; she works very hard to provide for them.

Jena runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc..

Jena has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Mency

texts.en:
Ma. Mency is 54 years old and married.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Ma. Mency has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from a butcher shop.

Ma. Mency aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is 63 years old and widowed with nine children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Marlina runs a buy and sell rice in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

She has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Marlina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Tirta Kusuma Group

texts.en:
Having succeeded in the previous period, the Tirta Kusuma groups is proceeding to its next loan. Based on the assessment of MUK, the group has been granted a total loan of14.000.000 IDR, with each individual receiving 2.000.000 IDR. Because most have been able to increase their pig populations, the new loan will be used for farming. Now is the right season to start planting.

I Gusti Nyoman will use the loan to purchase chilli seeds and corn seeds. She uses her pigs' manure as an organic fertilizer. Other members do the same. 

I Gusti Nyoman hopes not only to become a big pig seller in her village, but also a successful farmer. She uses all of her profits to improve the welfare of her family and save for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase chilli seeds and corn seeds

loans.name: La Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es: Rosa de 40 años de edad es soltera. El grupo “Inmaculada Concepción”  está conformada por  08 mujeres solidarias y responsables. Ella se dedica a la venta de pollos y especerías. Gracias a su constante dedicación ha logrado mejorar su casa. Tiene planeado poner otro puesto de venta en un mercado. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de pollo, ají, sillao y ajos. El grupo “Inmaculada Concepción” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Rosa se encuentra sentada, es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo rosado.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old and single. The "Inmaculada Concepción" group is made up of eight supportive and responsible women. Rosa sells chickens and spices. Thanks to her constant dedication, she has been able to improve her home. She plans to start another food stall at a market. She asked for the loan to buy chicken, peppers, soy sauce, and garlic. 

The “Inmaculada Concepción” group is grateful to the people who have made this loan possible. Rosa is the one seated, second on the left, wearing a pink t-shirt.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, peppers, soy sauce, and garlic.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Наверху фотография женщины по имени Махбуба. Ей 40 лет. Она мать одиночка. Махбуба с двумя сыновьями и дочкой проживает на районе Гиссар. Махбуба работает портнихой и этим она зарабатывает на жизнь и жизнь своих детей. Она уже 5 лет работает в данной сфере и уже полностью освоилась. Причина, по которой Махбуба обратилась за кредитом, является ремонт дома. Она старалась до последнего собрать деньги, чтобы по быстрее отремонтировать дом. Она видит выход из положения только в получении кредита. У Махбубы маленькие дети и биться за них. Поддержите Махбубу!
texts.en: The photograph above depicts a woman by the name of Mahbuba. She is 40 years old and a single mother. Mahbuba and her two sons and a daughter live in the Gissar district. Mahbuba works as a seamstress and this is how she earns a living for herself and her children. She has been working in this field for 5 years and has gotten very familiar with it. The reason for Mahbuba's request for this loan is a repair of her house. She has been trying to save money in order to fix her house quicker. She sees obtaining this loan as the only resolution. Mahbuba has young children and has to fight for them. Please support Mahbuba!

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Maria Felicitas

texts.es: María es una mujer de 66 años de edad que se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar por medio de su negocio de elaboración y venta de tamales, quesadillas y tortillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus productos. Ella habita en vivienda propia al lado de su hijo de 40 años de edad  y sus 3 nietos uno de 7 y 2 de 16 años de edad que son gemelos. María siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer que siempre se ha esforzado en salir adelante con su familia, por lo que desea invertir en su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: queso, maíz, pollo, tomates, harina de arroz, azúcar, huevos, etc. Para seguir elaborando sus deliciosos platillos que tanto gustan a su clientela. Agradece estar muy agradecida con el apoyo que se le dio con el primer crédito dado que gracias a este apoyo ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en:
María, age 66, puts forth great effort to support her household through her business of making and selling tamales, quesadillas, and tortillas.  She has been engaged in this business activity for eight years.  Therefore, she has a lot of customers who always seek her products.

She lives in her own house with her 40 year old son and her three grandchildren.  One of them is 7, and two are 16 because they are twins.  

María has always stood out as being a woman who has always put forth a lot of effort to get her family ahead.  She wishes to invest in her business in order to get better earnings.  In order to do so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cheese, corn, chicken, tomatoes, rice flour, sugar, and eggs, etc.  She will do this in order to continue making her delicious dishes that her customers like so much.

She is very grateful for the support that was given to her with the first loan.  Thanks to this support she has managed to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cheese, corn, chicken, tomatoes, rice flour, sugar, and eggs, etc. to make her delicious dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two sewing machines and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, opta por un nuevo préstamo para tener recursos con los que comprara vitaminas, antibióticos, analgésicos, etc., busca tener surtido su inventario para abastecer a sus clientes y seguir mejorando su situación financiera.
 El buen uso del préstamo anterior la facilitado tener nuevos clientes, mejorar la mercadería, cambiar las circunstancias familiares y mantener un buen record crediticio.
texts.en:
Victor chooses to get a new loan in order to have the resources to buy vitamins, antibiotics, and analgesics, etc.  He is looking to have his inventory stocked in order to supply his customers and to continue improving his financial situation.

The good use of the previous loan facilitated his getting new customers, improving the merchandise, changing his family’s circumstances, and maintaining a good credit record.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, antibiotics, and analgesics, etc. to stock his inventory and supply his customers.

loans.name: Delmy Elizabeth

texts.es: Delmy tiene 27 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida con su negocio de un taller de electrónica en el cual repara televisores, aparatos de sonido, teléfonos celulares, etc. Delmy desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda que desde hace algún tiempo está presentando filtraciones, además desea repellar las paredes de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, pines, cemento y arena para cambiar el techo y repellar las paredes de su vivienda, para lo que espera contar con el apoyo de este crédito sabiendo que podrá pagar las cuotas con las ganancias de su negocio.
texts.en:
Delmy is 27 years old. She lives in her own house along with her husband and two children, ages 5 and 2 years old.  She earns her living working in her electronics repair shop,  where she repairs televisions, sound systems, cellular phones, etc. 

Delmy wants to change the roof on her house which, for quite a while, has had leaks. She also wants to plaster the walls in the house. She is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheeting, fasteners, cement, and sand to replace the roof and plaster the walls of her house. She hopes to have the support of this loan, knowing that she will be able to pay the installment payments with the earnings of her business.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, fasteners, cement, and sand to change the roof and to plaster the walls of her  house.

loans.name: Sol De Cultura Y Progreso Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Sol De Cultura Y Progreso” conformado por 05 socios dinámicos y emprendedores. Maribel de 38 años de edad  es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica  a la venta de pollos y pavos. Hace más de 07 años que viene desempeñándose en dicho negocio. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado crecer en su negocio captando mayores clientes. Su mayor anhelo es diversificar su negocio como la venta de pescado. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de pollos y pavos. El grupo “Sol De Cultura Y Progreso” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar este crédito. Maribel es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo rojo.
texts.en:
The Sol De Cultura Y Progreso group is comprised of five dynamic and enterprising members. Maribel, age 38, is married and has two dependent children.  

She sells chickens and turkeys.  She has been working in this business for seven years.  Thanks to her effort, she has managed to grow in her business by gaining more customers.  Her biggest desire is to diversify her business by selling fish.

She requested the loan to buy chickens and turkeys.

The Sol De Cultura Y Progreso group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for facilitating this loan.  Maribel is the first one on the left, and she is wearing a red shirt.

loans.use: to buy chickens and turkeys.

loans.name: Dina Argelia

texts.es:
Dina, es una persona que con ayuda de préstamos ha ido mejorando su negocio, con la facilidad que ofrece hoy en día la institución a través de la Línea Especial de la Tercera edad en Kiva ella continuara progresando,  en esta oportunidad solicita capital para comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, bebidas, etc. y productos para la ferretería,  al tener un buen inventario continuara trabajando y generando ingresos para subsistir.
 El financiamiento anterior le ayudo a la señora Dina a ofrecer nuevos productos y a mantener en el mercado su ferretería, la familia se mantiene, gozan de buena salud y le apoyan en sus actividades.
texts.en:
Dina is a person who, with the help of loans, has worked to improve her business. She has done this with ease given the offers of the institution Linea Especial de la Tercera edad (Special Line for Seniors) through Kiva, and she will continue to progress. In this instance, she is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, candies, bread, drinks, etc, and hardware products, in order to have a good inventory and continue working and generating an income to support herself.

The former loan helped Señora Dina to offer new products, and to keep her hardware store in the market. Her family is maintained and enjoy good health, and they support her in her work.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, bread, drinks, etc. and hardware products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, refreshments, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Zoila Marina

texts.es:
Zoila, está preparando todo lo necesario para la época navideña y no cuenta con el capital necesario,  por tal razón solicita apoyo con un nuevo préstamo para comprar repollos, tomates, chiles, manzanas, papayas, uvas, etc., frescas y de calidad para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos, así trabajara y tendrá un negocio más competitivo.
La ayuda de préstamos le da a Zoila la oportunidad de tener un negocio estable y rentable para generar los ingresos que tanto necesita para cambiar las circunstancias familiares y disminuir sus deudas.
texts.en:
Zoila is preparing everything that is necessary for the Christmas season, and she does not have the necessary capital.  For that reason she is requesting the support of a new loan to buy cabbages, tomatoes, chiles, apples, papayas, grapes, etc., fresh and of quality so that her customers are satisfied.  Thereby, she will work and will have a more competitive business.  

The help from the loans gives Zoila the opportunity to have a stable and profitable business to generate the much needed income to change the family circumstances and reduce her debts.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, tomatoes, chiles, apples, papayas, grapes, etc., fresh and of quality so that her customers are satisfied.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 50 years old and has three children. She is a widowed woman and has one child in school.

Aida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aida has been raising pigs for one year now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Aida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from tailoring. Nenita is borrowing PHP 24,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Гулшан, 44 года, вдова, есть дочь и новорожденная внучка. У Гулшан высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается реализацией золота, стартовав в 2012 году. Благодаря упорному труду Гулшан, на сегодняшний день ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет в среднем 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулшан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ювелирных украшений, так как в предпраздничные дни наблюдается большой спрос. Доходы от кредита Гулшан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы накопить на образование дочери и внучки.
texts.en: Gulshan is 44 years old, a widow and has a daughter and a newborn granddaughter. Gulshan has a college education and, to provide the primary source of income for her family, has been involved in selling gold since 2012. Thanks to Gulshan's hard work, today her monthly profit amounts to an average of 20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Gulshan requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy jewelry because it will be in high demand during the holidays. Gulshan plans to invest the earnings into further developing her business in order to save for her daughter's and granddaughter's education.

loans.use: to increase her selection of jewelry for resale in order to be more profitable and save money for her daughter's and granddaughter's higher education

loans.name: Las Pollitas Group

texts.es: Las Pollitas es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras que solicitan por primera vez el financiamiento de la institución para incrementar el capital de trabajo. A este grupo lo coordina Maribel una joven de 20 años de edad, acompañada y madre de un hijo, quien es su mayor fuerza para su superación, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva en el mercado de Granada desde hace dos años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de talladores, camiseta cuello V, blusas, pantalones, licras, etc. Su equipo de trabajo lo integra Dilma de 29 años de edad, y quien comercializa frutas y verduras en una plaza del Centro Comercial de la Capital, y Elba de 57 años de edad, propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace un año.
texts.en: Las Pollitas is a solidarity group consisting of 3 members that seek their first loan from the institution to have working capital for their businesses. This group is coordinated by 20 year old Maribel. She is married and has a son, who is her inspiration to succeed. She has sold new clothing in the Granada market for 11 years. The loan will be used to buy v-neck t-shirts, blouses, pants, nylons, etc.  Her group colleagues are 29 year old Dilma who sells fruits and vegetables in the central market plaza in the capital, and 57 year old Elba who has owned a convenience store in her home for a year.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Palabra De Mujer Group

texts.es: Segundina de 53 años de edad es separada con 06 hijos independientes. Este es el grupo “Palabra De Mujer” La cual  está constituida por 08 socios solidarios y dinámicos. Segundina se dedica a la venta de gas domestico. Así mismo como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de aceitunas los fines de semana. Su mayor deseo es implementar su negocio de abarrotes. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de balones de gas y aceitunas. El grupo “Palabra de Mujer” agradece a todas las personas que facilitaron este crédito. Segundina es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste blusa plomo.
texts.en: Segundina is 53 years old, separated, and has 6 grown children. The group "Palabra de Mujer" consists of 8 united and dynamic members. Degundina sells domestic gas. As a second business she sells olives on the weekends. Her greatest dream is to open a grocery store business. She seeks a loan to buy cylinders of gas and olives. The "Palabra de Mujer" group is thankful to the people who facilitate this loan. Segundina is the first person on the left side wearing a grey blouse

loans.use: to buy cylinders of gas and olives.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Evelyn has a buy-and-sell used shoes business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of used shoes to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Fredis

texts.es:
Carlos, opta por un nuevo financiamiento para comprar huevos, detergentes, lejía, jabón, bebidas y otros productos al por mayor para continuar realizando sus recorridos y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, el resto le será de utilidad para dar mantenimiento a su vehículo, así trabajara con seguridad.
Su negocio está mucho mejor, los nuevos clientes están satisfechos con sus servicios, su familia tiene un nivel de vida más confortable y tiene una buena calificación crediticia.
texts.en:
Carlos requested a new loan to buy eggs, detergent, soap, drinks and other products at wholesale to continue with his route and cover the needs of her clients, the rest will be used for maintenance of his vehicle, this way he can work with safety.
His business is doing much better, the new customers are satisfied with his services and his family has a more comfortable lifestyle, he has a good credit score.

loans.use: to buy eggs, detergent, soap, drinks and other products at wholesale to continue with his route.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, iron and pay for labor.

loans.name: Bismona Group

texts.es:
Este grupo grupo solidario que ha tomado el nombre de una comunidad miskita cuyo significado es Icaco de la parte oeste.  El icaco en la planta que da frutos con el mismo nombre que crece en las costas. Está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Elsa Juana, Andrea y Skarlet Jorlenne), viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron hace 4 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana  para poder tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.
 
Elsa Juana: Es una mujer cordial, coordinadora del Grupo Solidario BISMONA, casada, tiene 55 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, mayores de edad. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo de manera ambulante, gracias a los créditos anteriores que Pana Pana le ha brindado, ha podido diversificar sus ingresos de diferentes fuentes: construir poco a poco 6 cuartos de madera que los alquila y la venta ambulante de los productos de belleza. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua: cremas, perfumes, prendas de oro laminado, acero, entre otros productos, así poder ofertar más productos e incrementar sus ingresos. Su sueño llegar a tener una tienda donde pueda vender los productos que actualmente oferta de manera ambulante y construir más apartamentos para alquiler.
texts.en:
This solidarity group has taken the name of a miskita community whose name means Icaco from the western part.  The icaco is a plant, that bears fruits with the same name, on the coasts.  It is made of three enterprising women (Elsa Juan, Andrea, y Skarlet Jorienne).  They live the city of Bilwi.  They formed four months ago with the aim of working in solidarity to be able to access loans from Pana Pana to be able to have the opportunity to improve their small businesses, improve their incomes, and, thereby, improve their families' quality of life.

Elsa Juan:  She is a friendly women, coordinator of the Solidarity Group BISMONA, married, 55 years old, and has three adult children.  With the objective of having her own source of income, two years ago she began making a living selling beauty products through a street vending catalog.  Thanks to the previous loans that Pana Pana has provided her, she has been able to diversify her income from different sources: gradually building six wooden rooms that she rents and the street vending of beauty products.  
 
She is requesting funding to buy in Managua: creams, perfumes, gold plated jewelry, steel, among other products, and thus be able to offer more products and increase her income.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell the products that she currently sells on the street and to build more apartments to rent.

loans.use: To buy in Managua: creams, perfumes, gold plated jewelry, steel, among other products.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hilda is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.



Hilda has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Hilda requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials to use in her business.



Hilda has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Hilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials to use in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial stove and improve the quality of the products she offers and taking care of her health.

loans.name: Santos Thony

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive don Santos, tiene 49 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 23 y 22 años de edad los mismos que estudian en universidad. La esposa es ama de casa y le ayuda en su trabajo.
El señor Santos tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz y un local en el cual vende repuestos y refacciones para automóviles los mismos que el utiliza para realizar su trabajo, con esto el asegura sus ventas ya que la mayoría le comprar a él los repuestos, su especialidad es parte electrónica y computarizada de los automóviles, son muchos los clientes que llegan hasta su taller para que les realice sus trabajos ya que no hay muchos técnicos que arreglan este tipo de daños en los vehículos. Su esposa le ayuda en su trabajo al igual que sus hijos cuando ellos pueden, el lleva con su negocio  por más de 6 años el cual lo tiene en un local alquilado.
Este crédito es para comprar ciertos repuestos eléctricos que necesita para surtir su negocio.  Lleva tres años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación  a otros bancos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio para ya no pagar arriendos.
texts.en:
The Crédito Productivo group meets every 15 days in Montecristi, an area known for its rich precolonial culture and artisan works which are nationally and internationally renown. It is the place of the famous straw hats.

It is here that 49 year old Santos lives, married, and has two children ages 23 and 22 who study in the university. His spouse is a housewife and helps his with his work. Santos has an automotive repair shop and a locale where he sells parts and repairs for automobiles, the same that he uses to do his work. With this he ensures sales as the majority of purchases are parts, and his specialty is electronic and computerized automobile parts. There are many customers who arrive to his shop for him to work on their vehicles as there are not many people who can fix this type of vehicle damage. His wife helps him with the work and also his children help when they can. He has had this business for more than 6 years in a rented locale.

This loan will be used to buy certain electrical parts that he needs to stock his business. He has been in the Grupo de Credito for 3 years and he likes it because the interest rates are low as compared to other banks. His dreams are to have his own locale and not pay rent.

loans.use: to buy electrical parts.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
San Rafael es un grupo muy unido y trabajador, que se esfuerza por poder ir mejorando, ellas están en su ciclo numero 20, y han ido creciendo gracias al trabajo de todas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juliana, quien en su última encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, mostró un nivel tres, es decir que ha mejorado bastante. Ella es la presidenta de este grupo, quien siempre trata de motivar a las miembros del grupo, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas, es una mujer muy trabajadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas frescas de estación, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en: San Rafael is a very united and hard-working group who strives to be able to continuously improve. They are in their 20th cycle and have been growing thanks to everyone's work. One of the members is Juliana, who in her last poverty elimination survey demonstrated a level 3, which indicates she has improved quite a bit. She is the president of the group; she always tries to motivate the group members. She has a business selling fruit and is a very hard-working woman. She seeks this loan to be able to buy seasonal fresh fruit and in this way be able to continue with her work as she has been doing. She is thankful for this opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es una mujer emprendedora que pone todo su esfuerzo y creatividad en su negocio de elaboración y venta de tamales y quesadillas actividad que decidió realizar hace 5 años y gracias a la cual ha logrado sostener a su familia. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 nietas de 15 y 14 años de edad, que son su mayor alegría. Margarita desea seguir con su negocio, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar nuevamente un crédito a  FUSAI para invertir en la  compra de: harina, azúcar, maíz, queso, pollo, tomates, chile verde, etc. con el fin de aumentar susventas y ganancias. Gracias al apoyo que recibió en el pasado pudo mejorar sus condiciones  habitacionales.
texts.en:
Margarita is an enterprising woman who puts all of her effort and creativity into her business of making and selling tamales and quesadillas.  This is a job that she decided to begin five years ago, and thanks to it has managed to support her family.  She lives in her own house together with her husband and their two granddaughters, 15 and 14 years old, who are her greatest joy.

Margarita wants to continue with her business, and that is why she has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI again to invest in buying flour, sugar, corn, cheese, chicken, tomatoes, green peppers, etc. to increase her sales and profits.  Thanks to the support that she received in the past, she could improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, corn, cheese, chicken, tomatoes, green peppers, etc. to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más ganado para seguir con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young man is in a blurry photo because of his 22 year old age and for living in a high risk zone, he works raising cattle, has done so for several years. He sells the products in different markets, he lives at home with his family in a house they own, he is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to continue with his work and have better income.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Carmen Jacqueline

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 43 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 17 y 15 años, el mayor estudia en universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Carmen se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí también vende artículos de bazar, helados y productos de catálogos (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00, en su local también vende sus otros productos, sus hijos le ayudan en su labor cuando ellos están desocupados. Tiene 7años con su negocio el cual le permite ganar lo suyo que lo utiliza para los estudios de sus hijos que son para ella lo más importante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y cosméticos. Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta porque los créditos son muy necesarios y le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Crédito Productivo meets every 15 days in the region Montecristi, an area known for its rich pre-columbian history and for its artisanal works renowned both on a national and internal level. They are also famous for their straw hats.

Carmen lives here. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children who are 19, 17 and 15 years old. The oldest goes to university and the younger ones are in high school. Her husband is a driver.

Carmen makes a living by running a grocery store from her home. She also sells bazaar items, ice cream and catalog items (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She works every day from 7am to 9pm. Her children help her run the store when they are not busy. She has run her store for 7 years. The earnings she makes from her business help her pay for her children's studies which, for her, come first.

This loan will be used to stock her store and purchase more rice, sugar, detergent and cosmetics. She has been a member with the communal bank group since its inception and she likes it because the loans are much needed and help her a lot. Her dream is to see her children have professional careers.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent and cosmetics.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Leonora is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Leonora has a buy-and-sell used shoes business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy used shoes to sell.

Leonora has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Lateefah

texts.en:
Lateefah is a conservative woman, she asked her son Anas to appear in the photo instead of her.
Lateefah is a mother for five children, they live in Al Rusaifeh. one of her sons is a 20 years old student his name is Anas. he is studying to get his diploma degree in Business Administration and he is in her second year. Ana's future plan is to continue studying to get his bachelor's degree and work in the field. Lateefah is applying for a loan to help her son cover her semester fees.

loans.use: To help her son cover her semester fees.

loans.name: Tekoporave Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tekoporave está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento, es una zona eminentemente rural, que está luchando por crecer.
La Sra. Josefa es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas varias, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se esta esforzando por poder salir adelante y dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Josefa quiere seguir creciendo, y es por eso que pide este préstamo, para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, y así seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group Tekoporave is made up of a committee of women and it is in its second cycle. They live in the city Concepcion, located in an area a little far from the central zone that is still experiencing growth. It is a rural zone and it is fighting hard to develop.

Mrs. Josefa is one of the group members and she makes a living selling clothing. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to get ahead. She wants to give her family all that she could not have. Josefa wants to continue growing her business and that is why she needs this loan; to purchase a variety of clothing for resale. This is how she will continue to run her business and do what she is doing.

loans.use: purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
En el comité Maria Auxiliadora, la mujeres quienes la integran se caracterizan por la destreza, dedicación y esfuerzo que ponen en sus labores y por sus ganas de ir escalando cada vez más. Son de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona eminentemente rural, que está luchando por crecer.
Una de las integrantes de este comité es la señora Maria, es muy activa, cría animales y también tiene un almacén donde ofrece productos de las necesidades básicas del hogar, es muy guapa y genera entusiasmo en sus compañeras.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder surtir su negocio, como ser verduras, frutas, aceites, panificados y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The women who make up the Maria Auxiliadora Committee are characterized by their skill, dedication, and effort they put into their jobs, and for their desire to keep climbing higher and higher all the time.  They are from the city of Santaní, a particularly rural area, that's striving to grow.

One of the members, Maria, is very active.  She raises animals and has her own grocery store where she sells basic home necessities.  She is very interesting and generates enthusiasm among her companions.  

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of supplies to stock up her store, including vegetables, fruits, oils, baked goods, etc., so she can continue with her work as she's been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, oil, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Conavi Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Conavi Poty está integrada por 17 mujeres y sostienen como pilares fundamentales la solidaridad, cooperación, comunicación y responsabilidad, son mujeres muy luchadoras y luchadoras.
Una de las integrantes de este comité es la señora Yohanna, es muy activa, y se desempeña como limpiadora y es cocinera a la vez en la empresa privada. Este trabajo le posibilita seguir una carrera universitaria, y está  pensando invertir el préstamo que pide en el montaje de una peluquería para diversificar su ingreso, es muy guapa, cumple el rol de tesorera dentro del grupo y genera entusiasmo en sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The group Conavi Poty is formed by 17 women, their main supporting pillars are solidarity, cooperation, communication and responsibility, they are very hardworking women.
One of the members of the group is Yohanna, she is very active and works cleaning and cooking in a private company.  This job allows her to study a university career, she is thinking of investing the loan in setting up a hair salon to diversify her income, she is very good looking, fulfills the role of treasurer in the group and generates enthusiasm among her group members.

loans.use: to invest in setting up a hair salon.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Elvira de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su nieto, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Elvira está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar concentrado para los cerdos y así poder continuar con la crianza de los mismo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elvira is 51 years old and lives in her own house with her three children and baby boy. She earns a living raising pigs. With the income she earns, she's able to get ahead with her household expenses.

Elvira is seeking a loan to be able to buy concentrate for the pigs, continuing their growth and earning a better income.

loans.use: to buy concentrate for pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities, like bread, powdered milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, canned goods, bath soap, and seasonings. She is a mother of six children. The oldest child is 20 and the youngest is two. She has been operating a sari-sari store for almost 20 years now.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stocks for the store, like noodles, canned goods, biscuits, and toiletries. These stocks will fill her store, causing her to attract more customers. She can now provide her children with nutritious diets and better living conditions.

In the future, Jocelyn dreams to expand her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store, like noodles, canned goods, biscuits, and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medical treatment, to pay for medical consultation.

loans.name: Manos Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Manos Emprendedoras, está en el  ciclo número 5° del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, a través del cual quieren conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder seguir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la  Sra. Blanca, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida, que con mucho trabajo pudo montar y que hoy día es el medio del sostén de su familia. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que quiere seguir con su trabajo, es por eso que pide este préstamo, para poder comprar verduras, carne, pollo, frutas y demás.
Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group Manos Emprendedoras (Enterprising Hands) is in it 5th cycle of the women's committee program.  They are doing a survey on the elimination of poverty, through which they want to know the situation of each person and according to it be able to continue growing.  

One of the member is Blanca, who has a well stocked pantry, that with hard work can overcome, and who today is means of providing for her family.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman, who wants to continue her job.  That it why she is requesting this loan to be able to buy vegetables, beef, chicken, fruit, and more.

She is thankful for the opportunity that they are receiving, and it will help her a lot.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, beef, chicken, fruit, and more.

loans.name: Maa Panchakhanda Shg Group

texts.en:
Ranjita is a member of the Maa Panchakhanda Self-help Group of a small village in Sambalpur district of Odisha. She has stories to tell about how she made her living and gradually improved her lifestyle by making leaf plates. She, along with her husband, prepares leaf plates and sells them in the local market.

The business of leaf plates had begun long before she got training from Peoples Forum, but the business did not flourish because of lack of capital. It was through joining hands with Peoples Forum that her business got the much-needed push to witness progress. The family now owns a concrete house and wishes to sell their leaf plates in the main market rather than local market.

The production has subsequently increased, as they now have their vehicle to take the produce to the market. She now does not have to worry about her children's study expenses. It is she who has started the habit of saving money in her family. With the course of time, she now prepares leaf plates of different sizes and according to the demands of various customers. She, along with her husband, even sells these leaf plates to various sweets shops, small stalls selling eatables, etc.

Now she will use her loan portion to buy a leaf plate-making machine to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy a leaf plate-making machine to increase her production.

loans.name: Tseren-Ochir

texts.en:
Tseren-Ochir, 43 years old, lives with his wife in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as maintenance engineer at power plant since 1999. His wife is a physician at a high school, working for 14 years. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, and fiberglass for house renovation. After renovation, he and his wife will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, releasing fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Sri Ganesh Shg Group

texts.en:
20-year-old Puja makes a living by selling fruits and vegetables in the town where she lives. She is the mother of two children, aged 3 and 1 years. She has been making a living from fruits and vegetables sales for four years. Her husband helps in this activity.

This is her first loan with Peoples Forum. She will use it to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk to resell.

She wants to be able to grow her business and attend to her clients better. For this reason, she will save up in order to adapt her house to cater for the needs of her business and be able to establish her own vending store for fruits and vegetables.

She is the President of the “Sri Ganesh Shg” group, which has 14 members. Each of the members has a different business and they are all from the same community. They work together for the good of the children and elderly people in the village.

Each member will receive 15,000 INR. The person who leads the group (Puja) is shown in the photograph and is seated with her hand raised.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk to resell

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
San Juan está en su ciclo numero décimo segundo, están trabajando de manera unida y se ayudan siempre las unas a las otras. Son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener, y por ello se están sacrificando mucho.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Martha, quien con mucho esfuerzo esta luchando por su familia, es una mujer que sobresale del grupo por su entusiasmo, ya que ella quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento, que es la venta de remedios naturales. Ella comenta que es un trabajo muy humilde, pero que lo hace para poder tener un medio honesto para sostener a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de remedios naturales, y de esa forma seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
San Juan is in its 10th cycle, working together and helping each other. They are female heads of families that want to give their loved ones all that they couldn't have, therefore they sacrifice a lot.

One of the members is Martha, who with great effort is fighting for her family. She is a woman who stands out in the group for her enthusiasm, as she wants to improve her living conditions and continue growing in her business, which is selling natural medicines. She states that it is very humble work, but that she does it in order to have an honest way to support her family. She seeks this loan to buy natural medicines, and in this way continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora, a 52-year-old married mother of four, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For five years she has been buying and selling scrap in the Philippines.

Leonora has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy more scrap to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy scrap to sell

loans.name: Mahuli Maa Shg Group

texts.en:
Kalpana is the president for this group of women. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband works as a farmer. She has had a cereals and spices reselling business for the last five years. She earns 3,000 INR per month from this activity. She wants to expand her business so that she would be able to help her husband financially.

Kalpana will use this loan to buy cereals and spices in bulk to resell. This fine lady runs several activities at the same time, and in the future envisions hiring at least one employee to assist her.

Profits will enable her to take care of her family and pursue her activities.

loans.use: to buy cereals and spices in bulk to resell

loans.name: Jay Ganesh Shg Group

texts.en:
Sabina, 21, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in a small village in Koraput district of Odisha state. Her husband is a worker in a local company. She earns an income running a general store in the front of her house. 

She is the group leader of a ten-member loan group that resides in same village where she lives. In the picture, she is seated with her hand raised. All of the group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.
