Sabina is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of products such as food and beverages to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. 

Sabina hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family. She also hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to restock her store

loans.name: Santoshi Maa Shg Group

texts.en:
The group is called Santoshi Maa Shg, which is the name of a famous Goddess. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change their future for the better. 

Mukta is a group leader, aged 42. She is widowed and has two children aged 14 years and 11 years old. Both go to school. She has a shop and has been running the business for 10 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, and biscuits to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Dangardevi Shg Group

texts.en:
The Self Help Group consists of 10 inspiring women on a journey of dignity and to improve the quality of life of each member. They have the desire to overcome poverty in each one of the poverty elimination program indicators.

One of the members is Padma. She is 22 years old mother of two children. She always has a positive attitude and works every day making and selling traditional foods of Odisha such as bada, idli, puri, upma, etc. Her level of income is improving. 

In addition, she comments that she also has a secondary job cleaning the school. She is a very good artisan, and above all a young person. She seeks a loan to buy flour, rice flour, sugar, edible oil, and other food making supplies in order to be able to continue making and selling foods.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice flour, sugar, edible oil and other food making supplies in order to be able to continue making and selling foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school expenses such as school tuition.

loans.name: Tripati Swami - 2 Group

texts.en:
Ananta is an active married lady of 47 years of age, resident of a rural village named Muniguda in the Rayagada district of Odisha, India. The lady standing second from left with her hand raised  in the photograph is Ananta. She resides with her husband and two sons. 

To increase the income of her family, Ananta, along with other four likeminded women of her locality, formed a group and wish to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

Ananta is doing a dry fish business with the support of her husband for the last eight years. Nowadays, both of her sons are also supporting the business. At present the monthly household income is 7,000  INR. The monthly income hardly meets the monthly expenses. 

Ananta understands that to increase income, the business should grow. Hence Ananta wants a loan with an affordable cost. From the loan she will purchase dry fish in a large quantity from Andhra Pradesh. She has a dream to be a wholesaler of dry fish in her locality.

Other four members of the group are doing a tiffin stall, a fish business, a fancy store and an audio/video CD business. The loan will definitely change the income level of the members.

loans.use: purchase dry fish in a large quantity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de arena, hierro, cemento, piedrin

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille is 42 years old. She is married with five children aged between 2 and 14 years. Two of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for seven years. With the loan requested from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer for the maize that they will sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase her standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the maize that they will sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 49 years old. He is married with eight children aged between 2 and 19 years. Six of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 17 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer for the maize that they will sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the maize that they will sell

loans.name: Tripati Swami - 1 Group

texts.en:
This group comprises six members from a small rural village called Muniguda in the district of Rayagada of Odisha, one of the backward districts in India, mainly known for drought and underdevelopment. 

The lady standing third from left with her hand raised in the photo is one of the members named Jasabanti. She is 40 years old, living with her husband, one son and one daughter aged about 11 and 16. Jasabanti hails from a very poor, landless, illiterate, and belongs to another backward caste category. 

She is running a fancy store with the support of her husband. In a month her family earns about 8,000 INR which is not sufficient to manage her family. So Jasabanti wants to increase her income by adding some extra stock of fancy and cosmetic items. She wants to have enough stock for supporting her business to run for long days. Jasabanti wants to utilize the present loan for purchasing more stock of soap, shampoo, nail polish, deodorant, talcum powder, small solar lights, pen, etc .

Jasabanti dreams to send her children to English medium school for better education. She also wants to complete her half constructed house. The other five members of her group are belongs to the same community and do a fish business, leaf plate making and selling, and a hotel.

loans.use: to purchase soap, shampoo, nail polish, deodorant, talcum powder, small solar lights, pen, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a couple of cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three calves.

loans.name: Maa Bhairabi Group

texts.en:
In this year 2014, a women entrepreneur named Mamata of Muniguda village of Rayagada district in Odisha, India formed a group named “ Maa Bhairabi” with five other women of her locality, with the intervention of Mahashakti Foundation. 

The lady seating third from left, raising her hand in the photo, is Mamata. She is 38 years old living with her husband and one daughter and one son aged 8 & 9 years. She belongs to a Below Poverty Line family (BPL), a segment living on less than a dollar a day. 

Mamata is doing a  leaf plate business with the support of her husband. Mamata is collecting leafs and steaching them at home and her husband is moving to different villages to sell them. Mamata herself started this enterprise four years ago on a small scale and has been working hard to grow her business. 

Her family earns a monthly income of 4,500 INR which is very hard to manage the family with educational, domestic and business expenses. Due to lack of finance she is not being able to complete the construction of her house. 

So Mamata is planning to expand her business. From the present loan she will purchase a huge stock of leafs and leaf plates. Mamata dreams of completing the construction of her house and giving a better education to her children. 

The other five members of the group, are doing vegetable vending, mutton business, and leaf plate making.

loans.use: will purchase a huge stock of leafs and leaf plates

loans.name: Maa Majhigouri Group

texts.en:
Jayanti, aged 23 years, is a self-motivated, active woman entrepreneur of Muniguda village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a very hard working lady seating at the second from left of the front line in the photo with a raised hand. She resides with her husband, and a son of two years old. 

Jayanti has been running a vegetables and fruits business for the last four years.  Her husband is also supporting the business. Initially Jayanti started this business with a small investment of her own. When Mahashakti Foundation started working in her village, she motivated other seven women entrepreneurs  to form a group named “Maa Majhi Gouri” and apply for a loan for the development of their businesses. 

Now Jayanti’s income is 6,500 INR per month, but it is not at all sufficient to meet the house hold expenses. So for further development she will take a loan. From this loan she will purchase tomatoes, brinjals (eggplants), carrots, bananas, apples, oranges, and other vegetables and fruits. Jayanti hopes to construct a permanent cabin for her business and a good house for her family. 

The other seven members are doing a dairy, vegetable vending, a leaf plate business, and a fruits business.

loans.use: purchase tomatoes, brinjals, carrots, bananas, apples, oranges, and other vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ceramic and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres activas  esta en su Quinto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza donde 5 de las 17 señoras  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de ellas es la señora  Lilian, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que indica que hay varios indicadores que debe mejorar, y todo esto podrá ligrar por medio de su esfuerzo. Ella se dedica a la venta de leche, y comenta que pide este prestamo para poder comprar leche en cantidad, y asi poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo
texts.en:
The "Active Women" group is in their fifth cycle of the Women's Committee program, in which all of them promised to work and help each other to get ahead. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey, in which 5 of the 17 ladies live below the poverty line.

One of them is Señora Lilian, who proved to be in poverty level one in the survey, which indicates that there are various factors that she must improve. All this she will be able to achieve through her efforts. 

She works selling milk, and she says that she is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy milk in bulk so that she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell

loans.name: Los Picaflores De Los Chacos Group

texts.es:
Aglae es una mujer de 34 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es generosa, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por el comercio informal en todas las áreas. De clima cálido tropical y húmedo con una temperatura que varía durante el dia entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Aglae es de tez trigueña, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio (al centro, usa polera celeste, pantalón corto celeste y cartera negra). Su vida la comparte con su hijo que ya terminó la escuela y quiere continuar estudiando, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Los deseos de superación y las ganas de ayudar a su hijo para que estudie, la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de chompas, venta de materiales de construcción, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio y carnicería, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus sueños y sus metas. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional cruceña, como; MASACO DE PLÁTANO (plátano frito, carne molida en tacú), Arroz con queso (arroz mezclado con queso derretido, se sirve con carne a la parrilla), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Chicharrón de Taitetu (Chanchitos de monte ”taitetú” frito), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui), etc. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana para la hora de almuerzo y para la cena. “cocino desde que erea muy joven, ahora me independizé y necesito mobiliario y utensilios para atender a mis clientes…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante amplio para que sus clientes se sientan comodos y sean constantes. Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes y generar mejores ingresos. Esta es la sexta secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Aglae solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Aglae is a 34 year old single woman with an 18 year old son. She has a business selling traditional food.

She is generous, patient, a good listener, strong, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in the southern zone of the city, an area known for all kinds of informal businesses. The area has a warm and humid tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Aglae has a dark complexion, long dark hair, and her first language is Guarani and her second is Spanish which she uses daily and in business. She is in the middle of the picture, wearing a blue shirt and blue pants. She shares her life with a son who has finished school and wants to continue studying. They live in a rented house with potable water, electricity and septic system. She has the desire to be successful and help her son continue his studies. This inspired her to form a communal bank, and the members have business such as selling sweaters, selling construction materials, weaving baby clothing, selling French fries, selling athletic clothing, neighborhood store and butcher shop. They seek a loan to make their dreams reality and reach their goals.

Her business is selling tradition food such as: “masaco de platano” (fried plantain, ground meat), rice and cheese (rice mixed with shredded cheese served with grilled meat), “sopa de remojado” (bone soup), “Chicharrón de Taitetu” (fried rinds of the taitetu, a pig native to the area), “Cogete relleno” (chicken neck stuffed with potato), etc. She works every day of the week for lunch and dinner. She states, “I have been cooking since I was very young. Now I am self-sufficient and I need equipment and utensils to serve my customers.” Her dream is to have a sizeable restaurant so that her customers are comfortable and regular. She wishes to expand her business by buying tables, chairs, and kitchen utensils in order to expand to a greater number of customers and generate more income. This is the 6th sequence of loans with the institution in the 6 years that she has had this business.

It is for these reasons that Aglae seeks a loan to buy tables, chairs, and kitchen utensils to serve a greater number of customers.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and kitchen utensils to serve a greater number of customers.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Ее зовут Сабохат. Ей 25 лет. Она из района Шахритус. Она замужняя женщина и имеет трех летнего ребенка. Сабохат уже 5 лет занимается животноводческой деятельностью. Она дома выращивает крупнорогатых скотин. Для ее семьи скот является источником дохода. Сабохат держится за эту работу, потому что за счет этой деятельности она может прокормить семью. Сейчас у нее осталось меньшее количество скотин и ей необходимо купить еще пару голов крупнорогатых скотов и сохранить бизнес. Сабохат видит выход из положения только в получении кредита. Она заранее благодарна за помощь, потому что знает, мир не без добрых людей и ей обязательно помогут.
texts.en: Meet Sabohat, a 25-year-old native of the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  She is married and the mother of a three-year-old child.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for five years already and she raises cattle at home.  This activity constitutes her family's source of income.  Sabohat wants to keep her activity because it allows her to feed her family.   However, she currently has fewer head of cattle than usual and she needs to buy two additional cows in order to keep her business.  For Sabohat, the only way to improve her situation is to receive a loan.  She thanks you in advance for your help because she knows that the world has a lot of good people who will surely help her.

loans.use: to buy a couple of cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale coconuts

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Ormoc City, Leyte. Gina runs a sari-sari store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Gina has been in the business for more than 20 years now.

Gina is asking for a loan to buy groceries like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, rice, medicines and others. With a loan, Gina will be able to improve her inventories, thus attracting more buyers in her store.  In the future, Gina hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy groceries like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, rice, medicines and others

loans.name: Dutanguyubuzima Group

texts.fr:
Ildéphonse  fait partie du groupe  Dutanguyubuzima et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 38 ans et est marié à Violette, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 2 à 11 ans, dont  3 étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce de chèvres   depuis  6 ans. 

Il est à son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de chèvres à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Ildéphonse is part of the Dutanguyubuzima group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 38 years old and is married to Violette, a retail merchant. Together they have five children from two to eleven years old, and of whom three attend school.
 
He has been trading goats for the past six years.

This is his first credit loan with Turame. He will use the Kiva loan to increase his working capital and buy many goats to resell, to earn more.

In coming years, he would like to ensure his children's education.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy many goats to resell, to earn more.

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.ru: Зулайка, 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Зулайки среднее образование, работу в селе найти очень тяжело, однако надо содержать семью и воспитывать детей. Поэтому уже много лет, Зулайка занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 5 овец. На участке мерою 10,0 ГА Зулайка выращивает клевер, подсолнечник, пшеницу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Зулайки составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и подготовку земли для посева. Доходы от кредита Зулайка планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zulaika is 43 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising five children.  She has a secondary education but finds it very difficult to find a job in the village, as she has to take care of her family and raise her children.  For this reason, she has been involved in agriculture for many years already, and she currently owns five cows and five sheep.  She also grows clover, sunflowers and wheat for resale on 10 hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy livestock and prepare the land for sowing.  She plans to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her herd of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy livestock and cultivate her land.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда в возрасте 26 лет имеет мужа и двоих маленьких детей. Сыну 3 года, а дочке всего год. Мавчуда со своей любимой семьей живет в районе Гиссар, недалеко от столицы. Ее муж рабочий, а сама Мавчуда является швеей. Вот уже 5 лет Мавчуда у себя дома шьет таджикские женские платья на продажу. Ее товар хорошо продвигается, поэтому она хотела бы расширить свой бизнес. Мавчуда на сумму кредита собирается закупить необходимые ткани для шитья одежд на продажу. Она нуждается в ашей поддержке.
texts.en: Mavjuda is 26 years old, married, and the mother of two small children: a three-year-old son and a daughter who's just one year old.  Mavjuda and her beloved family live in the Gissar district of Tajikistan, not far from the capital city.  Her husband is a laborer and Mavjuda herself works as a seamstress.  For five years already, she has been sewing women's Tajik clothes which she then resells.  Her merchandise is selling well, and for this reason, she would like to expand her activity.  She plans to use her loan to buy the fabrics that she needs to sew clothes for resale.  She is hoping to receive your support.

loans.use: to buy the fabrics she needs to sew clothes.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 50 years old and married with one child in school. Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, rice, beverages, canned goods, etc.

Lilia has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, rice, beverages, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Kora Group

texts.fr:
Suzanne  fait partie du groupe  Kora et  habite à  Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de  41 ans. Elle a 2 enfants l’un a 13 ans et l’autre  20 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce des habits  depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est son  sixième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup  d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  créer une  alimentation, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Suzanne is part of the Kora group, and lives in Bujumbura. She is a 41-year-old widow. She has two children: one is 13 and the other 20 years old, and both attend school.

She has been trading clothes for the past 20 years.

This is her sixth credit loan with Turame. She will use the Kiva loan to increase her working capital and buy lots of clothes for resale, to earn more.

In coming years, she would like to open a food store and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy lots of clothes for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Santi Pala Group

texts.en:
As a farmer group, the Santi Pala group succeeded in managing their crops during the dry season. The long beans, nuts, cassava, and other crops that need less water produced a maximum result. It is because of the diligence and hard work of all members. They earned a satisfactory profit after together they harvested and sold their crops to the big buyer. The head of the group, Wayan, had enough profit and decided to continue the business with his own money. He said many thanks for the support. The group choose a new head, I Made.

Facing the rainy season, the Santi Pala continue to have a new loan. Now they use the loan to purchase fertilizer, chemicals to spray the insects and also many kind of crops. Now is the right time to plant chili and corn.

I Made, as the new head, has two children, and both of them are still in school. His wife helps him to work at the garden. He uses his loan to purchase corn seeds and fertilizer. I Made hopes the harmony of the groups remain well and can help each other. All members of the group are very grateful to MUK and still expect assistance in the agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Las Minas Group

texts.es:
Un pequeño parque llamado Alameda es el lugar donde por las tardes se reúnen los habitantes de la comunidad para jugar volibol, fútbol, andar en bicicleta, patineta, caminar o platicar. La comunidad pertenece a una zona productora de caña por lo que las principales fuentes de empleo son el campo y la fábrica azucarera.

En esta comunidad se formó un grupo de 4 mujeres de las cuales dos de ellas cuentan con 15 años de experiencia en su negocio, una 2 años y otra 1. Los préstamos que VisionFund les ha otorgado ha sido el apoyo necesario para que sus minas de oro, sus negocios, sigan creciendo de allí el nombre del grupo conformado por:

Mirella -Venta De Frutas y Cosméticos
María Magdalena-Venta De Abarrotes
Alondra - Venta De Pollo
Guillermina -Venta De Cerámica Y Regalos

La señora María Magdalena es madre de 4 hijos, todos ellos independientes que cuando les es posible apoyan a su madre con su actividad. Ella inicio con la venta de refrescos, frituras, galletas y pan hace ya 15 años y gracias al negocio fue que sus hijos continuaron estudiando. María Magdalena también tiene un nieto de 2 años quien pasa todo el tiempo con su abuelita o "Nana" como él le llama.

María Magdalena inició su negocio con el firme propósito de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, comenta que al principio vendía una gran variedad de abarrotes, pero con la experiencia notó cuáles eran los productos estrella y ahora es en los únicos que invierte. “Soy muy feliz en mi negocio, me he acostumbrado a vender y estar activa” comenta doña María, quien invertirá sus ganancias y el préstamo que se le otorgue para incrementar su inventario. 

Además, un nuevo plan se va armando en la mente de María Magdalena: con sus próximas ganancias comprará aceite, queso, frijol, masa, carne, crema y verduras ya que pretende iniciar con la venta de antojitos para lo cual también necesitará hacer remodelaciones en el corredor de la casa de su hija. La idea de aperturar el nuevo negocio se originó de sus proveedores quienes siempre le solicitan que les prepare alguna botana o comida.

El grupo agradece la oportunidad de recibir un nuevo préstamo para invertir en sus negocios.

*La fotografía se tomó en la tienda de María Magdalena quien viste de blusa color azul. En la foto se aprecia un macetero de los que comercializa doña Guillermina quien viste de blusa roja, de igual manera Mirella muestra un catálogo de los cosméticos que vende. El pequeño, es el nieto de María Magdalena.
texts.en:
A small park called Alameda is the place where the community residents get together in the afternoons to play volleyball or soccer, to ride bikes, to skate, to walk or chat. The community belongs to a zone that produces sugar cane and so the principal sources of employment are the land and the sugar factory.

In this community a group of four women was formed, two of which have 15 years of experience in their businesses, one of them two years, and the other one year. The loans that VisionFund has given them have been the necessary support so that their “gold mines,” their businesses keep growing. The group is composed of   

Mirella – fruit and cosmetics sales 
María Magdalena – grocery sales
Alondra – chicken sales
Guillermina – ceramics and gifts 

Mrs. María Magdalena is the mother of four children, all of them independent, who support their mother’s activities when it’s possible for them. She began 15 years ago by selling soft drinks, fried food, cookies and bread, and it was thanks to the business that her children continued studying. María Magdalena also has a two-year-old grandson who spends all his time with his grandmother, or “Nana” as he calls her.

María Magdalena began her business with the firm purpose of helping her husband with the 
household expenses. She says that at the beginning she sold a variety of groceries, but with experience, she noticed which were the star products; now those are the only ones in which she invests. 

“I am very happy in my business. I have gotten used to selling and being active,” says doña María, who will invest her profits and the loan that she is given to increase her inventory.

In addition, a new plan is taking shape María Magdalena’s mind: with her next profits she will buy oil, cheese, beans, masa, meat, cream and vegetables because she hopes to start selling snacks. For this she will also need to do some remodeling in the corridor of her daughter’s house.  The idea of opening a new business originated from her providers who always ask her to prepare them a snack or meal. 

The group expresses its thanks for the opportunity to receive a new loan to invest in their businesses. 

*The photograph was taken in the shop of María Magdalena, who is wearing the blue blouse. In the photo, a flowerpot can be seen that doña Guillermina, in the red blouse, sells. Mirella is showing a catalogue of cosmetics she sells. The little one is María Magdalena’s grandson.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, fried snacks, cookies and bread.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 39 years old and has two children in school.  

Ludivina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ludivina requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ludivina has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain this. 

In the future, Ludivina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 27 years old and married with two children. Alejandra works very hard to provide for them.

Alejandra runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alejandra has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Alejandra would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pen's Group

texts.en: An old woman living in Battambang province, Pen is 60 years old and a mother of four children. For her living, she grows rice as a single source of her income. She has been involved in this business for ages, and earns her about 40,000 KHR per day. This is her ninth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family's condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies, such as rice, oil, legumes, vegetables, meat, and fruit to restock her business

loans.name: Khalqiz

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Халкиз. Ей 35 лет. Она проживает на районе Шахритус. Она замужем. Имеет четверых детей, две дочки и два сына. Ее муж, вместе со старшим сыном находятся за приделами страны на заработках. Дочка вышла замуж и живет отдельно. Халкиз живет вместе с сыном и дочкой. Они живут тем, что ее муж и сын отправляют им.
  Халкиз решила начать новую деятельность и стать независимой женщиной. Она будет заниматься купля - продажей скотов. Халкиз создала все условия для данного бизнеса, в том числе огромный коровник и запаслась кормом. В работе ей будет помогать сын. Чтобы начать бизнес Халкизу необходимо купить несколько голов скотов, но у нее недостаточно средств. Халкиз приняла решение обратиться за кредитом. Она купить скотов, начнет бизнес, будет источник дохода и конечно улучшения жизненных условий.
texts.en: Meet Khalqiz, a 53-year-old resident of the Shahrituz district.  Khalqiz is married and she has four children (two daughters and two sons).  Her husband and her oldest son are currently working abroad.  One of her daughters is already married and living independently, so Khalqiz now lives with one son and one daughter.  The family live from what her husband and son send them.  Khalqiz has decided to start a new business in order to become financially independent.  She will be buying and selling cattle.  She has created all the conditions required for this type of business: she has a large barn and ample supplies of animal feed.  Her son will be helping her run this business.  But in order to start her new activity, Khalqiz needs to buy a few head of cattle.  However, she doesn't have enough money for this purchase, which is the reason why she has decided to apply for a loan.  She will buy cattle and start her own business, which will bring her a source of income and will surely improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start her own animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Merry

texts.en:
Merry is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merry is 33 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Merry has a buy and sell used shoe business in the Philippines. Merry requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy used shoes to sell.

Merry has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Merry would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 62 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been farming vegetables for five years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is a woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Purita is 49 years old now.

Purita has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. Purita requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Purita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Purita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: God Fride

texts.en:
God Fride is 46 years old. He is married with six children between the ages of 5 and 19 years. All of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for eight years. With this loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for his children. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for maize

loans.name: Marzhona

texts.ru: Маржоне 26 лет. Она замужем и уже имеет троих детей. Маржона в течение 5 лет предоставляет услугу портнихи. За столь время она влюбилась в свою работу и хочет дальше продолжить работать в данной сфере и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Маржона просит в кредит для покупки новой модернизированной швейной машинки, чтобы улучшить процесс работы. Когда она создаст условия работы, Маржона будет выполнять заказы быстрее и качественнее, тогда у нее будет больше клиентов.
texts.en: Marzhona is 26 years old.  She is married and she already has three children.  For the past five years, she has been offering sewing services.  During that time, she has fallen in love with her work and she wants to continue working in the same field, which is the reason why she is taking a loan.  She has requested a loan to buy a modern sewing machine, in order to make the sewing process easier.  Once she has created new working conditions for herself, she will be able to fulfill her orders quicker and to take more orders.  This will also allow her to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en:
Heidi is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of three children, from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in a hog raising business. This is the source of her income.

Heidi is asking for a loan to buy piglets and animal feed. With a loan, she will be able to raise more pigs and sell them to the market after a few weeks. In the future, Heidi hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Ya Salam Group

texts.fr: YA SALAM est un groupement qui est composé de 5 personnes. Ils habitent tous ensemble dans le même quartier et font la même activité. Ils se regroupent chaque fois de besoin et font des tontines mensuelles. Madame Awa est la présidente du groupement. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans  l’aviculture. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans et demande ce montant pour acheter des poussins et de l’aliment pour volaille et ensuite les revend à ses clients. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières a part ses besoins personnels. Grace aux crédits de l’institution elle voudrait diversifier ses produits en achetant du charbon de bois pour augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ya Salam is a group made up of five persons. They all live together in the same neighborhood and have the same activity. They get together when needed and hold monthly tontines (savings group).

Mrs Awa is the group's president. She is a married mother who is active in poultry farming. She has over five years' experience and is requesting this loan amount to buy chicks and poultry feed. Afterwards she resells them to her customers. She starts her day at 8 am to finish at 7 pm.

She has no special financial burdens apart from her personal needs. Thanks to the loan from the institution she will diversify by purchasing charcoal, so she can increase revenues and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: Buy chicks and feed for poultry farming

loans.name: Noeurn's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Noeurn is 44 years old and a mother of five children. She can earn income to support her family condition via rice cropping on two hectares area. Moreover, she raises pigs to earn extra income. 

This is Noeurn's fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She leads a group of three members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for a harvesting fee to support her rice farm, and buy pig feed. She hopes that she can get more income from her rice farm.

loans.use: To pay for a harvesting fee to support her rice farm, and buy pig feed.

loans.name: Socrates

texts.en:
Socrates is 50 years old and married with eight children. With five children in school, Socrates works very hard to provide for them.

Socrates runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Socrates has been in this business for nine years now. 

In the future, Socrates would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Laliene

texts.en:
Laliene is 38 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Laliene is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Laliene has been raising pigs for four years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jacinta is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonora is 50 years old and has three children who are in school.

Leonora has a farming coconut business in the Philippines. Leonora requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Leonora has been in this business for one year. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Khishigsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Khishigsuren is one of our reliable clients and used each of her loans for its intended purpose. She renders a taxi service to local people for a living, and her husband makes explosives for a mining company. Their daughters study at high school. 

Using her previous loan, she finished completing her house. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to connect her home to a central system of electricity, so her family will live in a comfortable place where they could use electricity for cooking and heating, instead of burning coal. The burning of coal is the main source of air pollution, and its reduction in households will contribute greatly to clean air efforts.

loans.use: to connect her house to a central electricity system in order to avoid burning coal

loans.name: Bibihanifa

texts.ru: Эту замечательную жизнерадостную женщину с района Хуросон зовут Бибиханифа. Ей 43 года. Она живет в селе своего горного района вместе с мужем, сыном и дочерьми. Бибиханифа любит домашних животных и поэтому занимается ремеслом животноводством, который является типичной деятельностью для жителей сел. Вот уже 8 лет как Бибиханифа занимается разведением крупнорогатых скотин. Она закупает маленьких телят, откармливает их в течение пару месяцев и затем выводит на рынок на продажу. В этой деятельности ей естественно помогают муж и дети. Целью запрашиваемого кредита Бибиханифы является расширение деятельности. Она хочет закупить несколько маленьких телят, чтобы увеличить поголовье скотов и получить больше прибыли от деятельности. Этот кредит поможет реализовать ее цели и улучшить жизненные условия семьи.
texts.en: This remarkably happy woman comes from the Khuroson district of Tajikistan, and her name is Bibihanifa.  She is 43 years old and she lives in a village of her own mountainous district with her husband, son and daughter.  She loves domestic animals and for this reason, she works in animal husbandry, which is very common among the residents of the village.  Bibihanifa has been raising cattle for eight years already.  She buys young calves, fattens them up for a couple of months, before taking them to the market for resale.  Her husband and children naturally help her.  Bibihanifa is taking this loan to expand her activity.  She intends to buy several young calves in order to increase her cattle headcount as well as the profits she makes from her activity.  This loan will help her to achieve her goals and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy several young calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman, and she has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old, and all of her children are in school.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF, which she will use to buy more fish to sell, at retail.

She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell, at retail.

loans.name: Suta Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
Suta Pertiwi group is a farming group. They planted a variety of crops such as peanuts, beans, cassava, chili, corn and other crops. Although last season was a bit dry because of the rain that never fell, they managed to cultivate the land well and get the maximum results. They can repay the loan on time.

Now they are entering the month of December and the rain has begun to fall with high intensity. Suta Pertiwi group was prepared to start planting in the garden with plants in accordance with a high water content, such as corn and chili. They use the renewed loans to buy corn seed and fertilizer. Wayan, because he already has the corn seeds, used the loan to buy fertilizer and agricultural tools. He is ready to cultivate the land and is assisted by his wife. With proper land management, Wayan is optimistic that he will get the maximum results.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and agricultural tools

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa de 34 años de edad se dedica a la venta de granos básicos (maíz, arroz, frijoles) en el mercado municipal desde hace varios años, ella vive en casa propia con su esposo y con lo que gana logra solventar algunos gastos de la casa, Rosa esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de quintales de granos básicos para poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa is 34 years old and has made a living selling basic grains (corn, rice, beans) in the municipal market for several years. Rosa lives in a house she owns with her husband. What she earns help to pay her family's household expenses. Rosa is requesting this loan to buy grains in bulk to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy basic grains (corn, rice, beans) in bulk.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 54 years old and married with two children in school. Leticia works very hard to provide for them.

Leticia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, shampoo, beverages, rice, etc.

Leticia has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Leticia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, shampoo, beverages, rice, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 62 years old, married and has three children. 

Norma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Norma has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed twenty times in the past from NWTF to sustain this. 

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 49 years old and has four children. She is married, and two of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nenita has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy feed and vitamins for pigs. She has been raising pigs for seven years, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for pigs.

loans.name: Samoeurt's Group

texts.en:
Samoeurt lives in a rural area in Battambang province. She is 33 years old, and a mother of two schoolchildren. To struggle for her living, she grows rice and sesame, on two hectares of land area.

This is the second loan for Samoeurt with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has repaid her past loan, completely. She leads a group of four members now, to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for harvesting services, and to buy sesame seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide. She hopes that she can get greater yields from her farm.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting services, and to buy sesame seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide.

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr: DAOUDA est un promoteur qui évolue dans la commercialisation des produits de beauté pour femme et des produits à base d’Aloès Véra. Il est marié et père de famille, il est à son 2ème prêt et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des produits cosmétiques pour les revendre à ses clients. Il gère les charges et dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il s’active depuis plus de 10ans et commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 20h. A l’avenir il voudrait avoir un grand magasin de produits cosmétiques pour mieux diversifier ses marchandises et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi, il pourra épargner de l’argent,  construire une maison pour sa famille et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Daouda is an entrepreneur who markets beauty products for women and products containing Aloe Vera. He is married and a father.

This is his second loan and he is requesting this amount to buy cosmetics for resale to his customers.

He manages household expenses, his family's daily expenditures and his children's tuition fees. He has been in business for over 10 years and starts his day at 8 am to finish at 8 pm.

In the future he would like to open a large cosmetics store to better diversify his merchandise and increase revenue. This way he can save money, build a house for his family and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: Buy women's cosmetics containing aloe vera

loans.name: Soeurm's Group

texts.en: A mother of seven children living in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Soeurm is 30 years old. She grows rice on four hectares area as the main source of income, and grows sesame to supplement her income. This is her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay for a harvesting fee, and buy fertilizer and seeds. She hopes that she can get more yield than before.

loans.use: To pay for a harvesting fee, and buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sorn is 39 years old and a mother of three schoolchildren. To support her living condition, she grows rice on four hectares area as her main source of income. Moreover, she can earn more income via cassava growing. 

This is the sixth cycle for Sorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans wisely, to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay for labor cost, and buy cassava seed and pesticide. She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: To pay for labor cost, and buy cassava seed and pesticide.

loans.name: Poeurn's Group

texts.en:
A father of one schoolchild from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Poeurn is 37 years old. He can earn income to support his family condition via rice cropping, and it earns him about 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is Poeurn's fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has fully repaid back his past loans wisely, to improve his living condition at a gradual pace. He leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support his rice farm. He hopes that he can improve his farmland better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to support his rice farm.

loans.name: Mbaye Boye

texts.fr: MBAYE BOYE est un promoteur qui s’active dans la vente de la viande de bœuf. Il a une expérience de plus de 10 ans et  sollicite ce montant pour acheter de la viande pour le revendre. Il a un cantine à coté de chez lui et presque tous les voisins du quartier sont ses clients. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour les terminer à 20h. MBAYE gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il souhaite avec l’aide de l’institution  avoir une ferme pour mieux gérer son activité et à long terme avoir une autonomie financière. Ainsi il pourra augmenter le nombre de ses employés et épargner de l’argent.
texts.en:
Mbaye Boye is an entrepreneur whose business is selling beef. He has over ten years' experience and is requesting this loan amount to buy meat for resale.

He operates a cafeteria next to his home and almost all the neighbors in the area are his customers. He starts his day at 8 am to finish at 8 pm. Mbaye manages his family's daily expenses and his children's tuition fees.

With help from the institution he wants to own a farm to better manage his business and in the long run gain financial independence. This way he will be able to increase the number of his employees and save money.

loans.use: Buy meat for resale to his customers

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Ret, 47, is a married factory worker and has four children. She lives in Kampong Speu province, in Cambodia. She has been a worker since 2011. Two of her children are working as a factory worker and an excavator driver, and only one of her children attends school. Ret's husband is 49, and he is a construction worker, in a city. Together, they can make approximately $24 a day.

Their house is old, which causes difficulties in living during the rainy seasons. So Ret decided to obtain a loan, to buy lumber with which to renovate her house. With the loan, she will be able to have a proper house for her family’s living. Her plan is to support her child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy lumber with which to renovate her house.

loans.name: Nona Grace

texts.en:
Nona Grace is 46 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Nona Grace is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nona Grace has been in this business for three years, and also earns additional income from selling bananas.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Estelita works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Estelita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Estelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Vanissa

texts.en:
Vanissa is a married woman, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 32 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Vanissa has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Yem's Group

texts.en: Yem, a local resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is 44 years old and a mother of eleven children. For her family condition, she grows rice as a single source of income. She has been involved in this business for ages, and earns about 40,000 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her farm better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Rosa Ovilia

texts.es: Rosa de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos (queso, crema, quesillo, requesón) desde hace varios años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos lácteos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: 62-year-old Rosa lives in her own home with her husband. She has sold dairy products (cheese, cream, cream cheese, cottage cheese) for several years. Her business is run out of her home. She is asking for a loan to buy bulk dairy products to be able to continue with her sales and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy dairy products (cheese, cream, cream cheese, cottage cheese) in bulk

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en: Mr. Bayanjargal, 38 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting people between districts since 2003. His wife is unemployed and stays at home, taking care of domestic work. Their children go to primary school. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as wallpaper, hardwood floor and fiberglass, in order to repair interior parts of his house. After repair, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to repair interior parts of his house

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida has been an operator of a motorcycle transport for five years. According to her, she offers vegetables twice a week for additional income for her family. In addition, she also cultivates her 7,000 square meter of rice farmland. Generated income goes to their daily needs, maintenance to their rice field, and monthly payment to their electric bill.

Florida is happily married to a farmer. The couple has been blessed with six children. Three of them had settled for marriage, while three are already working. Now she would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 8,000 which will be used to buy new tire, gasoline and chain for her transportation business. She hopes that her transportation business will continue to improve through her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy new tire, gasoline and chain for her transportation business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Teresita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Chhunheng

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Cham province, Chhunheng is 48 years old and a mother of eight children. For her family condition, she earns income via cassava and pepper growing. This is the first time for Chhunheng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She wants to focus on her daughter education instead. Therefore, she is applying for a new loan in order to pay for the tuition fee for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in Biology. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduate.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fee for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in Biology.

loans.name: Anyar Sari 1 Group

texts.en:
The Anyar Sari 1 group can pay off the loan on time. During the past six months, the group succeeded in maintaining the pigs. Beside controlled by the Loan Officer, they also were visited regularly by the Vet. That way the pigs can grow well and have a good price.

Ni Wayan, as the head, is responsible for the group and the repayment. She maintains three superior pigs for fattening and sold out 6,000,000 IDR. So, for the net profit after deducting the cost of feed and the price of piglets, she earned 3,500,000 IDR for six months. She is very happy about that, and she hopes next loan she get more to improve her business.

Ni Wayan is the head of the Anyar Sari 1 group, which is located in the middle part of Bali. Although most inhabitants there work as farmers, as the Balinese women, they still maintain cultural to raising pigs for supporting the family income.

She uses her loan to purchase four superior piglets and feed. She keeps her plan to manage fattening pig. She hopes the price for pig stays high and she can earn a satisfactory profit.

loans.use: to purchase four superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace varios años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: 63-year-old Ana lives in her own home with her life partner. She has worked making clothing for several years. Her runs her sewing workshop in her house and she has many customers because of the quality of her clothing. She is asking for a loan to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, elastic, etc. With this, she'll be able to continue working and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es: Rosa de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: 53-year-old Rosa lives in her own home with her husband. She has sold clothing for several years and she uses what she earns from her sales to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to buy more wholesale clothing to continue selling and to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw wholesale materials such as: yucca, potatoes, bananas, oil, etc.

loans.name: Yasmin Claribel

texts.es: Yasmin vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de charamuscas, chocobananos, gelatinas, flanes, etc. su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas, leche, azúcar, chocolate, etc. par continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yasmin lives in her own home with her life partner and her daughter. She sells candy, chocolate bananas, jelly, flan, etc. Her business is run out of her home and she's done this for several years. She has a lot of customers. She is asking for a loan to buy fruit, milk, sugar, chocolate, etc. to continue selling, to earn a better income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit, milk, sugar, chocolate, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lotion, shampoo, hair pins and scissors, among other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: tomatoes, onions, chayotes, potatoes, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: Dionisio es un hombre de 52 años de edad que se gana la vida con su oficio de electricista actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, pero además se dedica a cultivar la tierra cosechando productos como: cilantro, cebollines, papas, etc. Dionisio habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él siempre buscando la manera de mejorar sus condiciones de vida desea seguir cultivando la tierra, pero al no contar con la liquidez económica necesaria para invertir en los insumos  ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: semillas, abonos, plantas, etc. Para poder seguir con su cultivo esperando contar con el apoyo de este crédito.
texts.en: Dionisio is a 52-year-old man who makes a living as an electrician. He's done this for 10 years. He also works as a farmer, harvesting products such as: cilantro, green onions, potatoes, etc. Dionisio lives in his own home with his family. He is always looking for a way to improve his life quality. He wants to continue cultivating the land, but doesn't have the financial means necessary to invest in the supplies. He has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to invest in: seeds, fertilizers, plants, etc. to be able to continue growing. He is hoping to have the support from this loan.

loans.use: to invest in: seeds, fertilizer, plants, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: seeds, plants, fertilizers and the necessary supplies to cultivate his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, beef, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 100 kg of corn and lime

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en: An old woman living in Kampong Cham province, Nak is 62 years old and a mother of five children. Nowadays, she can earn income to support her living conditions via fish-catching and rice cropping to earn extra income. For Nak, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four members to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a cast net for catching fish. She hopes that she can catch more fish than before to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a cast net for catching fish.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: San  Roque Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ROQUE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Angelica ella es soltera y tiene 31 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida,la socia tiene un restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
El socio que está pegado a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
 
Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
These members are part of the San Roque Communal Bank which is located in the district of Cusco in the Cusco province, department of Cusco.

One of the members is Maria Angelica. She is single and is 31 years old. She works at a restaurant in which she makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soup and chipped beef. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She's had this business for eight years and it's going really well for her. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is asking for a loan to buy products to cook with such as rice, vegetables and chicken. 

The member that was added to the group photo after the meeting couldn't come to the meeting as he had to work. The other members work selling chicha, selling handicrafts, selling groceries and selling food.

loans.use: to buy cooking products such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Von's Group

texts.en: Von, 59, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province and is a mother of seven children. She struggles for a living via fish catching and working for others for a fee to earn more income. This is the first time for Von with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a cast net to support her fish-catching. She hopes that she gets more fish to improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy a cast net to support her fish-catching.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kimsrou's Group

texts.en: A mother of six dependent children living in Kampong Cham Province, Kimsrou is 39 years old. For her family, she catches fish as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 38,900 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads the group of four to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a cast net to support her fish-catching. She hopes that she can catch more fish to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a cast net to support her fish-catching.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anyar Sari 2 Group

texts.en:
The Anyar Sari 2 group made their payment. The meeting was attended by five members; the other members had a religious ceremony at the temple. During the meeting, they shared their experiences. They can manage the pigs well because they give them nutritious feed and vitamins. The FO (field officer) controls the pigs every month. They also make voluntary savings and give this to the FO to keep it at MUK.

Ni Made had a satisfactory result. Her pigs grew healthy and big. She sold them all to a big buyer. Now she has enough money to renovate her kitchen. She said many thanks to MUK, Kiva and the lenders for supporting her business. She plans to take another loan to increase her business.

To increase the population of pigs, the Anyar Sari 2 group decided to take another loan from MUK. The loan will be used to buy superior or local piglets and feed and to renovate their cages.

Ni Made used her loan to purchase superior piglets for fattening. The pigs will keep for six months until they reach the maximum weight. Now the price for 1kg of pig is between 30.000 IDR and 35,000 IDR depending on the quality of the meat. Her husband is a farmer. Sometimes the income from farming is not enough to fullfill the needs of her entire family.  Ni Made must work hard to solve this problem. Ni Made hopes during this period she will earn enough profit.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets for fattening

loans.name: Marjorie Liliana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive la señora Marjorie, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores  de edad e independientes.  Su esposo es Ing. Civil.
Doña Marjorie es una mujer  muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante y contribuir con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa, allí prepara almuerzos y trabaja todos los días, ella varia el menú de acuerdo al gusto de sus clientes que a diario visitan su local, ya son nueve años que tiene este negocio el cual le permite ganar lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para la elaboración de sus platos. Lleva casi dos  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la seriedad del grupo. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for years as the city of Reales Tamarindos, the partners of Grupo de Crédito Alfa meet every fifteen days. This is where señora Marjorie lives, she is 52 years old, married, and has three children from this union who are over 18 and independent. Her husband is a civil engineer.

Marjorie is a fighter who likes to work hard to get ahead and contribute towards domestic expenses. She has a small restaurant in her house where she  works every day preparing lunches. She varies the menu according to the tastes of her customers who visit her location daily. It's already been nine years since she started this business which allows her to bring home her part for the well being of her family. She would use this loan to purchase food that would enhance her menu offerings.  She has been with Grupo de Crédito Alfa for nearly two years and she likes the seriousness of the group. Her dream is to continue going forward.

loans.use: Purchase food supply.

loans.name: Sami's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Kampong Cham Province, Sami is 38 years old and single. She earns income to improve her family's living conditions via rice cropping. Moreover, she can earn more income via selling grocery items. For Sami, this is her third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of four members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for labor fees to support her rice farm and to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can get a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees to support her rice farm and to buy more grocery items for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, nails, cement, sand and gravel to change the roof and put down a concrete floor.

loans.name: Casandra Anel

texts.es:
Casandra tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 5 y 1 año de edad, vive en el canton Guaranda Provincia de Bolivar.
Solicita el credito para la compra de lo necesario para arreglar  la tienda de viveres y aumentar la mercaderia, para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ella trabaja de empleada domestica y cuida niños en las mañanas y en la tarde cuida de sus hijos. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno para construir una casa , su desafio es la falta de trabajo y en su tiempo libre le dedica a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Casandra is 21, single and has two children, ages 5 and 1.  She lives in the Guaranda Canton in the province of Bolivar.  She is requesting a loan to fix up her grocery store and buy more merchandise.  This is so she can give her children a better quality of life.

She works as a domestic employee and in child care in the morning.  In the afternoon she cares for her children.  Her dream is to buy land and build a house.  The challenge she has is the lack of work.  She spends her free time with her children.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Willy Alemao

texts.es:
Willy, es un joven estudiante de SENATI, vive con sus padres y su hermano mayor. Sus padres se dedican al comercio de diversos productos, ellos trabajan de manera informal por lo que sus ingresos son mínimos.
Él estudia actualmente Control de Calidad Textil, y está cursando el 4to. Ciclo de la Carrera, anteriormente se encontraba trabajando en como desarrollador de tela, pero debido a los horarios de la Carrera y de su Trabajo, tuvo que dejar de trabajar para poder continuar con sus estudios, es por eso que está buscando el apoyo de KIVA para poder culminar sus estudios sin ningún problema, ya que estuvo a punto de dejar sus estudios por la situación económica que está atravesando.
El objetivo que tiene para un futuro no muy lejano es de tener su propio negocio de Taller de Confecciones, es por ello que está muy agradecido con el apoyo que le brinda KIVA porque es una gran oportunidad para poder culminar su Carrera con mucho esfuerzo y perserverancia.
texts.en:
Willy is a young SENATI student who lives with is parents and older brother.  His parents are merchants and sell a variety of products.  They work informally so their income is minimal.

Willy is currently in his fourth year of Textile Quality Control studies.  He used to work as a fabric developer but because of a schedule conflict between classes and work he had to leave work to continue with his education.  Therefore he is seeking the support of KIVA to finish his studies with no further problems.  He was on the verge of abandoning his studies because of the economic situation he finds himself in.

The goal for his not-too-distant future is to have his own sewing workshop.  So he is very grateful for the KIVA support because it is a great opportunity for him to finish his career with much effort and perseverance.

loans.use: To pay off pending debt and continue studying 4th year Textile Quality Control and set up his own sewing shop.

loans.name: Rubenia Euceda

texts.es: Rubenia de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y colocando piso cerámico, pero con lo que ganan no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros y comodos.
