texts.en: Rubenia, 36, lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  She has a small store set up at home which she has been running for several years.  She wants to renovate her house by changing the roof and putting down a tile floor.  But she does not earn enough to do this and is requesting a loan to buy cement, bricks, metal sheeting and beams, and pay labor costs so she and her family can life more safely and comfortably.

loans.use: To buy cement, bricks, metal sheeting, beams and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
La socia Corina se dedica al negocio de venta de helados,la socia vende helados de diferentes sabores como fresa,leche y chocolate,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de helados.La socia solicita el credito para comprar helados.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Corina has an ice cream business and sells different flavors such as strawberry, vanilla and chocolate.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and has been in business for four years with positive results.  Her dream is to expand her activity so she is requesting a loan to buy ice cream.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy ice cream.

loans.name: Phy

texts.en: Phy is a 32-year-old married construction worker with four children who lives in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She has been a worker for nearly ten years. Three of her children attend school. Her husband is 36 and he is also a construction worker. Together, they can earn $12 per day. Every day Phy and her husband go to work on their brother’s old motorbike and it always needs repair. Now Phy would like to request a loan to buy a motorbike to commute to work. With her own motorbike, she will be able to improve her traveling conditions and reduce repair expenses. For her plans, she wants to sell fish at the market instead of working as a worker. She also wants to build a new house and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Norma Marina

texts.es:
La señora Norma de 59  años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de moler maíz con su molino eléctrico, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Norma está solicitando el préstamo para compra de un motor nuevo para su molino, ya que el que tiene en uso le está fallando,  con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y dar un buen servicio  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Norma is 59 years old and lives with her husband and children in a house that the family owns. For ten years, Norma has had a business grinding corn with her electric mill. Norma lives in a community in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman and wants to get ahead. She fights every day in order to improve her quality of life.

Norma is applying for a loan in order to buy an motor for her business as the one she has is not working properly. With the help of this loan, Norma can increase her income and her quality of life. Norma is a new borrower and wants to work with Prisma Honduras.

Norma's dream is to have a good business, offer good service and, at the same time, create a better future with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras. November 2014.

loans.use: to buy an motor for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, carrots, green chillis, squash, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit drinks, churros, water, cheese, eggs, milk, sugar, beans and more for her business.

loans.name: Vet's Group

texts.en: A villager from Kampong Chan province, Vet is 29 years old and the mother of one child in school. For her family's living conditions, she sells construction materials as her main source of income and works on a rubber farm to earn extra income. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 36,400 KHR per day. This is the second cycle for Vet with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy more construction materials for resale. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Julio Edgar

texts.es:
Julio, es un joven estudiante, que vive solo con su madre ya que su padre lo abandonó cuando él era muy pequeño. Su madre es operaria de limpieza y hace todo lo posible para que su hijo pueda continuar con sus estudios, pero la actual situación económica por la que están atravesando, le impide continuar apoyarlo, es por tal motivo que recurre a KIVA en busca de apoyo.
Él actualmente se encuentra cursando el 3er. Ciclo de la Carrera de Mecánica de Producción, quien podía apoyarlo en el pago de sus estudios era su tía, pero ahora lamentablemente no puede continuar haciéndolo. A Él le gusta mucho su carrera, desde que era pequeño y siente que lo beneficiará económicamente, con lo que podrá recompensar todo el esfuerzo que hace su madre por él.
Sin el apoyo de sus familiares, él hubiera tenido que dejar sus estudios para buscar un trabajo que le permita reunir el dinero suficiente para retomar su carrera; es por ello que se siente muy agradecido por la ayuda que KIVA le brinda, ya que así podrá cumplir sus sueños de ser un excelente profesional.
texts.en:
Julio is a young student who lives with just his mother as his father left when he was very young. Julio's mother is a cleaner and does everything she can so that her son may continue with his studies. Her current financial situation, however, does not allow her to support Julio and so Julio has come to seek support from Kiva.

Julio is currently in his third year of a degree in production mechanics. Julio's aunt was able to support him in paying for his studies but can no longer continue to do so. Julio really enjoys his studies and has enjoyed the subject since he was a boy. He believes that it is a financially-viable career and that he will be able to earn enough to repay his mother's efforts.

Without the support of his relatives, Julio would have had to have dropped out of university in order to find a job and save up the money to continue with his degree. He is therefore very grateful to Kiva for the help provided. With it, he will be able to achieve his dream of being an excellent professional.

loans.use: to pay next semester's tuition fees and continue studying production mechanics.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en: Umedjon is a taxi serviceman. He was born in 1988, in the eastern part of Tajikistan. He works as a taxi serviceman. He repairs automobiles. His work consists of repairing cars, repairing guide screws and balancing adjustment, changing amortization of cars, etc. The clients are satisfied with his work. The main goal of Umedjon is buying a new automobile. To buy this car he needs to have some financial support.

loans.use: To buy a new automobile

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.en: Nasimjon is 29 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in south Tajikistan. Nasimjon is an industrious man and has his own business. Nasimjon has been busy cooking and selling sambusa. He has a working shop and sells sambusa in a local market. He cooks varieties of sambusa such as sambusa with meat, with potatoes, with pump, with greens, etc. He has worked this way for three years and little by little developed his business. Nasimjon now plans to buy a car for transporting sambusa and with this aim he is asking for a loan of 1300 USD to buy a car. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a car for transporting sambusa

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: In 2011, Vicenta learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. She tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Vicenta borrowed an amount to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer. This will give her farming income a big boost. Vicenta is looking for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Armanda

texts.en: A $1200 loan is offered to Armanda to improve her business. Armanda is 58 years old, and she is a businesswoman. Most of her daily income is from her store so she is still happy to do her business. She started by opening her business in 2006, with her own working capital of $400. She is going to add money to her principal amount to buy more additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as detergent, pens, notebooks, hair ties, clothes brushes, soap, toothpaste, perfume, lighters and other things to sell. It has become her activity so she is happy to do it every day. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods and she will manage her business with this loan. She also raises animals like cows, pigs, chickens, goats and dogs.

loans.use: to buy detergent, pens, notebooks, hair ties, clothes brushes, soap, toothpaste, perfume, lighters and other things to sell.

loans.name: Mahmadaly

texts.en: Mahmadaly lives in a rural area. He was born in 1978. Mahmadaly is married and has three children. His wife is a housewife and has been busy bringing up their children. Mahmadaly’s children are little. They are 1, 2 and 3 years old. Mahmadaly tries to offer good living conditions for them. He has been busy with animal husbandry during the last three years. He buys cows, feeds them for some months and sells them in a local market. Mahmadaly now wants to increase the number of cows he feeds and in this way develop his business. He is asking for a loan of 7000 Somoni to buy cows. He awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cows to increase his number of cows.

loans.name: Almida

texts.en: Almida is a hardworking mother of two children. At the age of 35, she is engaged in cloth and dressmaking supplies in the nearest store, and at the same time she continues studying her business administration course. Almeda is very thankful that Paglaum Cooperative trusted her with the money to expand her business. She applied for a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP with which she will buy an additional sewing machine and the rest will be used in fruit vending.  Almeda personally supervises her business even with her hectic schedule.  Almeda hopes and prays that her new business will grow so that she can help her neighbors be employed.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 39 years old, separated and lives at Solinog, Calamba, Philippines. Her child is in the first year of college. Her source of income comes from their “sari-sari” (mini-grocery) store and “carenderia” (small restaurant). She manages the store at the same time she is the cook.

She joined Paglaum MPC just this year because of the benefits given to members. She has applied for an amount to buy additional grocery items like basic commodities to sell. She looks forward to some day her sari-sari becoming a grocery store with a restaurant and videoke bar.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items like basic commodities to sell.

loans.name: Jiguene Bakhna 91 Group

texts.fr: JIGUENE BAKHNA 91 est un groupement d’intérêt économique qui est composé de 5 personnes. Ils habitent tous dans le même quartier et font pratiquement la même activité.  Elles se sont connues dans une fédération qui regroupe plusieurs GIE et qui ont pris leur destin en main pour lutter ensemble contre la pauvreté.  Leur présidente s’appelle salimata, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation  des fruits et légumes et a une expérience de plus de 5 ans. Elle demande ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter des fruits et legumes et les revend au marché de sa commune. Elle appuie son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 20h. A l’avenir, elle voudrait augmenter ses revenus en augmentant son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses produits. Ainsi elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jiguene Bakhna 91 is an economic interest group which consists of five people. They all live in the same neighborhood and have practically the same activity. They became acquainted through a federation of several economic interest groups who decided to fight together against poverty.

Their president is Salimata, who is raising her hand in the photo. She markets fruits and vegetables and has over 5 years' experience.

She is requesting this loan amount  to buy fruit and vegetables and resell them in her community market. She supports her husband in managing the family's daily expenses and her children's tuition fees. She starts her day at 7 am to finish at 8 pm.

In the future, she would like to increase her revenues by increasing her stock supply and diversifying her products. Thus she will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy fruit and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a widow with seven adult children. She is 68 years old and lives in Agunod, Plaridel. 

Florencia is a farmer and grows palay and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 35 years. She has requested a loan to purchase coconut land, as coconut farming will make additional income for her family. She has been a member of PMPC for seven years. 

In the future, Florencia hopes to harvest more palay and vegetable crops, and also coconuts.

loans.use: to purchase coconut land for coconut farming

loans.name: Mariama Sow's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est né  le 11 juillet 2008 depuis la mise en place du banc villageois. Les membres ont une bonne entente entre eux résultant une longue période de travail de groupe. Elles  vivent dans le même village mais il y a une partie qui vit dans les Hameaux distant de 3km.   Leur activité principale repose sur  le petit commerce et l’élevage de petit ruminant. Cependant elles font aussi la culture sous pluie.

Madame Mariama (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 01 garçons et 04 filles. Elle s’active dans le petit commerce de produits alimentaires locaux : riz huile de palme sucre thé et divers autres produits de consommation courante. Elle s’approvisionne en gros et demi gros au marché hebdomadaire de Diaobé où dans les villages environnant  de sa commune.  Toute fois elle  revente en détail dans son village et les hameaux environnant. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter en gros:3 sacs de riz, 1 bidon d’huile de palme de 20 litres, un sac de sucre de 50 kg  et quels que paquets de thé vert pour la revente au détail.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’apporter un soutien  à son mari pour améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
The group was created July 11, 2008 at the establishment of the "banc villageois" loan association. The members have a good understanding between themselves resulting from a long period of group work. Most live in the same village but some live in hamlets three kilometers away. Their base activity is small retail commerce and raising small livestock. However they also practice rain-fed agriculture.

Mrs. Mariama (standing on the far right with one hand raised), is the group's featured borrower. She is the married mother of five children including one boy and four girls.

She is active in retailing local food products: rice, palm oil, sugar, tea and other basic groceries. She resupplies wholesale and semi-wholesale at the weekly market in Diaobé or in area villages. Retail sales are conducted in the village and its surrounding hamlets. She has a good experience in this field of activity, having practiced it for several years.

She intends to use this loan to buy wholesale three bags of rice, one 20-liter can of palm oil, one 50-kilo bag of sugar and a few packets of green tea for retail sales.

Profits from her activity will enable her to help her husband improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy wholesale: three bags of rice, one 20-liter can of palm oil, one 50-kilo bag of sugar and a few packets of green tea for retail sales

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
Muhayo is 41 years old and is a caring mother of 4 children. She lives with her husband and 4 children in a rural area. 

Muhayo has worked for 15 years in a local hospital. She is a worker with good knowledge and she does her job well. 

She now wants to find an additional source of income and in this way to improve her living conditions. She is going to buy a cow in order to sell milk and milk products at the local market. She is therefore asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy the cow. 

She awaits your mercy and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Enelina Lira

texts.es:
La señora  Enelina de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, tiene casa propia, vive en una comunidad Trojes, al Oriente de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 20 años a la ganadería la cual ha crecido gracias a su experiencia.
Doña Enelina está solicitando el préstamo para comprar de una planta solar debido a que en su comunidad no poseen servicio de energía eléctrica, espera que esta inversión le permita a ella y a su familia poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Doña Enelina está contenta porque también sabe que estaría contribuyendo a la protección del medio ambiente al utilizar esta tipo de energía.
Uno de sus sueños es iluminar su hogar.   

Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Enelina is 30 years old, she lives with her husband and children in her own house. She lives in the Trojes community, in eastern Honduras. For 20 years she has worked in livestock farming and her business has grown due to her experience.   

Enelina is asking for a loan to purchase a solar power plant for her home because in her community they do not have electricity. She hopes that this investment will allow her and her family to improve their quality of life.  

Enelina is happy because she also knows that by using this type of energy, she would be contributing to protecting the environment. One of her dreams is to introduce lighting to her home. 

Trojes, Honduras - November 2014.

loans.use: to purchase a solar power plant for her home.

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema is 48 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, etc. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

Rema has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, etc.

loans.name: Mansata's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est né  le 11 juillet 2008 depuis la mise en place du banc villageois. Les membres ont une bonne entente entre eux résultant une longue période de travail de groupe. Elles  vivent dans le même village mais il y a une partie qui vit dans les Hameaux distant de 3km.   Leur activité principale repose sur  le petit commerce et l’élevage de petit ruminant. Cependant elles font aussi la culture sous pluie

Madame Mansata (debout à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. C’est une dame très dynamique malgré son âge avancé. Elle est marié et mère de 7enfants dont 6 garçons et une fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de savon traditionnel et d’huile de palme qu’elle achète au marché international de la zone, pour la revente au détail dans son village et les environs. 

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle va acheter 05 sacs de noix de palmiste, qu’elle transforme en huile de palme et  3 cartons de savon traditionnel pour la revente au détail.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer activement à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille en nourriture et la scolarité des enfants. Une  autre partie est destinée à augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The group was created July 11, 2008 at the establishment of the "banc villageois" loan association. The members have a good understanding between themselves resulting from a long period of group work. Most live in the same village but some live in hamlets three kilometers away. Their base activity is small retail commerce and raising small livestock. However they also practice rain-fed agriculture.

Mrs. Mansata (standing on the right with one hand raised), is the group's featured borrower. She is a very dynamic woman in spite of her age. She is the married mother of seven children including six boys and one girl.

She is active in selling traditional soap and palm oil she buys in the region's international market. Retail sales are conducted in her village and its surrounding area.

She intends to use this loan to buy five bags of palm nuts she will transform into palm oil, and three boxes of traditional soap for retail sales.

Profits will enable her to actively participate in managing the family's nutritional needs and the children's tuition fees.The remainder will go into savings.

loans.use: buy five bags of palm nuts to be transformed into palm oil, and three boxes of traditional soap for retail sales

loans.name: Tamba

texts.fr:
Dés son entrée dans le groupement, madame Tamba a fait preuve d'une femme déterminée dans la gestion de ses activités et a su faire croître son activité cycle après cycle. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 02 garçons et 03 filles. Elle s’active dans le petit commerce de produits alimentaires locaux : riz huile de palme sucre thé et divers autres produits de consommation courante. Elle s’approvisionne en gros et demi gros au marché hebdomadaire sous régional de la zone où dans les villages environnant  de sa commune.  Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter en gros et demi gros : 05 sacs de riz, 02 bidons d’huile de 20 litres et le reste pour divers produits alimentaires qu’elle revendra au détail.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’apporter un soutien  à la dépense quotidienne de  la famille. Une autre partie est investie dans le bétail pour accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Upon her entry into the group, Ms. Tamba demonstrated she was a determined woman in managing her business, which she managed to grow cycle after cycle. She is the married mother of five children: two boys and three girls.

She is an active retail merchant of local food products: rice, palm oil, tea, sugar and other basic consumer goods. She buys wholesale and semi-wholesale at the sub-region's weekly market or in villages surrounding her district. She has solid experience in this field of activity having practiced it for several years.

She intends to use this loan to buy wholesale and semi-wholesale: five bags of rice, two 20-liter cans of oil, and the rest for various food products she will then sell retail.

Profits from her activity will enable her to support the family's daily expenditures, and another part will be invested in livestock to increase her revenues.

loans.use: buy wholesale and semi-wholesale: five bags of rice, two 20-liter cans of oil, and the rest for various food products she will sell retail

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa es una emprendedora mujer de 69 años de edad, es residente de un barrio ubicado en Barranquilla, en su negocio de miscelánea ella comercializa libretas, bolígrafos, lápices, cartulinas, cremas corporales, fragancias, detalles, cosméticos, ropa para bebes y accesorios. Ella es oriunda de Rio Frio, en donde hace años comercializaba estos mismos productos cuando iba de visita a la casa de su mamá, pero a raíz de la muerte de su madre, ella dejo de ir al pueblo y de negociar.  Hace dos años motivada por un hijo quien le sugirió que comenzara nuevamente con éste negocio  ella tomó la determinación de comprar lo necesario para volver a comercializar productos, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará útiles escolares y detalles para fiestas.  Esta inversión es muy importante para su negocio, ya que podrá aprovechar la temporada escolar con un buen stock de productos.  Rosa es madre de siete hijos varones y una hija, su meta familiar es tener su casa propia y su meta de negocio es ampliar su negocio para vender más.
texts.en:
Rosa is 69 years old and an enterprising woman. She lives in a barrio of Barranquilla and at her miscellany sells notebooks, pens, pencils,card, body creams, perfumes, make-up, clothes for babies, and accessories. Rosa is originally from Río Frío where, years ago, she sold these same products when she visited her mother's house. However, following the death of her mother, Rosa stopped going to her home town and closed her business. Two years ago, after her son suggested that she reopen it, Rosa became determined to buy everything that she needed in order to sell her goods again.

Now Rosa is applying for a Kiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy school materials and party favours. This investment is very important for Rosa's business as, with it, she will be able to stock up and take advantage of the start of the new school year .

Rosa is mother to seven sons and one daughter. Her goal for her family is for them to have a house that they own; at work, Rosa wants to expand her business in order to sell more.

loans.use: to buy school materials and party favours.

loans.name: Koundo's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement   est mis en place depuis le 31 Octobre  2006 jour de son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent sont toutes issues du même village, elles ont également des liens de parentés de sang ou par alliance. Elles sont très solidaires les unes des autres et mènent des activités principalement dans le petit commerce.

Madame Koundo (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle marié, âgée de 29ans et mère de 02 garçons et 01 filles âgés de 6 mois pour le cadet, l’ainée 10ans et l’autre 6ans. Malgré son jeune âge, elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans le système des bancs villageois ainsi que dans son activité de vente de des denrées alimentaires qu’elle fait dans son village et les environs.

 Avec son nouveau prêt, elle désire acheter du sucre 01 à 02 de 50 kg, 03 bidons de 20 litres d’huile raffinée et divers produits alimentaires pour la revente au détail.

Les bénéfices du prêt sont prêt investi dans l’école des enfants, leur santé et la cuisine de la maison.
texts.en:
The group was set up October 31, 2006, the day of its inauguration. Women who compose it are all from the same village. They also have ties through blood kinship or marriage. They are very supportive of each other and conduct primarily small retail businesses.

Mrs. Koundo (sitting at the far right with one hand raised), is the group's featured borrower. She is a 29-year-old married mother of two boys and one girl, whose ages are 6 months for the youngest, six years and ten years for the oldest.

Despite her young age, she has a good experience with the "banc villageois" system, as well as selling food products in her village and the surrounding area.

She wants to use the new loan to buy one or two 50-kilo bags of sugar, three 20-liter cans of refined oil and various food products for retail sales.

Profits from the loan will be invested in the children's schooling, their healthcare and the household's cooking.

loans.use: buy one or two 50-kilo bags of sugar, three 20-liter cans of refined oil and various food products for retail sales

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
LA  ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL EL PROGRESO, ESTA CONFORMADA POR DOCE INTEGRANTES, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES CON  VEINTE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL. EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE SUS FAMILIAS, LAMENTABLEMENTE NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DÍA A DÍA PARA BRINDARLE UN FUTURO MEJOR A SUS HIJOS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE Y LA COORDINADORA ES MARÍA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA UNA PULPERA ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES EN CANTIDADES PEQUEÑAS COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZÚCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, FÓSFOROS, DETERGENTE, FRESCOS, VERDURAS, ETC. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNA DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. EL O OBJETIVO DEL CRÉDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. EL PROGRESO AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A  PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Progreso is made up of 12 members, who are responsible mothers and fathers with twenty children under their care. They are from Sauce which is located in the northern zone of the region. They are characterised as being hardworking, responsible and with a strong drive for self-improvement. In their free time the like to enjoy themselves with their families. Unfortunately, none of them were able to go to school because of a lack of financial resources. They are currently fighting every day to provide their children with a better future.

The group's coordinator is Maria. She owns a small local convenience store which sells food products in small quantities such as: Rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, matches, detergent, fruit drinks, vegetables, etc. The business is located in her own house and she works for twelve-hours a day, offering her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business so that in the not too distant future she can obtain a better income. El Progreso is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders provide people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua, allowing them to have dignified sources of employment.

loans.use: to stock her local convenience store and purchase products such as: Rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, matches, detergent, fruit drinks, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María cuenta con 37 años de edad y se gana la vida con su cultivo de productos como: cebollines, pepino, tomate, rábano, etc. Dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 18 años, por lo que gracias a su experiencia cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que buscan sus productos. María desea seguir con el cultivo de sus productos pero no cuenta con los insumos necesarios para ello por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: semillas, fertilizantes, abono, etc. Para continuar con sus cultivos.
texts.en: María is 37 years old and she earns a living growing products such as: spring onions, cucumbers, tomatoes, radishes, etc. She has been doing this activity for 18 years and thanks to this experience she has a lot of customers who look for her products. María wants to continue growing her products but she does not have the necessary supplies and so she has made the decision to apply for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: seeds, fertilizers, manure etc. to continue with her farming.

loans.use: to invest in: seeds, fertilizers, manure etc.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 28 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Trojes al sur de Honduras y se dedica al comercio de abarrotería, cuenta con más de 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.
Don José está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una planta solar ya que en la zona donde vive no hay servicio de energía eléctrica y espera que con esta inversión mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia, está contento porque también estaría contribuyendo a conservar el medio ambiente.
Don José uno de sus sueños es que su hogar este iluminado.
   
Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old. He lives in the community of Trojes in southern Honduras and he works in the grocery business. He has more than 3 years' experience in this activity.  

José is asking for a loan to buy a solar plant because the area where he lives has no power service and he hopes this investment will improve his and his family's quality of life. He is happy because he will also be investing in conserving the environment.

One of José's dreams is for his home to be lit up. 
   
Trojes, Honduras - November, 2014.

loans.use: to buy a solar plant for his house.

loans.name: Ever Alexander

texts.es:
El señor Ever tiene 30 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Trojes al Oriente de Honduras y se dedica al comercio de lácteos, cuenta con más de 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.
Don Ever  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una planta solar ya que en la zona donde vive no hay servicio de energía eléctrica y desea se le apoye para así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Don Ever uno de sus sueños es tener iluminado su hogar y gracias a este préstamo poder cumplirlo, también está contento porque sabe que estaría contribuyendo a la conservación del medio ambiente al utilizar este tipo de energía. 
   

Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Ever is 30 years old. he lives in the community of Trojes in eastern Honduras and he sells dairy products. He has been doing this activity for more than three years.

Ever is asking for the loan to buy a solar plant because where he lives there is no power utility. He wants support to improve his and his family's quality if life.   

One of Ever's dreams is to for his house to be lit up, and thanks to this loan it can come true. He is also happy because he will be helping the environment by using this type of energy.  
   

Trojes, Honduras - November, 2014.

loans.use: To buy a solar plant for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: DABA est une promotrice qui évolue dans l’aviculture et l'élevage des lapins. Elle a une expérience de plus de 4ans et demande ce crédit pour acheter des poussins et des sacs d’aliment pour volaille. Elle est mariée et mère de famille  qui gère les frais médicaux de ses enfants car c’est son mari qui prend en charges les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Elle commence sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 18h. le crédit l’aidera à augmenter ses revenus , épargner de l’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. A l’avenir elle rêve d’avoir un grand poulailler et ce rêve ne peut être réalisé que grâce à l’aide de l’institution.
texts.en: Daba is a promoter who has a poultry business and also breeds rabbits. She has over 4 years experience in this line of work and is requesting this loan in order to buy chicks and bags of chicken feed. She is married and a mother who takes care of her children's medical expenses, as her husband is the one who takes care of the family's daily expenditures. She starts her workday at 10am and finishes it at 6pm. This loan will allow her to increase her income, save some money and improve her family's living conditions. In the future, she dreams of having a large hen house and feels that her dream can only come true with the help of the institution.

loans.use: to buy some chicks and chicken feed for her poultry business.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: BABACAR est un homme qui habite non loin du guichet, c’est un habitué du guichet et il a plusieurs prêt. Etant à son 6ème crédit il demande ce dernier pour acheter un moteur d’occasion pour la réparation de son véhicule. Il évolue dans le transport, et à une expérience de plus de 20ans dans cette activité. Il est marié et père de famille qui n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution. Il gère tous les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il commence sa journée à 9hn pour la terminer à 22h. Avec le crédit il pourra entretenir son véhicule et épargner de l’argent. A l’avenir, il souhaite avoir deux autres voitures de transport pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Babacar is a man who lives near the UIMCEC branch. He is regular customer and has had several loans. This is his 6th loan and he is requesting it in order to buy a second-hand engine for his taxi which needs repairs. He is a driver and has over 20 years experience in his line of work. He is married and a father who does not have any relatives who benefit from the institution. He covers all of his family's daily expenses as well as his children's education. He starts his workday at 9am and ends it at 10pm. This loan will enable him to do some maintenance work on his vehicle and to save some money. In the future, he would like to have two more transportation vehicles so that he can raise his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
La señora Daisy es una persona emprendedora ya que con esfuerzo y desempeño a salido adelante, tiene 41 años de edad, vive con sus 3 hijos e hijas y su compañero de hogar,su actividad es la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar, cuenta con más de 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Doña Daisy tiene una buena clientela siendo estos vecinos de la misma aldea y comunidades aledañas. está muy agradecida con los crédito que se le han otorgado han sido de mucho provecho y tiene más amplio su negocio, actualmente esta solicitando préstamo para la compra de agua, refrescos, salsas, pan, huevos, harina, café, arroz, azúcar, etc. Espera que esta inversión le contribuya a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Doña Daisy su sueños es tener muy buenas condiciones de vida.


Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014
texts.en:
Daisy is an entrepreneurial person and with effort and determination she has gotten ahead in life. She is 41 years old, she lives with her three sons and daughters and her partner. She works selling basic family needs and she has been doing this type of work for over three years.
Daisy has a good clientele who are neighbours from the same small town and from neighbouring communities. She is very grateful for the loans she has been given and they have been very beneficial and she has increased her business. Currently she is asking for a loan to buy water, soft-drinks, sauces, bread, eggs, flour, coffee, sugar, etc. She hopes that this loan will contribute to better stock in her business, which will allow her to improve her earnings and to cover the family expenses and financial commitments. 
Daisy dreams of having very good living conditions. 

Trojes, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to buy water, soft-drinks, sauces, bread, eggs, flour, coffee, rice, sugar etc. for her business.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa es una mujer de 61 años de edad, casada, sin hijos, y su negocio es la pesca.
Ella es independiente, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Isla Suriqui’ que es una comunidad de pobladores que viven de la agricultura, pesca y la construcción de balsas. De clima frio y seco, a una altura aproximada de 4800 metros sobre el nivel del mar, y con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados.
Nicolasa es de tez morena, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que se dedica  a la agricultura, viven en una casa construida de adobe que cuenta con electricidad. Su negocio es la pesca en bote con red; su labor la realiza todos los días de la semana, 1 o 2 veces al día, hasta obtener su cuota necesaria. Para su negocio utiliza redes en sus diferentes tipos (agalleras, de arrastre, etc.), siendo las de mayor apertura las de uso diario, aquellas que capturan peces adultos, dejando a los pequeños para que cumplan su ciclo de vida (nacer, crecer, reproducirse). Su principal necesidad es contar con redes de pesca, estas debido al uso diario se malogran y se desgastan hasta quedar inutilizables. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella desea realizar la compra de redes de pesca por mayor, para contar con su herramienta de trabajo constantemente. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 50 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nicolasa solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pesca por mayor para continuar realizando su pesca sin parar.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a 61 year old woman. She is married and has no children. Her business is fishing.   

She is independent, patient, a good listener, supportive, strong, responsible and hardworking. She does her work in the community of ‘Isla Suriqui’. It is a community of residents who live from agriculture, fishing and building rafts. It has a cold and dry climate and an altitude of approximately 4,800 meters above sea level. its temperature varies between 2-12 degrees celsius. 

Nicolasa has dark skin and short stature. she dresses in the traditional style (hat, shawl and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymará and she speaks Spanish for the general culture. She lives her life with her husband, who works in agriculture. They live in a house made of adobe and it has electricity. Her business is fishing with a boat and a net. She does her work every day of the week, once or twice a day, until she meets her quota. For her business, she uses different types of nets (gill nets, drag nets, etc.). The ones with the wider openings are for daily use, to capture adult fish, living the little ones to finish their life cycle (birth, growth, reproduction). Her main need is to have fish nets. Because of daily use, they fail until they become unusable. Her dream is to improve her quality of life. She wants to buy fishing nets wholesale so she can always have her work tools. This is her first loan cycle with the institution for the 50 years she has been doing this activity.   

That is why Nicolasa is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets wholesale to continue with her fishing without stopping.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets wholesale to continue fishing without stopping.

loans.name: Ana Judith

texts.es:
Ana es una sonriente y entusiasta mujer de 61 años que se gana la vida con ayuda de su tienda donde oferta productos de la canasta familiar.
Trabaja exhaustivamente 10 horas por cada día de la semana y lo hace para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
Ana solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de grano y gaseosas para abastecer su negocio, trayendo variedad y calidad a su negocio, y con la ayuda de este crédito espera mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes e incrementar su utilidad.
Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones en las que actualmente vive.
texts.en:
Ana is a smiley and enthusiastic woman. She is 61 years old and earns a living with the help of her shop, in which she sells groceries and household goods. She works extremely hard, usually 10 hours a day, every day of the week, so she can provide for her household. 

Ana is asking for a loan in order to buy an assortment of grains and soft drinks so she can stock her shop and offer a range of quality products. With the help of this loan she hopes to improve her sales, increase the number of customers who visit her shop and increase her profits. 

Her greatest dream is to be able to improve the conditions that she currently lives in.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of grain and soft drinks in order to restock her shop.

loans.name: Jamer Gabriel

texts.es:
Jaime un sonriente, alegre, entusiasta, bromista, una persona que contagian a los demás de su buenas vibras y de su carisma. Se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria, actividad que heredó de su familia y que aprendió de su padre.
Con la ayuda de este negocio se gana el sustento para su familia que la conforma su pareja y dos hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad, ellos son su razón de sonreír y por ellos quiere mejorar su negocio, busca que estudien se capaciten y se conviertan en un futuro en todos unos profesionales.
Jaime solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como riegos, abonos, pesticidas, fungicidas, insecticidas, larvicidas.
Ayuda a este hombre, tu apoyo será vital para que pueda seguir luchando por su familia y mantener en su rostro
texts.en:
Jaime is a smiling, cheerful, enthusiastic jokester. He is a person who contaminates others with his good vibes and his charisma. He works in agriculture, an activity he inherited from his family and that he learned from his father.  

With the help of this loan, he will support his family, made up of his spouse and two children, aged 4 and 1. They are his reason for smiling and it is for them that he wants to improve his business. He wants to them to be educated and trained and in the future to graduate from college. 

Jaime is asking for a loan to buy materials such as irrigation materials, fertilizer, pesticide, fungicide, insecticide, and larvicide. 

Help this man. Your support will be vital so he can keep fighting for his family and keep a smile on his face.

loans.use: to buy irrigation materials, fertilizer, pesticide, and insecticide. His idea is to have materials to grow and maintain his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plastic awning, tables, chairs and a better range of products.

loans.name: Gloria Group

texts.es:
Fanny es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 1 año, y su negocio es la venta de empanadas tradicionales.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por el comercio informal en todas las áreas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Fanny es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio (al centro detrás, vestida de negro, sostiene un bebé). Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor está aprendiendo a caminar. El deseo de ayudar a su familia la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de pescado, comercio de cosméticos, venta de ropa de temporada, tejido a máquina, venta de muebles,
venta de edredones y confección de carteras de cuero, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de empanadas tradicionales. La empanada es una fina masa de pan, rellena con una preparación salada o dulce y cocida al horno o frita. Las más comunes con; de yuca (a base de yuca, rellena de queso o carne), de arroz (a base de harina de arroz), cuñapes (harina de yuca, con queso), masaco (plátano con queso) y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana en un horno en su casa para luego salir a vender de forma ambulante en mercados, ferias y plazas cercanas. “la comida tradicional es una exquisitez para el paladar, la comida de aquí es insuperable, los turistas no paran de comer durante todo el día…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un salón de té donde pueda  hornear y vender sus empanadas y atender a muchos clientes. Ella desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de mesas, sillas y diferentes tipos de harina por mayor, para dejar de ambular y vender en la puerta de su casa. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Fanny solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas, sillas y harina por mayor para vender en la puerta de su casa.
texts.en:
Fanny is a woman of 35 years old. She lives with her partner and has 2 children aged 10 and 1. Her business is selling traditional empanadas. She is a good mother and is entrepreneurial, generous, understanding, patient, a good listener, supportive, responsible and hardworking. She carries out her business in the southern area of the city, an area which is known for informal commerce of all kinds. The local climate is hot, tropical and humid with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35ºC. 

Fanny has a dark complexion and long black hair which is tied-back. Her mother tongue is Guarani and she speaks Spanish for business (In the picture she is at the back, dressed in black and holding a baby). She lives with her partner who works in construction and her children. Her eldest child goes to school and her youngest is learning to walk. Her desire to help her family led her to form a communal bank composed of people that own different businesses such as: selling fish, cosmetics, selling seasonal clothing, knitting, selling furniture, selling duvets and making leather wallets. They are asking for a loan to expand their businesses. 

Fanny's business is making and selling traditional empanadas. An empanada is made of fine bread dough with a sweet or savoury filling and baked in the oven or fried. The most common empanadas are: "de yucca" (with a cassava or manioc base and filled with cheese or meat), "de arroz" (with a rice flour base), "cuñapes" (cassava flour, with cheese), "masaco" (plantain with cheese) amongst others. She works every day, using the oven in her house and then goes out to sell her empanadas at markets, fairs and nearby squares. She says that "traditional food tastes exquisite, food from here is the best, tourist cannot stop eating it all day...” Her dream is to have a tea room where she can bake and sell her empanadas, tending to many clients. She wants to be able to make this expansion to her business through buying tables, chairs and different types of flour in bulk. This would enable her to stop selling at markets and at the door of her house. This is her first loan cycle with this institution in the four years that she has been doing this work.

It is for these reasons that Fanny is asking for a loan to buy tables, chairs and flour in bulk to then sell at the door of her house.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and flour in bulk to then sell at the door of her house.

loans.name: Alyda Yaneth

texts.es:
Alyda es una mujer hecha para grandes cosas, la separación con su esposo fue una de sus mayores pruebas pues había hijos de por medio y desde que paso dicho suceso tuvo que buscar alternativas para generar ingresos y mantener a sus dos crías de 9 y 17 años de edad.
Su creatividad y pasión la llevo a iniciar su negocio de salón de belleza, donde realiza peinados y arreglo de uñas, ha ido comprando artículos poco a poco, pero por su falta de capital compro artículos ya muy viejos pero que estaban a su alcance, y ahora que tiene la oportunidad de una entidad como interactuar que la respaldara buscara solicitar un crédito para cambiar toda su silletería que ya está obsoleta.
Su sueño es seguir generando los recursos suficientes para darles a sus hijos buena calidad de vida y que las empresas encargadas de la normatividad no le cierren su negocio por el estado de su equipo.
Alyda de verdad te necesita Ayúdala.
texts.en:
Alyda is a woman made for great things. The separation from her spouse was one of her biggest tests since she had children in the middle and since that event happened, she had to look for alternatives to generate income and support her two offspring, ages 9 and 17 years old. 

Her creativity and passion brought her to open a beauty salon business where she does hairstyles and manicures. She has been purchasing items little by little, but due to her lack of capital, she bought things that were already very old, but that were within her reach and now she has the opportunity of an entity such as Interactuar which will support her in her search for a loan to replace all the chairs that are now obsolete.

Her dream is to continue generating sufficient resources to provide her children with a good quality of life and that the regulating agencies don't close her business due to the state of her equipment.

Alyda really needs you. Help her.

loans.use: to update her furniture since what she has is in terrible condition.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola una mujer de 47 años de edad, madre de dos hijos los cuales ama y son la razón de que salga todos los días a vender ambulantemente sus libros didácticos, ellos le dan fortaleza y es por ellos que quiere superarse cada día.
Fabiola está consciente de que se avecina la temporada escolar y por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de libros y material didáctico.
Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá cubrir la demanda que se avecina, ofreciéndole a la comunidad una alternativa económica para encontrar sus libros.
texts.en:
Fabiola, a 47-year-old woman, is mother of two children whom she loves and who are the reason she goes out every day to sell educational books as a street vendor. They give her strength and it is for them that she wants to improve herself each day. 

Fabiola is aware that the school season is approaching and for that she wants to ask for a loan to purchase books and educational materials. 

With the help of this loan, she will be able to meet the upcoming demand, offering her community an economic alternative for finding their books.

loans.use: to purchase books and educational material since her business is an economic alternative for low income families.
